jobs.title: Embedded Software Engineer Machine Learning
jobs.description:
Embedded Software Engineer met Machine Learning kennis

Wat ga je doen?

Als Embedded Software Engineer Machine Learning bij 24Beta krijg je de kans om intelligente, zelflerende oplossingen te ontwikkelen voor een breed scala aan hightech (software) producten. Je werkt dicht op de hardware én aan de software daarboven. Je ontwerpt en implementeert slimme softwarearchitecturen waarin embedded software en Machine Learning samenkomen.

Je ontwikkelt robuuste, onderhoudbare en uitbreidbare code, voornamelijk in C++ en C, en waar nodig Python voor data-analyse, modelontwikkeling of tooling. Je past Machine Learning toe op embedded systemen, bijvoorbeeld voor signaalverwerking, patroonherkenning, predictive maintenance, computer vision of edge-AI toepassingen.

Je werkt in innovatieve R&D-teams en test jouw ontwerpen en ML-oplossingen op echte hardware, waarbij je rekening houdt met beperkingen zoals performance, geheugen, latency en energieverbruik. Of je nu geïnteresseerd bent in hightech, automotive, offshore, agrarische technologie, medische technologie of consumentenelektronica: bij 24Beta maak jij direct impact op de slimme producten van de toekomst.

Sluit je aan bij ons en maak het verschil met jouw technische én data-gedreven expertise.

Je werkt met de nieuwste technologieën op het snijvlak van Embedded Software en Machine Learning en draagt bij aan het bouwen van slimme, duurzame oplossingen. Tegelijkertijd ontwikkel je jezelf als engineer én als persoon, met begeleiding van zeer ervaren managers die klaarstaan om je te ondersteunen.

Je bent bezig met het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en testen van software voor microcontrollers en andere embedded systemen, met speciale aandacht voor ML-integratie, prestatie-optimalisatie en energiezuinigheid.

Jouw takenpakket bestaat uit:

  • Het opzetten van de software- en systeemarchitectuur, inclusief ML-componenten
  • Het maken van technische ontwerpen voor embedded systemen met intelligente functionaliteit
  • Het ontwikkelen van embedded software in C en C++ voor microcontroller- en embedded platforms
  • Het ontwikkelen, integreren en optimaliseren van Machine Learning modellen voor embedded/edge omgevingen
  • Het werken met Python voor data-analyse, modeltraining, prototyping en tooling
  • Het integreren van ML-algoritmen met hardware, sensoren en real-time software
  • Het testen en valideren van software en ML-oplossingen op target hardware
  • Het oplossen van bugs en uitvoeren van systeem- en performance-tests
  • Het optimaliseren van prestaties, geheugenverbruik, veiligheid en energie-efficiëntie
  • Uitvoeren van code reviews
  • Onderzoeken en toepassen van de nieuwste technieken en ontwikkelingen op het gebied van Embedded AI en ML

Onze missie

Een omgeving creëren waarin technisch talent floreert en waar duurzame samenwerkingen met opdrachtgevers leiden tot maximale impact.

24Beta is dé plek waar technisch talent en innovatie samenkomen. Met meer dan 40 jaar ervaring binnen technische software engineering bieden we jou als software engineer de kans om te werken aan uitdagende projecten bij de meest vooruitstrevende hightech bedrijven in de Randstad. Daarbij krijg je veel persoonlijke aandacht en optimale carrièrebegeleiding.

Embedded Software Engineering is een ambacht. Als consultant en engineer ben jij dé drijvende kracht achter innovatie.

24Beta is een snelgroeiend bedrijf dat jou de mogelijkheden biedt om jouw talenten te benutten, te groeien én impact te maken.

Sluit je aan bij 24Beta en bouw mee aan een slimmere wereld van morgen.
Solliciteer vandaag nog en bepaal zelf waar jouw carrière naartoe groeit.
Stuur je cv naar recruitment@24beta.nl of neem contact op met Pieter de Leuw voor meer informatie.

aFunctie-eisen

Wat we van jou verwachten:

  • 2–7 jaar ervaring in embedded softwareontwikkeling
  • Sterke kennis van C++ en/of C, en ervaring met Python
  • Ervaring met of aantoonbare interesse in Machine Learning, bijvoorbeeld:
  • klassieke ML-algoritmen
  • embedded/edge AI
  • signal processing, computer vision of data-analyse
  • Afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in een technische richting
  • Ervaring met ontwikkelprocessen zoals Agile/Scrum
  • Inzicht in ontwikkelprincipes zoals OOP, TDD, BDD, SOLID en GRASP
  • Affiniteit met hardware, sensoren en resource-constrained systemen

Wat jij van ons mag verwachten:

  • Een vast contract voor onbepaalde tijd en uitdagende innovatieprojecten
  • Een bovengemiddeld salaris
  • Aantrekkelijke bonusregeling bovenop je maandsalaris
  • Informele bedrijfscultuur waarin je actief kunt meedenken
  • Een community van technische software engineers
  • Onbeperkte mogelijkheden voor (online) trainingen en persoonlijke ontwikkeling
  • Aantrekkelijke mobiliteit-/lease-regeling
  • Maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding
  • Bijdrage aan oudedagsvoorziening volledig vergoed door 24Beta
  • Coaching: jij staat er nooit alleen voor

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime

Verwacht aantal uur: Niet minder dan 32 per week

Screeningsvragen:

  • In bezit van rijbewijs B

Opleiding:

  • HBO (Vereist)

Taal:

  • Nederlands (Vereist)

Werklocatie: Fysiek

jobs.title: Marketing Data Scientist / Analist (2-3 jaar ervaring)
jobs.description:
Bij Magpie Technology zijn we op zoek naar iemand die energie krijgt van data en marketing en met ons wil meegroeien.

Dat kan zijn:

  • een marketeer die wil doorgroeien richting data science, of
  • een data-scientist/analist die meer wil leren over marketing en marketing effectiviteit.

Je komt terecht in een startup en krijgt alle ruimte om mee te bouwen aan het allerbeste marketing effectiviteits-model in de markt. Bepalen welke marketing investering het beste rendeert. Dit doen we voor snel groeiende scale ups tot grote multinationals.

Wat ga je doen?

  • Je werkt aan echte klantcases (van scale-ups tot multinationals)
  • Je bouwt en verbetert modellen die bepalen waar marketingbudget echt rendeert, zoals Marketing Mix Modelling, Bayesian models & Machine learning models, Attributie & causal inference, Forecasting
  • Samenwerken met onze partners, zodat zij hun marketing strategie kunnen optimaliseren.
  • Meedenken over hoe we ons product en onze oplossingen in de markt zetten
  • Af en toe mee naar events en conferenties

Wat bieden wij?

Als we verwachten dat je week in week uit met ons werkt, moeten we daar natuurlijk wel iets voor terug doen. Dus naast salaris en vakantiedagen etc. kun je:

  • Werken aan mooie data & AI technologie binnen marketing
  • Veel vrijheid om je eigen rol en ontwikkeling vorm te geven
  • Snelle leercurve in marketing data science

Ontwikkelen op o.a.:

  • Python, SQL, dbt
  • Machine learning & statistiek (Bayesiaans, causal inference)
  • Data engineering & Google Cloud
  • Marketing dynamiek

Kantoor

  • Kantoor in hartje Rotterdam, vlak bij Centraal station
  • (2-3 dagen per week op kantoor)
  • Werken met leuke collega’s (wij van Magpie, adviseren Magpie)
  • Een plek waar je veel leert, verantwoordelijkheid krijgt en ook gewoon plezier maakt

Wat zou een goede match zijn?

  • 2-3 jaar werkervaring (marketing, data analyse of iets vergelijkbaars
  • Je bent proactief en vindt het leuk om zelf dingen op te pakken
  • Nieuwsgierig en leergierig
  • Je kunt goed uitleggen wat data betekent voor niet-technische mensen
  • Affiniteit met marketing en hoe data kan helpen betere beslissingen te nemen
  • Technische basis (of de motivatie om dit snel te leren):
  • Python & SQL
  • Statistiek
  • Machine Learning

En nu?

Fantastisch als je tot hier bent gekomen! Hou er rekening mee: wij zijn gewoon data engineers / data scientists. Magpie is een B2B-bedrijf dat volledig om het product draait. Alles wat we doen is gericht op het behalen van de beste resultaten voor onze klanten.

Dat betekent ook dat we geen recruiters of copywriters hebben die hier een perfect gepolijste vacaturetekst van maken. Dus: heb je vragen over de vacature? Of lees je iets en denk je: “wat bedoelen ze hiermee?” laat het vooral weten, we leggen het graag uit.Interesse?

Hoe solliciteer je?

Geen (AI-gegenereerde) motivatiebrief nodig. Maar solliciteer hier via Indeed.

Een CV + 3 à 4 bullets waarom jij denkt dat je een goede match bent is prima, dan laten we snel van ons horen.

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime

Salaris: €3.000,00 - €4.500,00 per maand

Arbeidsvoorwaarden:

  • Flexibele werkuren
  • Mogelijkheid tot promotie
  • Reiskostenvergoeding

Taal:

  • Nederlands (Vereist)

Werklocatie: Hybride werken in 3013 Rotterdam

jobs.title: IT Stage - Data Science
jobs.description:
Dit ga je doen

For this internship we only accept students that are studying at a Dutch Business school or university. Not already graduated students. You need to be able to include this internship in your current study.

We also accept English speaking students already living in Holland, but the text is in Dutch, translate with AI;-)

De stage vindt plaats in het Data Science-team, dat onderdeel is van de Digital IT-afdeling (IT). Ons team is divers, met collega’s van vijf continenten! Je werkt samen met zowel niet-technische klanten als technische collega’s. De afdelingen waarmee je samenwerkt, zijn de eindgebruikers van de modellen (Mass Market, Customer Operations, Enterprise, Finance of Technology).

Vanaf het begin worden onze modellen en processen ontworpen om in productie te gaan. Dit betekent dat je niet alleen een academische uitdaging hebt, maar je modellen ook echt in actie ziet! Bovendien hebben we drie collega’s met een PhD die je academisch kunnen ondersteunen.

Dit ga je doen

Als Data Science Stagiair(e) krijg je de kans om te werken aan echte bedrijfsvraagstukken en machine learning en AI-technieken toe te passen om inzichten en innovatie te stimuleren. De precieze invulling van je stage is flexibel en wordt afgestemd op jouw interesses, in overleg met je manager en academische begeleider.

Of je nu geïnteresseerd bent in voorspellende analyses, datavisualisatie, modeloptimalisatie of AI-toepassingen, we werken samen om een project te definiëren dat aansluit bij jouw ambities én onze zakelijke behoeften.

Jouw verantwoordelijkheden kunnen bestaan uit:

  • Verzamelen, opschonen en analyseren van grote datasets om waardevolle inzichten te verkrijgen.
  • Ontwikkelen en evalueren van machine learning-modellen.
  • Creëren van datavisualisaties om bevindingen effectief te communiceren.
  • Samenwerken met data engineers om efficiënte datapijplijnen te waarborgen.
  • Experimenteren met geavanceerde AI-technieken om Odido’s producten en diensten te verbeteren.

Welke onderwerpen behandelen we in het team?

Meestal werken we aan twee kerngebieden: Generative AI en het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor commerciële campagnes of klantondersteuning. Hier zijn enkele van onze grootste projecten (maar niet beperkt tot):

  • Voice-to-text Analytics
    We analyseren de audiobestanden van gesprekken met ons callcenter om onze klantenservice te verbeteren. De gesprekken worden getranscribeerd en vervolgens samengevat en gecategoriseerd met een Large Language Model (LLM). Ook doen we sentimentanalyse. Er is altijd ruimte voor verbetering in dit proces, of misschien heb jij ideeën over extra mogelijkheden!

  • Chatbot voor klantenservicemedewerkers
    We helpen onze klantenservicemedewerkers om klantvragen sneller en beter te beantwoorden. Hiervoor hebben we een intern Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)-systeem ontwikkeld dat informatie uit meerdere bronnen haalt om het juiste antwoord te geven. Een grote uitdaging hierbij is het meten van de kwaliteit van de antwoorden. In de toekomst willen we deze aanpak ook toepassen op een klantgerichte chatbot.

  • Marketing Automation
    Ons BestNextAction-systeem stuurt marketingcampagnes aan en gebruikt voorspellende modellen om het juiste aanbod, op het juiste moment, via het juiste kanaal, aan de juiste klant te presenteren. Een uitdaging waar we aan werken, is het personaliseren van de boodschap met Generative AI. We staan nog aan het begin, met enkele experimenten in uitvoering.

  • Credit Risk & Fraud Engine
    We hebben een fraudedetectiemodel dat beoordeelt of een klant die bijvoorbeeld een iPhone-abonnement afsluit op onze website betrouwbaar is of dat er sprake is van fraude. Naast het verbeteren van dit model, kun je ook helpen bij het implementeren van vereisten uit de Europese AI-wetgeving, zowel technisch als niet-technisch.

  • Workforce Forecasting voor het Callcenter
    Het voorspellen van het belvolume in ons callcenter is cruciaal om de juiste personeelsplanning te maken. Een mogelijke opdracht is het verbeteren van ons voorspellingsalgoritme en het vergelijken van de prestaties van verschillende methoden.

Heb je een eigen idee?
We staan open voor jouw suggesties! Als je minder geïnteresseerd bent in Data Science, kun je ook aansluiten bij ons Data Engineering-team, Front-end Development-team, Enterprise Integration-team of Data Governance-team, laat dat wel weten in je motivatie svp.

Wat wij bieden

✔️ Een flexibele en op maat gemaakte stage, afgestemd op jouw interesses en leerdoelen.
✔️ Hands-on ervaring met echte datasets en moderne data science-tools.
✔️ Werken met ervaren professionals met een academische achtergrond die je begeleiden.
✔️ Een Top Employer-gecertificeerde werkplek waar leren en ontwikkeling centraal staan.
✔️ De kans om te werken aan impactvolle businessuitdagingen die de toekomst van Odido vormgeven.

Samen zijn we

We zijn Odido, de nieuwe provider van Mobiel, Glasvezel en TV. En met bijna 2.000 collega’s laten we zien dat telecom beter kan. Want technologie is er voor iedereen. Waar je ook vandaan komt, waar je ook heengaat. Met Odido doet iedereen mee aan de digitale wereld. Dat is onze ambitie. Iedereen bij Odido bouwt mee aan een merk dat menselijk, optimistisch en vooruitstrevend is. Is dat ook echt wat voor jou? Dan passen we goed bij elkaar.

Hier staan we voor

Onze naam - je kan hem ook van achteren naar voren lezen - bestaat uit verschillende vormen. Die samen een eenheid zijn. Want dat is hoe we naar de wereld om ons heen kijken. Als een plek waar mensen, hoe verschillend ook, samen vooruitgaan. We zijn er voor elkaar. We kijken altijd wat er kan.

We vieren diversiteit en zetten ons in voor een inclusieve werkomgeving met gelijke kansen voor iedereen. Dat klinkt goed natuurlijk. Maar we laten het niet bij mooie woorden: bij Odido zijn we erkend Top Employer. Een bevestiging waar we trots op zijn.

Dit hebben we voor je

  • Ontwikkeling én uitdaging.
  • Ontzettend veel vrijheid en plezier.
  • Een stagevergoeding van 750 euro bruto per maand (op basis van 40 uur per week)
  • Een veilige & hybride werkomgeving.

Dit breng je mee

Sommige dingen leer je niet op school, de universiteit of uit een boek, maar bezit je van nature. Jouw kernpersoonlijkheid is nieuwsgierig, analytisch, probleemoplossend en proactief. Je vindt het leuk om met data te werken, patronen te ontdekken en inzichten te creëren die bijdragen aan slimme beslissingen.

Must-Have Skills & Kwalificaties

✅ Je volgt een HBO- of WO-opleiding in Data Science, AI, Wiskunde, Statistiek, Business Analytics, Computer Science of een vergelijkbare studie.
✅ Interesse in (Generative) AI, machine learning, statistische analyse en voorspellende modellen.
✅ Kennis van Python (SQL is een pluspunt).
✅ Ervaring met AWS, Azure of on-prem systemen (pré).
✅ Het vermogen om datatrends te interpreteren en bevindingen helder te communiceren.
✅ Een sterke probleemoplossende mindset en leergierigheid.

Elke dag leren

Bij Odido leren we elke dag, allemaal. Je bent zelf verantwoordelijk voor je eigen ontwikkeling. Daarom bepaal je zelf hoe, wat en wanneer je leert. We hebben meer dan 200 digitale trainingen waarmee je aan professionele én persoonlijke doelen kunt werken. Aan ouderwetse functioneringsgesprekken en beoordelingen doen we niet. Je houdt je manager en je collega’s op de hoogte van je doelen en de voortgang: jij hebt de regie.

Druk op de knop

Ben je net zo enthousiast over Odido als wij? Dan zijn we vast een goede match. We kijken naar je uit. Solliciteren doe je via de sollicitatieknop. Zo gebeurd.
jobs.companyDescription: Wij zijn Odido. Menselijk, Optimistisch en Vooruitstrevend

jobs.title: Experienced AI Engineer
jobs.description:
At ML6, we believe in using the full potential of artificial intelligence to spark innovation, increase efficiency, accelerate growth, and create lasting impact.

Our mission is clear: ensure that the next wave of technological breakthroughs drives progress not just for businesses, but for humanity as a whole. We bring AI ambitions to life.

As a senior, you take up a tech lead role on a per-project basis, and lead your more junior colleagues in both the technical and client-facing aspects of a project. Internally, you take a leading role in driving forward the company’s technical capabilities and client offerings.

YOUR IMPACT

  • Design & Build Innovative AI: Architect and implement end-to-end ML solutions, from data engineering to deploying sophisticated models (including TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Generative AI systems) and deploy them on all major cloud providers (GCP, AWS, Azure).
  • Engineer agentic systems and complex workflows using advanced prompt engineering techniques.
  • Guide Projects to Success: Lead your team's projects, ensuring high-quality delivery and translating client business needs into clear technical roadmaps.
  • Mentor & Empower the Team: Act as a technical guide for other engineers, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and coaching them to grow their skills.
  • Partner Across the Business: Collaborate with our sales team to explore and shape exciting new client opportunities, lending your technical expertise to the conversation.

WHY YOU

  • 4+ years of work experience with Machine Learning and software development, with proficiency in Python and Cloud (AWS, Azure or GCP).
  • A proven ability to lead technical projects and guide fellow engineers with a coaching mindset.
  • A degree in computer science or a related field.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with a talent for explaining complex technical ideas to clients and non-technical stakeholders in a clear, structured way.
  • Familiarity with MLOps principles and a passion for building robust, scalable systems.

We're actively building a diverse team with a broad range of skills and backgrounds. This job description is a starting point, if you're passionate about this role and eager to learn, we strongly encourage you to apply.

WHY ML6

At ML6, our 'people first' culture is how we bring innovation to life. We've built a place where we truly love working, and we think you will too. Here’s what you can expect:

  • Lead with Impact: Your work will directly deliver value to our clients and contribute to positive change.
  • Growth & Learning: We invest in your development with opportunities to work on diverse, challenging projects, dedicated learning tracks & opportunities and clear opportunities for advancement.
  • A Culture of Trust: Thrive in an inclusive environment built on trust and transparent communication, where every voice is heard and valued.
  • Rewarding You: We offer an attractive salary package and an optimized benefits program that reflects your expertise and impact. You can view our rewarding philosophy and offerings here.

Job Type: Full-time

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • 1011 EM Amsterdam, Netherlands: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Work authorization:

  • Nederland (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 1011 EM Amsterdam, Netherlands

jobs.title: AI Automation Engineer / AI Systems Builder
jobs.description:
Locatie: flexibel / hybride
Dienstverband: fulltime (32–40 uur)

Bouw jij AI omdat je niet anders kunt?

Ben jij iemand die liever iets werkends oplevert dan er een PowerPoint over maakt? En krijg je energie van slimme automatisering, data en schaalbare systemen die échte impact maken?

Dan pas je waarschijnlijk goed bij LUCRATIEF.

Wij zoeken een AI Automation Engineer die samen met ons AI-systemen bouwt die processen versnellen, kosten besparen en bedrijven slimmer laten werken.

Wat ga je doen?

Bij LUCRATIEF werk je aan concrete AI-oplossingen voor ons eigen bedrijf en een beperkt aantal klanten. Geen eindeloze trajecten, maar: bouwen, testen en live zetten.

Je houdt je onder andere bezig met:

  • Bouwen van AI-oplossingen met Python, JavaScript, LLM’s en machine learning
  • Automatiseren en optimaliseren van bedrijfsprocessen
  • Ontwerpen van slimme workflows (o.a. RAG, agents, decision support)
  • Werken met data: structureren, opschonen, analyseren en toepassen
  • Bouwen en beheren van n8n / Zapier workflows (webhooks, routers, data transforms)
  • Integreren met externe tools via API’s (OAuth2, rate limits, retries)
  • Inrichten van logging, monitoring en alerts
  • Werken met klantdata volgens AVG/GDPR (security, secrets & permissions)
  • Meedenken over wat wel en niet gebouwd moet worden (business first)
  • Systemen schaalbaar, onderhoudbaar en productie-klaar maken

Je werkt in een klein, scherp AI-team met korte lijnen. Iedereen die hier zit, bouwt.

Hoe wij werken

  • Lean & mean (geen vergadercultuur, geen onzin)
  • Focus op impact en winstgevendheid
  • Alles wat we bouwen draait in productie
  • Continu verbeteren (technisch én inhoudelijk)
  • Veel vrijheid, met bijbehorend eigenaarschap

Wat verwachten we van jou? (Must-haves)

  • Goede kennis van Python en/of JavaScript
  • Begrip van AI / ML / LLM’s en ervaring met toepassen ervan
  • Je kunt zelfstandig oplossingen uitzoeken en bouwen
  • Ervaring met automations (n8n, Zapier of vergelijkbaar)
  • Ervaring met API-koppelingen
  • Basiskennis van productie-omgevingen: error handling, retries, logging, version control (Git)
  • Comfortabel met JSON, webhooks en databases/spreadsheets
  • Je denkt in oplossingen, niet in beperkingen
  • Nieuwsgierig en continu bezig met leren

Nice-to-haves (geen dealbreakers)

  • Ervaring met LLM’s, RAG en vector databases
  • Kennis van PyTorch, scikit-learn of vergelijkbare libraries
  • Ervaring met cloud (AWS / Azure) en/of Docker
  • Affiniteit met processen, automatisering en businesslogica

Opleiding? Leuk als je die hebt, niet verplicht. Wij kijken naar wat je kunt, niet naar je diploma.

Wat bieden wij?

  • Werken aan echte AI-systemen met echte impact
  • Veel vrijheid in hoe je problemen oplost
  • Klein team met hoge technische standaard
  • Ruimte om te experimenteren én te shippen
  • Marktconform salaris, afhankelijk van je ervaring
  • Flexibel werken (locatie en tijden in overleg)
  • Meegroeien met een bedrijf dat AI serieus neemt

Waarom LUCRATIEF?

Omdat wij:

  • AI zien als gereedschap, niet als hype
  • Geen consultants zijn, maar bouwers
  • Snappen dat slimme systemen geld moeten opleveren

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime

Salaris: €3.000,00 - €5.000,00 per maand

Verwacht aantal uur: 24 – 40 per week

Arbeidsvoorwaarden:

  • Auto van de zaak
  • Bedrijfsfeesten
  • Dienstreizen vergoeding
  • Fietsplan
  • Kosteloos parkeren
  • Mogelijkheid tot promotie
  • Reiskostenvergoeding
  • Vrijdagmiddagborrel
  • Werk vanuit huis

Werklocatie: Hybride werken in 3454 Utrecht

jobs.title: Intern Data Science
jobs.description:
We are looking for a highly motivated Data Science Intern to support our Digital End-to-End (E2E) team within Global Supply Chain & R&D. In this role, you will contribute to advanced analytics, predictive modeling, and data-driven decision-making across our manufacturing, R&D, procurement, planning, and logistics processes. You will help turn complex datasets into actionable insights that improve efficiency, sustainability, and innovation across our global operations.


Wat we vragen

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or similar
  • Strong programming skills in Python and experience with data science libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn)
  • Foundational understanding of machine learning, statistics, and analytical techniques
  • Ability to manipulate and analyze complex datasets
  • Basic proficiency in SQL
  • Strong communication and storytelling abilities
  • Curiosity to understand supply chain and R&D processes and ability to connect data with business logic
  • Availability for a minimum 5-6 month internship

Wat we bieden

  • A unique opportunity to work on high-impact projects across Global Supply Chain & R&D
  • Hands-on experience in developing and deploying data science solutions end-to-end
  • Close collaboration with experts in data engineering, data science, and digital transformation
  • A learning-oriented, supportive environment with mentorship and continuous feedback
  • Access to internal learning sessions, training, datasets, and advanced tools
  • Internship compensation aligned with market standards
  • A potential pathway to full-time roles in Data Science, Digital, or Advanced Analytics teams
Vacaturetekst

As a Data Science Intern in the Digital E2E team, you will contribute to the digital transformation of our supply chain and R&D operations. Your responsibilities include:

  • Exploring and preparing datasets from manufacturing, R&D, procurement, planning, and logistics domains
  • Building predictive and statistical models to support efficiency improvements, scenario planning, recommendation engines and decision-making models
  • Contributing to dashboards and automated reporting for global stakeholders
  • Running exploratory data analyses to uncover patterns, bottlenecks, and opportunities
  • Helping improve existing analytical pipelines and recommend process enhancements
  • Presenting insights and outcomes to technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Collaborating with various teams to ensure your solutions align with real business needs

You will gain practical exposure to end-to-end digital initiatives that shape how our global supply chain and R&D functions operate.


Bij FrieslandCampina geloven we in een werkomgeving waar iedereen zich hun volledige en authentieke zelf kan voelen en in hun kracht wordt gezet om het beste uit zichzelf te halen. We omarmen elkaars verschillen en ontvangen graag je sollicitatie, ongeacht je geslacht, geloof, afkomst, seksuele voorkeur, leeftijd, beperking, of nationaliteit. Als wie wij zijn bij jou past, moedigen we je aan om te solliciteren, ook als je niet zeker weet of je aan alle eisen voldoet.
Ons team

For thousands of people every day, we are more than just a dairy company. To our farmers, our employees, the communities we serve, the businesses we work with and the people to whom we bring happiness, FrieslandCampina means something more. For them it's not just about what we do, but who we are.

We value talented people from any background who want to contribute to something bigger than themselves. We encourage all of our employees to make decisions that benefit our entire company. At FrieslandCampina we own our own career and act accordingly. We trust you to make a difference in your job and influence the bigger picture. Working at FrieslandCampina means you are contributing to a better world.

You will join the Digital End-to-End (E2E) team, a global, cross-functional unit driving digital innovation across supply chain and R&D. The team includes:

  • Data Scientists working on predictive modeling, optimization, and analytics use cases
  • Data Engineers managing pipelines, data platforms, and cloud infrastructure
  • Analytics Translators who bridge business challenges with analytical solutions
  • Business stakeholders across manufacturing, procurement, planning, logistics, and R&D

Our team values collaboration, and encourages scientific curiosity, experimentation, and continuous improvement. You will have a dedicated mentor and will play an active role in impactful digital transformation projects.


Contact

Berredina Cornelia Oosterom

BerredinaCornelia.Oosterom@frieslandcampina.com
jobs.companyDescription: We're bigger than milk and more than a piece of cheese. Every day we work hard to make a difference in the lives of millions of people. Bring your spark. Join us. Grow with us. #UnleashYourNature

jobs.title: Android Full-stack AI Engineer
jobs.description:
About Fairphone

Fairphone is more than just a company - we are a global leader in sustainable, modular electronics, on a mission to change the electronics industry from the inside out. Built on strong social and environmental values, we are a diverse and inclusive team from all walks of life creating market consumer electronics that make a real impact.

At Fairphone, you will find a supportive and safe space where everyone can be themselves, collaborate openly, and have the freedom to learn and grow - because that’s how we innovate and drive change together!

So… are you a proactive, self-motivated team player who loves taking initiative and bringing positive energy? Do you thrive in a fast-moving start-up or scale-up environment? Are you a great communicator who values collaboration and embraces different perspectives? And most importantly, do you feel a strong connection to Fairphone’s mission and values? If you're nodding along and thinking, “Yes, that’s me!”, then check out our vacancy below!

Please know that we acknowledge that we are living in a time where the use of AI can bring many efficiencies and support. However, we want to know the real YOU. Please try to limit the use of AI tools to generate answers to the application; we value authenticity and encourage you to use your creativity!

  • Location: Amsterdam (you should have the right to work in the Netherlands)

  • Hours: 32-40 hours per week

  • Contract duration: 6 months

  • Deadline to apply: We review applications on a rolling basis. Please apply as soon as possible.

About your role

This is a unique opportunity to join our Software Engineering team, where you will be instrumental in developing cutting-edge, full-stack predictive maintenance features for our acclaimed mobile phones. You will drive the creation of sophisticated, data-driven systems designed to preemptively detect and mitigate hardware or software issues. This role signifies a critical strategic shift for Fairphone, moving the maintenance paradigm from reactive fixing to proactive, intelligent intervention, which will directly enhance the longevity and reliability of Fairphone devices, contributing measurably to our mission of building a more sustainable future for mobile technology.

Your profile


  • You feel a strong and intrinsic connection with Fairphone’s vision, mission and values.

  • You are hands-on, take initiative and see opportunities where others see issues, and apply them via constructive, creative thinking.

  • You love technical challenges.

  • You embrace diversity in thoughts, opinions, levels of seniority and backgrounds and feel good working with many nationalities in a multicultural environment.

  • You are passionate about improving the quality of our software. A small fix delivered to many people has a big impact.

Key Responsibilities & Objectives

  • Designing and developing new features for predictive maintenance for the Android platform to anticipate hardware failures (e.g., battery degradation, storage corruption, overheating), software glitches, or performance bottlenecks.

  • Architect, implement, and maintain the end-to-end stack—from the device kernel (data acquisition) to the cloud (model training/serving) and the Android application (user feedback/alerts).

  • Utilise real-time device data, advanced analytics, and machine learning models to accurately anticipate potential failures, degradation, or performance bottlenecks before they impact the user experience.

  • Take ownership of both the Android (Frontend) components, including user-facing predictive diagnostics and actionable insights, and the Backend infrastructure (Microservices) necessary for large-scale data ingestion, model serving, and continuous learning.

  • Clean and manage large datasets for model training.

  • Version, track, package, and deploy models into a production environment, treating ML models as first-class citizens in a CI/CD pipeline.

  • Unit and integration testing code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability.

  • Bug fixing and improving application performance.

  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.

  • Working with data sources and APIs.

  • Continuously discovering, evaluating, and implementing new technologies to maximise development efficiency.

Your Skills & Experience

  • Proven software development experience in Android front-end and back-end development.

  • You are a programmer and are comfortable with Kotlin.

  • You know about Compose.

  • Deep knowledge of the Android SDK.

  • Experience with working on Android framework and server-side technologies with Spring Framework.

  • Theoretical and practical knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms, Deep Learning concepts, and Neural Network Architectures.

  • Familiarity with major AI/ML Frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.

  • Experience with Large Language Models (LLMs), including using and integrating APIs, and applying techniques like Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)

  • You have experience/knowledge with working in an agile environment.

  • You have experience/knowledge working with software development tools such as Git, Gerrit, Gitlab and Jenkins.

  • Excellent debugging skills to solve challenging problems.

  • Experience working with remote data via REST, JSON and XML.

  • Experience with third-party libraries and APIs.

  • A solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle.

  • You appreciate Free and Open Source software and want to collaborate with the community.

What Fairphone can offer you?

  • The opportunity to create an impact on the electronics industry around the world.

  • A diverse work environment full of international, passionate, warm-hearted team members.

  • 25 paid holidays per year (based on a full-time contract) next to the other public holidays in the Netherlands. You’ll also get a day off on your birthday! Additionally, the longer you stay, the more holidays you get!

  • Daily, healthy lunch, organic FairChain coffee, and many more tasty things.

  • You will join Fairphone’s collective pension scheme, and we will contribute to building your pension.

  • You will receive a MacBook, Fairbuds, and a Fairphone as working devices.

  • Hybrid working model - We are remote-friendly, and you can work up to 60% of your time per month from home or any other location you want. We also contribute up to €250 for your home office set-up.

  • Public transport allowance – we fully cover your 2nd class commute from your home to the office

  • Bike allowance – We support you with a bike purchase of up to €300, and you’ll also have a yearly repair budget of up to €100! We also cover 23 cents per km for your biking distance from home to the office (or train station) and back!

  • Grow with us! We encourage you to develop at Fairphone. That’s why we’ll support your career goals with coaching (Inuka), trainings, workshops, or courses that you can join with your development budget.

  • Kitchen with beautiful views to the IJ waterfront.

  • There’s a gym and recreation and yoga rooms in the building where you can build healthy habits, stay active and have fun with your colleagues, as well as a subscription to our mental & physical well-being services (Inuka & Urban Sports)

About us

DEI @Fairphone

At Fairphone, we care about people, planet and you. It’s natural that we see diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) as an essential part of how we work together and do business.


We support and further strengthen our inclusive work environment and culture by more formally implementing various DEI efforts to ensure all Fairphoners feel included, respected, and supported.

jobs.title: Junior Data & AI Engineer (Dutch required)
jobs.description:
Ben jij (bijna) afgestudeerd en klaar voor de volgende stap in je carrière? Vraag jij je af: “What’s next?”
Wil je niet alleen blijven hangen in theorie, maar jouw kennis écht toepassen in de praktijk? Dan is ons Data Traineeship jouw ideale start.

Bij ons krijg je geen standaard traineeship, maar een intensief leertraject waarin je in korte tijd enorme stappen zet. Je ontwikkelt je zowel technisch als persoonlijk en leert hoe je de theorie uit je studie vertaalt naar concrete oplossingen voor echte businessvraagstukken. Zo leg je een stevige basis voor een succesvolle carrière in data en AI.


Wat ga je doen?


Tijdens het traineeship start je met een intensieve ontwikkelfase van 4 weken, waarin leren en doen centraal staan.

Je ontwikkelt hard skills zoals:

  • Python

  • SQL

  • Machine Learning

  • Power BI

Tegelijk werk je aan soft skills zoals:

  • Communicatie

  • Samenwerken

  • Presenteren

  • Professioneel handelen


Samen met je medetrainees werk je aan een gezamenlijke praktijkopdracht, waarin je alles wat je leert direct toepast. Zo maak je de overstap van theorie naar praktijk vanaf dag één.

Na deze ontwikkelfase ga je aan de slag bij één van onze klanten. Hier werk je mee aan echte data-vraagstukken, zoals analyses, dashboards, datamodellering en rapportages. Je staat er nooit alleen voor: je wordt begeleid door een Talent Manager die jou helpt het maximale uit jezelf te halen.


Je kunt instromen in rollen zoals:

  • Data Engineer

  • Data Scientist

  • AI Engineer

  • Data Analyst

  • Business Intelligence Specialist

  • Machine Learning Specialist


Binnen één jaar groei je door tot een volwaardig Data Expert.


Wat krijg je ervoor terug?


Wij zorgen ervoor dat jij je volledig kunt focussen op leren, groeien en presteren:


  • Direct een vast contract

  • Startsalaris €2.600 €3.300 binnen één jaar

  • Bonus bij start van je opdracht

  • 25 vakantiedagen + 8% vakantiegeld

  • Thuiswerkvergoeding €50,- per maand

  • Vitaliteitsbudget €30,- per maand

  • Meerdere momenten per jaar salarisgroei

  • Pensioen via STIPP + aanvullende verzekering

  • NS-Businesscard

  • Laptop + volledige thuiswerkset

  • Hybride en remote werken mogelijk

  • Uitgebreid ontwikkelpad (technisch en soft skills)

  • Terugkomdagen, borrels en teamuitjes

  • Evenementen met medetrainees en senior consultants

  • Vanaf dag 1 betaald om te leren


Interesse of vragen?

Neem contact op met onze Recruiter Nikita.

Nikita.Cavadino@veneficus.nl

jobs.title: Senior AI Architect - Telecommunicatie
jobs.description:
Position Description:

(Note: This job posting is only open to native level or near-native level Dutch speakers. If you are not proficient in Dutch, please have a look at our other job postings instead!)
Spreek jij native of near-native Nederlands? Lees dan verder!

Ben jij een strategische denker met diepe technische kennis van AI, LLM’s, machine learning en cloudplatformen? Wil jij organisaties helpen om AI op schaal te ontwerpen, integreren en veilig te implementeren? Dan is deze rol als Senior AI Architect precies voor jou!

Jouw rol in ons team
Als AI Architect ben jij de visionair én technisch leider achter belangrijke AI-initiatieven. Je ontwerpt end-to-end AI-architecturen, bepaalt de technologische richting en zorgt dat AI-, ML- en LLM-oplossingen veilig, schaalbaar en betrouwbaar worden gebouwd.
In jouw rol werk je op het snijvlak van business, technologie en data. Je adviseert stakeholders, begeleidt teams en vertaalt complexe vraagstukken naar robuuste AI-architecturen die waarde leveren. Je bouwt mee aan enterprise AI-platformen en helpt de organisatie volwassen te worden in verantwoord, data-gedreven werken.

Wat ga je doen?
  • Ontwerpen van Enterprise AI-architecturen, inclusief LLM-, ML-, NLP- en automatiseringsoplossingen.
  • Opstellen van AI- en data-architectuurprincipes, kaders en best practices om AI schaalbaar en veilig uit te rollen.
  • Leiden van de technische AI-strategie en roadmap; bepalen van technologiekeuzes, platformstandaarden en integraties.
  • Vertalen van businessdoelen naar technische AI-oplossingen en referentiearchitecturen.
  • Samenwerken met data engineers, MLOps-teams, securityspecialisten en productteams om AI van POC naar productie te brengen.
  • Waarborgen van compliance (AVG), security, governance en ethische AI-richtlijnen.
  • Ontwerpen en implementeren van MLOps-/LLMOps-processen voor deployment, monitoring, lifecycle management en continuous improvement.
  • Evalueren van nieuwe AI-technologieën, frameworks en Cloud services, en advies geven over vendorselectie.
  • Coachen van engineers, data scientists en AI-specialisten binnen projecten of teams.
  • Sparren met leiders, architecten en C-level stakeholders over AI-strategie, risico’s en waardecreatie.

Wat breng je mee?
  • Je hebt een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in AI, Informatica, Data Science of een verwant vakgebied.
  • Minimaal 5–8 jaar ervaring binnen AI-, ML- of data-architectuur (senior) of ervaring met AI-architectuur én aansturen van teams (manager).
  • Diepgaande kennis van AI/ML-concepten, LLM’s, GenAI, NLP, vector databases en retrieval augmented generation (RAG).
  • Sterke technische ervaring met Cloud platformen zoals Azure, AWS of GCP (ML-, AI- en data services).
  • Vaardig in Python of vergelijkbare talen, inclusief ML/AI-frameworks (bijv. PyTorch, TensorFlow).
  • Ervaring met MLOps/LLMOps, CI/CD, feature stores, model registries en geautomatiseerde pipelines.
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden en in staat om complexe AI-concepten helder uit te leggen.
  • Je kunt schakelen tussen strategisch denken en hands-on architectuurwerk.
  • Ervaring met Enterprise-omgevingen, security-by-design en data governance is een grote pré.

Wat typeert jou?
Je bent nieuwsgierig, vernieuwend en hebt een sterke visie op de toekomst van AI. Je ziet kansen, durft richting te bepalen en krijgt mensen mee in verandering. Je combineert technische diepgang met leiderschap en weet hoe je AI-oplossingen schaalbaar, veilig en waardevol maakt.

Wat bieden wij?
  • Een sleutelrol in de vormgeving van onze Enterprise AI-strategie en -architectuur.
  • Mogelijkheid om innovatieve AI-technologieën en LLM’s op schaal te implementeren.
  • Veel vrijheid om te bouwen, experimenteren en te innoveren.
  • Ruimte om teams te coachen, leiderschap te tonen en de AI-richting te bepalen.
  • Hybride werken, flexibele werktijden en uitstekende doorgroeimogelijkheden.
  • Een ambitieuze werkomgeving waar AI-topprioriteit is.

Waarom CGI
CGI is één van 's werelds grootste IT-consultancy bedrijven en speelt een grote rol in sectoren zoals Overheid, finance, lucht- en ruimtevaart, infrastructurele organisaties, telecom, retail sector en energie- en productiebedrijven. Bij ons werk je niet alleen aan innovatieve projecten, maar ook aan je eigen toekomst.

  • Werken in kleine, zelfsturende teams met experts in jouw vakgebied.
  • Direct een vast contract en een uitstekend salaris.
  • Flexibele werktijden en parttime mogelijkheden.
  • Ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en de regie over je eigen carrière.
  • Werken met de nieuwste technologieën.
  • De mogelijkheid om aandeelhouder te worden van CGI.
Bij CGI geloven we in diversiteit en inclusie, omdat dit leidt tot betere samenwerking en innovatie. We kijken uit naar jouw bijdrage aan ons team!

Sluit je aan bij ons team van experts en solliciteer direct!
We nemen dan zo snel mogelijk contact met je op! Heb je nog vragen over de inhoud van de vacature, stel ze aan Director Consulting Services Roxanne Krijsman via roxanne.kruijsman@cgi.com Vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure? Neem contact op met Recruitment Business Partner Natrah Pula via 06 11218723 of via Natrah.pula@cgi.com.

We werken niet samen met externe recruitment bureau’s. Acquisitie wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.

#LI-SP4

What you can expect from us:

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

In 1976 opgericht als een familiebedrijf, is CGI vandaag de dag een van de grootste onafhankelijke zakelijke en ICT-dienstverleners ter wereld. Bij ons draait het om ownership, teamwork en respect. Je krijgt de ruimte om al je talenten volledig te ontplooien.

Vanaf je eerste werkdag ben je mede-eigenaar van CGI. We profiteren samen van ons succes en je krijgt de kans én verantwoordelijkheid om actief bij te dragen aan de koers en strategie van ons bedrijf.

Jouw inzet voegt waarde toe. Je werkt aan innovatieve oplossingen en bouwt aan je netwerk van collega's en klanten. Je hebt toegang tot wereldwijde kansen om je ideeën te realiseren, mogelijkheden te benutten en te profiteren van onze kennis van de industrie en technologische expertise.

Ontdek bij ons de mogelijkheden voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling en zet de volgende stap in je carrière. Hier staat jouw succes centraal!
jobs.companyDescription: Founded in 1976, CGI is among the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer – LLMs
jobs.description:
Join our AI team at Prosus, the largest consumer internet company in Europe and one of the biggest tech investors in the world. You'll be working on the team that drives growth and innovation across the company, with your work directly impacting how millions of people shop online.

Who we’re looking for

We're seeking an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to develop our domain-specific language models. You'll own the full training pipeline - from continued pre-training on proprietary data, through fine-tuning, to advanced post-training techniques. You have hands-on experience training language models at scale (from embedding models to specialized LLMs), deep understanding of distributed systems and excel at turning research concepts into robust production systems. You're motivated by seeing your work deployed and used by millions of real users. You thrive in fast-paced environments where you balance research insights with practical business impact.

What you’ll do

  • Analyze model performance and training data to identify improvement opportunities and formulate hypotheses for enhancement
  • Design, execute, and rigorously evaluate experiments to improve model quality, training efficiency, and downstream task performance
  • Train large language models for our domain through continued pre-training and full parameter fine-tuning on proprietary datasets
  • Design and implement post-training pipelines using RLHF, DPO, GRPO, and other reinforcement learning techniques
  • Build and optimize distributed training infrastructure across multi-node GPU clusters using frameworks like DeepSpeed, FSDP, Megatron-LM, or Axolotl
  • Own large-scale data preparation: filtering, quality assessment, deduplication, and data mixture strategies for training corpora at 100B+ token scale
  • Generate and curate high-quality synthetic data for instruction fine-tuning and capability enhancement
  • Debug training stability issues, optimize training throughput, and monitor model performance throughout long-running distributed jobs
  • Implement techniques from recent papers and adapt them to our use cases
  • Build robust evaluation frameworks to measure model quality and guide training decisions
  • Write production-grade, well-tested code and contribute to team engineering standards

Minimum qualifications

  • 5+ years of ML engineering experience
  • Proven experience training and deploying language models to production (embedding models, encoder models, or large language models) including pre-training, continued pre-training, or fine-tuning with rigorous evaluation
  • Experience preparing large-scale training datasets: data filtering, quality assessment, deduplication strategies, and data mixture design
  • Hands-on experience with distributed training frameworks (DeepSpeed, FSDP, Megatron-LM, or Axolotl) including orchestrating multi-node jobs, debugging failures, and optimizing throughput
  • Strong understanding of training dynamics at scale: debugging loss instabilities, tuning learning rate schedules, managing training stability across long-running multi-node jobs
  • Expert Python and PyTorch with production experience using training libraries (Transformers, DeepSpeed, Accelerate)
  • Strong software engineering practices: version control, testing, CI/CD, code review

Preferred qualifications

  • Published research at ML conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, ACL, EMNLP), released models on Hugging Face, created public benchmarks, or contributed to open-source projects
  • Experience with post-training methods: RLHF, DPO, GRPO, or other reinforcement learning approaches for alignment and instruction-following
  • Experience optimizing models for production inference: quantization, model compression, distillation, and serving frameworks (vLLM)
  • Understanding of memory optimization: gradient checkpointing, mixed precision training (FP16, BF16, FP8), ZeRO optimization
  • Track record of building synthetic data generation pipelines for instruction tuning or domain adaptation
  • Research contributions: published papers at ML conferences, released models on Hugging Face, or created benchmarks used by the community
  • Contributions to open-source LLM training projects or tools

What we offer

  • High-impact AI projects that are strategically vital to the company, with direct engagement from senior leadership including the CEO
  • State-of-the-art infrastructure: H200 GPU fleet, massive proprietary datasets, access to frontier models (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Together.ai) for evaluation and baselines
  • Expert colleagues who have released top Hugging Face models, authored papers at NeurIPS, created well-known benchmarks, and built multiple production AI systems
  • Significant autonomy and freedom to test ideas, experiment with new approaches, and drive technical decisions
  • Modern tooling: Latest ML frameworks, coding assistants, best-in-class development environment
  • Hybrid work model with our Amsterdam office - home to the AI House, bringing together 200+ AI professionals through events, meetups, and startup collaborations
  • Competitive compensation, top-spec MacBook Pro, and an environment genuinely built for professional growth and learning

  • If you're excited to apply your LLM training expertise to high-impact applications at scale and see your work make a tangible difference globally, let's talk.
Our Diversity & Inclusion Commitment

We respect the dignity and human rights of individuals and communities wherever we operate in the world. Building an inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome and can thrive is critical for us. jobs.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer – LLMs
jobs.description:
Join our AI team at Prosus, the largest consumer internet company in Europe and one of the biggest tech investors in the world. You'll be working on the team that drives growth and innovation across the company, with your work directly impacting how millions of people shop online.

Who we’re looking for

We're seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to train domain-specific language models and provide technical leadership to the team. You'll own critical parts of our training infrastructure, mentor engineers, and drive technical decisions from data preparation through production deployment. You have deep hands-on experience training language models at scale, lead by example through rigorous experimentation and high-quality code, and are motivated by seeing your work deployed to millions of users. You thrive in fast-paced environments where you balance technical depth with practical business impact.

What you’ll do

  • Analyze model performance and training data, formulate hypotheses, design and execute rigorous experiments to systematically improve model quality, training and inference efficiency, and downstream task performance
  • Drive technical decision-making for model architecture, training strategies, and infrastructure choices
  • Provide technical leadership and mentorship to ML engineers and interns, conducting code reviews, sharing best practices, and accelerating team growth
  • Train large language models through continued pre-training and full parameter fine-tuning on proprietary datasets
  • Build and optimize distributed training infrastructure across multi-node GPU clusters using frameworks like DeepSpeed, FSDP, Megatron-LM, or Axolotl
  • Own large-scale data preparation: filtering, quality assessment, deduplication, and data mixture strategies for training corpora at 100B+ token scale
  • Generate and curate high-quality synthetic data for instruction fine-tuning and capability enhancement
  • Debug training stability issues, optimize training and inference throughput (quantization, distillation, serving optimization), and monitor model performance throughout long-running distributed jobs
  • Build robust evaluation frameworks and establish metrics to measure model quality and guide decisions
  • Write production-grade, well-tested code and set engineering standards for the team

Minimum qualifications

  • 7+ years of ML engineering experience
  • Technical leadership experience: mentoring engineers, conducting code reviews, making architecture decisions, and delivering projects with measurable business impact
  • Proven experience training and deploying language models to production (embedding models, encoder models, or large language models) including pre-training, continued pre-training, or fine-tuning with rigorous evaluation and inference optimization
  • Experience preparing large-scale training datasets: data filtering, quality assessment, deduplication strategies, and data mixture design
  • Hands-on experience with distributed training frameworks (DeepSpeed, FSDP, Megatron-LM, or Axolotl) including orchestrating multi-node jobs, debugging failures, and optimizing throughput
  • Strong understanding of training dynamics at scale: debugging loss instabilities, tuning learning rate schedules, managing training stability across long-running multi-node jobs
  • Expert Python and PyTorch with production experience using training libraries (Transformers, DeepSpeed, Accelerate)

Preferred qualifications

  • Published research at ML conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, ACL, EMNLP), released models on Hugging Face, created public benchmarks, or contributed to open-source projects
  • Experience with post-training methods: RLHF, DPO, GRPO, or other reinforcement learning approaches for alignment and instruction-following
  • Experience optimizing models for production inference including quantization, model compression, distillation, and serving frameworks (vLLM, TensorRT-LLM)
  • Understanding of memory optimization: gradient checkpointing, mixed precision training (FP16, BF16, FP8), ZeRO optimization
  • Deep knowledge of GPU architectures (A100, H100, H200) and their implications for training and inference optimization
  • Track record of building synthetic data generation pipelines for instruction tuning or domain adaptation

What we offer

  • High-impact AI projects that are strategically vital to the company, with direct engagement from senior leadership including the CEO
  • State-of-the-art infrastructure: H200 GPU fleet, massive proprietary datasets, access to frontier models (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Together.ai) for evaluation and baselines
  • Expert colleagues who have released top Hugging Face models, authored papers at NeurIPS, created well-known benchmarks, and built multiple production AI systems
  • Significant autonomy and freedom to test ideas, experiment with new approaches, and drive technical decisions
  • Modern tooling: Latest ML frameworks, coding assistants, best-in-class development environment
  • Hybrid work model with our Amsterdam office - home to the AI House, bringing together 200+ AI professionals through events, meetups, and startup collaborations
  • Competitive compensation, top-spec MacBook Pro, and an environment genuinely built for professional growth and learning

  • If you're excited to apply your LLM training expertise to high-impact applications at scale, lead technical initiatives, and grow the next generation of ML engineers, let's talk.
Our Diversity & Inclusion Commitment

We respect the dignity and human rights of individuals and communities wherever we operate in the world. Building an inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome and can thrive is critical for us. We provide access to education, which helps everyone understand the important role they play and the positive impact they can have.

For a deeper look at our journey and future plans, explore our latest Annual Report. Stay up to date with our latest news to see what makes Prosus stand out. Learn more at www.prosus.com.

If you’re excited to push the boundaries of AI applications — and to see your work make a tangible difference on a global scale—let’s talk.

jobs.title: MLOps Engineer I
jobs.description:
Company Description

We’re Checkout.com – you might not know our name, but companies like eBay, ASOS, Klarna, Uber Eats, and Sony do. That moment when you check out online? We make it happen.

Checkout.com is where the world checks out. Our global network powers billions of transactions every year, making money move without making a fuss. We spent years perfecting a service most people will never notice. Because when digital payments just work, businesses grow, customers stay, and no one stops to think about why.

With 19 offices spanning six continents, we feel at home everywhere – but London is our HQ. Wherever our people work their magic, they’re fast-moving, performance-obsessed, and driven by being better every day. Ideal. Because a role here isn’t just another job; it’s a career-defining opportunity to build the future of fintech.

Job Description

As a ML (Machine Learning) Ops Engineer at Checkout.com in the ML Platform team, you will contribute to the development of scalable systems that power real-time fraud detection and payment optimization. This is your opportunity to grow alongside top-tier engineers while making a tangible impact on millions of transactions globally.

The solutions that you will be building will power our stack of value added services in the Payments Performance area. We’re a growing team in an expanding area within the company and we’re looking for individuals who have strong ownership, are passionate about productionising ML and have a pragmatic approach to converting big problems into smaller iterations to constantly deliver value.

How you’ll make an impact

  • Build systems for training, deploying and monitoring machine learning models used in our payments platform, at scale
  • Scale our feature store to more and increasingly complex use-cases both online and offline
  • Deliver end to end features with full ownership under mentorship of talented engineers

Qualifications

  • Proficiency in writing clear, production-ready Python code
  • Familiarity with production ML models (online or offline) and standard MLOps practices
  • Familiarity with monitoring and observability of production systems, with a strong sense of ownership
  • Familiarity in Cloud-based application development (we use AWS)

  • Strong communication skills, able to express ideas clearly and collaborate across teams
  • Growth mindset, always on the lookout for stretch challenges
  • Curiosity to tackle open-ended problems and learn from failures

Bring all of you to work

We create the conditions for high performers to thrive – through real ownership, fewer blockers, and work that makes a difference from day one.

Here, you’ll move fast, take on meaningful challenges, and be recognized for the impact you deliver. It’s a place where ambition gets met with opportunity – and where your growth is in your hands.

We work as one team, and we back each other to succeed. So whatever your background or identity, if you’re ready to grow and make a difference, you’ll be right at home here.

It’s important we set you up for success and make our process as accessible as possible. So let us know in your application, or tell your recruiter directly, if you need anything to make your experience or working environment more comfortable.


Life at Checkout.com

We understand that work is just one part of your life. Our hybrid working model offers flexibility, with three days per week in the office to support collaboration and connection.

Curious about what it’s like to be part of our team? Visit our Careers Page to learn more about our culture, open roles, and what drives us.

For a closer look at daily life at Checkout.com, follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram

jobs.title: Postdoc in Design Generation and Evaluation for the Mobility DesAIgn Lab
jobs.description:
Postdoc in Design Generation and Evaluation for the Mobility DesAIgn Lab

Curious about how AI can shape the future of mobility system design, and do so in an equitable way? Join us at the Mobility DesAIgn Lab and be part of the innovation!


Job description

The global urbanization and growth of cities lead to a significant increase in mobility and logistics while the amount of space available is scarce. IT technology and mobility services in cities are evolving rapidly, and there are many public and private stakeholders involved in the design, and management of mobility and transport systems. To keep areas accessible and liveable there is a pressing need for advanced design methodologies that are capable of dealing with increasingly complex design problems such as location choice of mobility hubs, the number of shared vehicles offered at hubs and the number of parking spaces on different locations in a city.


Current urban mobility planning and design makes use of predictive digital twins based on classical traffic and transport models, in which a group of stakeholders interacts with a visual dashboard. In this approach, the stakeholders propose several designs, and transport models are used to assess the expected impacts of those designs on the modal-split, network performance, accessibility and other indicators. A substantial disadvantage of this approach is that only a limited number of designs can be considered. Another disadvantage is that only a small group of stakeholders decides about the designs, creating the risk that they unconsciously introduce bias towards specific population groups, areas and/or types of solutions.


The Mobility DesAIgn Lab focuses on novel ‘prescriptive’ digital twins that are based on AI and optimisation techniques and studies the ethical, legal, societal, and economic implications of using these prescriptive digital twins for urban mobility and spatial system design and management, enabling stakeholders to start using these prescriptive digital twins responsibly.


In this role you will be responsible for the generation and evaluation of the designs and management strategies that can be explored in the digital twin. The process of generating designs is steered by AI techniques, while the evaluation of designs is performed using existing transport models. These models simulate behaviour of travellers to compute a variety of indicators, such as modality choices, travel times, and accessibility measures, for different population groups. The indicators can be used to explore, compare and eventually choose designs in the use cases. You will collaborate closely with a fellow postdoc as well as with researchers from TNO, the university of Leiden, and with several public and private partners.


Key responsibilities include:

  • Make an inventory of population groups and indicators that should be considered in the design and evaluation, based on three different use cases: sustainable mobility, car-restrictive interventions, and future traffic management with connected automated vehicles.
  • Develop AI-based design generation methods.
  • Develop and apply transport models such that the selected indicators can be computed for different designs.
  • Collaborate with researchers and consortium partners in the Mobility DesAIgn Lab.

More information on the project (and a 2nd PostDoc vacancy within the project) can be found at its website: Mobility DesAIgn Lab


Job requirements

  • PhD in Artificial Intelligence (AI), Computer Science, Transport (Engineering), Urban Mobility, or a related field.
  • Proven expertise in digital twins, and urban mobility modelling.
  • Strong programming skills.
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams.

TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)

Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.


At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.


Challenge. Change. Impact!


Faculty of Civil Engineering and Geosciences

The Faculty of Civil Engineering & Geosciences (CEG) is committed to outstanding international research and education in the field of civil engineering, applied earth sciences, traffic and transport, water technology, and delta technology. Our research feeds into our educational programmes and covers societal challenges such as climate change, energy transition, resource availability, urbanisation and clean water. Our research projects are conducted in close cooperation with a wide range of research institutions.
CEG is convinced of the importance of open science and supports its scientists in integrating open science in their research practice. The Faculty of CEG comprises 28 research groups in the following seven departments: Materials Mechanics Management & Design, Engineering Structures, Geoscience and Engineering, Geoscience and Remote Sensing, Transport & Planning, Hydraulic Engineering and Water Management.


& Geosciences.


Conditions of employment

  • Duration of contract is 2 years. Temporary.
  • A job of 38-40 hours per week.
  • Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities.
  • An excellent pension scheme via the ABP.
  • The possibility to compile an individual employment package every year.
  • Discount with health insurers on supplemental packages.
  • Flexible working week.
  • Every year, 232 leave hours (at 38 hours). You can also sell or buy additional leave hours via the individual choice budget.
  • Plenty of opportunities for education, training and courses.
  • Partially paid parental leave
  • Attention for working healthy and energetically with the vitality program.


Will you need to relocate to the Netherlands for this job? TU Delft is committed to make your move as smooth as possible! The HR unit, Coming to Delft Service, offers information on their website to help you prepare your relocation. In addition, Coming to Delft Service organises events to help you settle in the Netherlands, and expand your (social) network in Delft. A Dual Career Programme is available, to support your accompanying partner with their job search in the Netherlands. .


Additional information
For more information about this vacancy, please contact Maaike Snelder M.Snelder.tudelft.nl.
For more information on the Mobility DesAIgn Lab, see Mobility DesAIgn Lab


Application procedure
Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than 30 January 2026 upload the following documents:


  • Cover Letter
  • Motivational letter
  • A proof of scientific writing (e.g. a summary of your PhD thesis or a conference/journal paper).

You can address your application to Maaike Snelder.


Please note:

  • You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
  • As part of knowledge security, TU Delft conducts a risk assessment during the recruitment of personnel. We do this, among other things, to prevent the unwanted transfer of sensitive knowledge and technology. The assessment is based on information provided by the candidates themselves, such as their motivation letter and CV, and takes place at the final stages of the selection process. When the outcome of the assessment is negative, the candidate will be informed. The processing of personal data in the context of the risk assessment is carried out on the legal basis of the GDPR: performing a public task in the public interest. You can find more information about this assessment on our website about knowledge security.
  • Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.

Faculty/Department: Faculty of Civil Engineering and Geosciences
Salary range: €3546 - €5538
Hours per week: 38-40
FTE: 1,0
Submission is possible until: 30 Jan 2026

jobs.title: Principal Web Engineer
jobs.description:
About Us

Eagle Eye Networks is the global leader in cloud video surveillance, delivering cyber-secure, cloud-based video with artificial intelligence (AI) and analytics to make businesses more efficient and the world a safer place. The Eagle Eye Cloud VMS (video management system) is the only platform robust and flexible enough to power the future of video surveillance and intelligence. Eagle Eye is based in Austin, Texas, with offices in Amsterdam, Bangalore, and Tokyo.

Summary

Step into the role of Web Architect at Eagle Eye Networks and take charge of architecting the next generation of cloud video surveillance applications! This is not your typical frontend role, this is your chance to define the standards, structure, and scalability of the systems that power a global leader in cloud-based security.

We need a sharp, future-ready architect to lead the charge in defining our frontend architecture, defining programming guidelines, and delivering detailed technical design documents (TRDs) for high-impact features and components. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams and act as a central force driving consistency, performance, and maintainability across our platform.

If you're passionate about elegant architecture, component design, and raising the engineering bar across teams, and using AI to do it, this role was made for you.

What Makes This Role Exciting?

  • You’ll set the architectural direction for web development in a product used globally.
  • Modernize how we build, ship, and scale (and leverage AI to do it).
  • Craft guidelines and standards that empower engineering teams to move fast without breaking things.
  • Collaborate with talented engineers, product managers, and designers in a high-ownership culture.
  • Influence the development of mission-critical features in real-time video and security tech.

You Will

  • Define architecture and technical standards for our frontend platform (Vue 2/3, Vuetify, TypeScript).
  • Author comprehensive technical design documents (TRDs) for large-scale components and systems.
  • Lead and advise on best practices around state management, component reuse, testing, and code scalability.
  • Work closely with engineering leadership and product to translate business requirements into technical architecture.
  • Provide mentorship and architectural reviews to development teams.
  • Develop high-quality components and features, leveraging AI where possible

What you bring

  • 7+ years of experience in web development, including 3+ years in a senior or architectural role.
  • Deep understanding of Vue.js, with experience in both Vue 2 and Vue 3 (Composition API a plus).
    Solid experience with Vuetify and TypeScript in large-scale production environments.
  • Strong grasp of modern frontend architecture principles including modularization, dependency management, testing, and performance optimization.
  • Proven ability to produce clear, thoughtful architecture and technical design documentation.
  • Experience designing and consuming REST APIs.
  • Excellent collaboration and communication skills, you're a mentor, not just a maker.

Bonus Points For

  • Experience leading large-scale frontend refactor/migration initiatives.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
  • Background in video streaming, IoT, or real-time applications.
  • Experience with working in Agile environment, Scrum, Kanban
  • Experience in leveraging AI tools (e.g., GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, AI linters) to:
    • Improve code quality and maintainability.
    • Accelerate development of web components and features.
    • Assist with architectural planning and documentation.

Why Eagle Eye Networks?

At Eagle Eye Networks, we’re not just developing software, we’re redefining safety, insight, and scalability in a cloud-first world. You’ll join a team that thrives in a startup-paced, impact-driven culture while enjoying the benefits of a global, industry-leading company. Be part of shaping products that make a real-world difference.

What can you expect from us?

  • Diverse team with 25+ nationalities
  • 23 paid holidays yearly + Dutch public holidays
  • Compensation for travel expenses from your home to the office;
  • Company equipment for work use;
  • Enrollment in the Eagle Eye Networks B.V. collective pension plan;
  • Drinks & Snacks at the AMS office;
  • Opportunity to take part in EEN Corporate Fitness App challenges;
  • Company swag, business casual scale-up work atmosphere and Friday drinks;
  • Once or twice a year a stunning company day;
  • Flexible work time arrangement.

More About Eagle Eye Networks

Eagle Eye Networks is leveraging artificial intelligence on its true cloud platform to dramatically reshape the video surveillance and security industry. The Eagle Eye Cloud Video Management System (VMS) is a smart cloud video surveillance solution, purpose-built to help businesses improve safety, security, operations, and customer service. Tens of thousands of companies in more than 90 countries around the globe have moved their video surveillance to the cloud with Eagle Eye VMS. Customers, including multi-family residences, smart cities, schools, hospitals, hotels, logistics, restaurants, and retail shops trust Eagle Eye for actionable business intelligence and proactive security across multiple locations. The Eagle Eye VMS has strong APIs for the secure integration of third-party systems and works with thousands of industry cameras, so customers don’t have to “rip and replace” their existing infrastructure. Eagle Eye Cloud VMS is the only platform robust enough to power the future of video surveillance.

Eagle Eye Networks is an equal employment opportunity employer and values diversity. Qualified candidates are considered for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, military or veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
