jobs.title: AI Test Engineer
jobs.description:
Wat ga je doen

Is het tijd om slimmer te testen? Dan kom jij om de hoek kijken. Als AI Tester ben jij namelijk onze nieuwe generatie testautomatiseerder: je gebruikt Artificial Intelligence om testactiviteiten te versnellen, te verrijken en te optimaliseren. Waar organisaties nog zoeken naar manieren om AI in te zetten binnen hun testproces, laat jij zien hoe het werkt.

Je ontwikkelt en gebruikt AI-modellen om testgevallen te genereren, realistische testdata op te bouwen en testresultaten automatisch te beoordelen. Jij helpt klanten hun testautomatisering te optimaliseren met AI — zelfs als zij nog geen AI-gegenereerde software hebben om te testen. Jouw kennis maakt hen onafhankelijk van de manier waarop software ontwikkeld wordt: jij weet AI altijd effectief in te zetten.

Van inrichting tot uitvoering werk je inhoudelijk mee aan AI-gedreven testspecificatie, datamanagement en het gericht selecteren van AI-tools die het testproces ondersteunen, evenals aan de interpretatie van AI-gegenereerde resultaten. Je ziet direct waar kansen liggen en legt helder uit wat slimmer, sneller of veiliger kan. Met je ervaring binnen zowel testen als AI weet je wanneer je een testproject kunt valideren en hiermee het vertrouwen van onze opdrachtgevers wint. Van teststrategie tot databeheer, van AI-tooling tot advies: jij draait er je hand niet voor om.

Voor het selecteren van AI-gerelateerde tools, ze implementeren en integreren in de teststraat heb je de nodige kennis en ervaring. Je denkt mee over processen en richtlijnen binnen het AI-testtraject en bepaalt hoe dekkend AI-gegenereerde testscripts moeten zijn, en hoe deze bruikbaar en veilig worden ingezet in zowel ontwikkel- als testomgevingen. Daarnaast adviseer je stakeholders en teams bij de klant op basis van jouw inzichten en analyse.

Klinkt het ontwikkelen, verbeteren en optimaliseren van AI-gedreven testprocessen jou als muziek in de oren? Wil jij graag werken aan de volgende stap in het testvak?

Dan zoeken wij jou, ons AI Tester!

Wat bieden wij jou

  • Salaris. Een onvoorwaardelijk en gegarandeerd basisinkomen, wat jou zekerheid geeft.

  • Provisie. Naast het basissalaris deel je mee in de omzet met ons Solidshare beloningsmodel, dus dat kan aardig oplopen.

  • Zekerheid. Uiteraard krijg je een vast contract met prima secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden

  • Vakantiedagen. Onbeperkt!

  • Essentials. Een auto, laptop en telefoon, dat spreekt voor zich.

  • Projecten. Samen kiezen we de projecten waar jij helemaal op je plek zit.

  • Ontwikkeling. Opleidingen, trainingen en cursussen die bij je passen.

  • Een stem. Laat je horen binnen jouw competence.

  • Our community. Deel kennis, successen en gezelligheid met collega’s die net zo bezeten zijn van IT als jij.

  • Events. Van onze jaarlijkse ski-trip naar Oostenrijk en de jubileumreis naar Dublin tot een MTB-clinic of running event. Van tweewekelijkse Dungeons & Dragons-avonden tot familiedagen naar de Efteling.

Wie ben jij als AI Test Engineer?

Als AI Tester ben je bedreven in zowel traditioneel testen als in het inzetten van generatieve AI. Je werkt met moderne tooling voor testgeneratie, testdata-creatie en AI-analyse van testresultaten. Je weet hoe je data verantwoord beheert, hoe je AI-modellen configureert en hoe je uitkomsten interpreteert om duidelijke adviezen te geven aan opdrachtgevers, product owners en developers.

Je werkt gestructureerd, bent analytisch sterk, resultaat- en kwaliteitsgericht. Je communiceert open en duidelijk op verschillende niveaus, spreekt en schrijft vloeiend Nederlands en Engels en schakelt moeiteloos tussen professionals uit diverse disciplines.

Ervaring met Agile/Scrum werken is een pluspunt. Verder heb je een afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding in een relevant vakgebied zoals Informatica, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science of vergelijkbaar.

Werken bij Pancompany in AI

Ben je de beste in je vak.
Denk en handel je als een ondernemer.
Maak je plezier en geniet je volop.

jobs.title: PhD Position in Foundation Model for Architectural Engineering
jobs.description:
PhD Position in Foundation Model for Architectural Engineering

Challenge: Developing novel representation and foundation model for architectural engineering subjects.

Change: Advancing human-in-the-loop systems of architectural engineering knowledge tasks, with a focus on enhanced digital-human agency in design, engineering and construction coordination.

Impact: Enhancing adaptability and scalability of AI models in building engineering.


Job description


We are seeking a highly motivated PhD candidate to pioneer the integration of architectural knowledge and logic directly into the latent manifold of Generative AI. This position operates at the cutting edge of AI and the Built Environment, challenging you to architect a native Multimodal Foundation Model for Architectural Engineering designed for "Constraint-to-BIM (Building Information Modelling)" synthesis. You will investigate how deep neural networks can internalize complex building dynamics (e.g., structural load paths, material thermodynamics) and regulatory logic (e.g., zoning envelopes) as native languages, facilitating rigorous, carbon-centric decision-making. If you are driven to transcend generic, task-agnostic generation and advance frontier AI toward structurally and functionally viable design, join us in defining this new scientific paradigm.


Your core research will target three novel frontiers: (1) heterogeneous input encoding, where you will develop architectures to unify disparate modalities into a coherent embedding space; (2) causal chain-of-thought, engineering mechanisms for the model to manage long-horizon dependencies in construction sequencing and system-level planning; and (3) constraint-aware latent reasoning, innovating tokenization strategies that semantically bind geometric primitives with performance constraints to ensure "construction-valid" generation. You will apply parameter-efficient fine-Tuning (e.g., low-rank adaptation) to an open-source Multimodal Foundation Model (MMLM) for domain-specific adaptation, combining it with novel pretraining objectives (e.g., topology-preserving loss, consistency-based self-supervision) to overcome engineering data scarcity and enable autonomous reasoning for tasks such as structural integrity, HVAC routing, and climate-adaptive design.


You will work within an interdisciplinary ecosystem of domain experts and stakeholders from industry and the public sector. A critical component of your work will be establishing rigorous evaluation protocols to probe the model's physics-consistency and logic-adherence, moving the field beyond standard perceptual metrics. Your contributions will define the state-of-the-art through publications in leading AI and built-environment venues, the release of open benchmarks for architectural reasoning, and the formulation of methodological guidelines for reliable domain-specific foundation models. Ultimately, your research will deliver a unified native foundation model, providing the multi-level disciplinary intelligence essential for the early-stage development of sustainable, high-performance buildings.


Requirements

  • You hold an MSc in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science or Architectural Engineering (with strong computational focus), demonstrating a solid portfolio at the intersection of Deep Learning and geometric/physical data.
  • You have a keen interest and/or experience in large-scale model architectures, specifically focusing on self-supervised learning, latent space alignment, or multimodal representation learning.
  • You have solid programming skills (e.g. Python) and are familiar with modern ML frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
  • You are motivated to work with complex and heterogeneous AEC (Architecture, Engineering, and Construction) data.
  • You possess hands-on experience in at least one of the following frontier areas: Geometric Deep Learning (GNNs, 3D-CNNs), Computer Vision, or Vision-Language Models (VLMs).
  • You have excellent scientific communication skills in English and a driven ambition to publish high-impact research in top-tier AI and Built Environment venues.
  • You thrive in bridging disciplines, capable of working translating complex problems into potential solutions and collaborating effectively with domain experts and industry stakeholders.


TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)

Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.


At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.


Challenge. Change. Impact!


Faculty Architecture & the Built Environment

The Faculty of Architecture and the Built Environment has a leading role in education and research worldwide. The driving force behind the faculty’s success is its robust research profile combined with the energy and creativity of its student body and academic community. It is buzzing with energy from early in the morning until late at night, with four thousand people studying, working, designing, conducting research and acquiring and disseminating knowledge. Our faculty has a strong focus on 'design-oriented research’, which has given it a top position in world rankings.


Staff and students are working to improve the built environment with the help of a broad set of disciplines, including architectural design, urban planning, building technology, social sciences, process management, and geo-information science. The faculty works closely with other faculties, universities, private parties, and the public sector, and has an extensive network in the Netherlands as well as internationally.


about this role, please contact Dr ir. Pei-Yu Wu, Assistant Professor, via +31 (0)634115402 or p.y.wu@tudelft.nl or Dr ir. Michela Turrin, Associate Professor, via +31 (0)62921839 or m.turrin@tudelft.nl.


For information about the application procedure, please contact Paulien Stastra, HR advisor, e-mail: recruitment-BK@tudelft.nl.


Application procedure

Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply before 25 January 2026 (local Dutch time + 2 hrs) upload:

  • Motivation letter (maximum 1 page) addressing your interests and describing how your experience and plans fit with the position.

  • Detailed CV.

  • Undergraduate and graduate transcripts.

  • The names of two references, with contact information (letters not required at this stage).



Please address you application to Dr.ir. Pei-Yu Wu, Assistant Professor at the Digital Technology Section at the Department of Architectural Engineering and Technology.


The initial interviews will take place in mid-Februay 2026.

Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.


Please note:

  • You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.

  • As part of knowledge security, TU Delft conducts a risk assessment during the recruitment of personnel. We do this, among other things, to prevent the unwanted transfer of sensitive knowledge and technology. The assessment is based on information provided by the candidates themselves, such as their motivation letter and CV, and takes place at the final stages of the selection process. When the outcome of the assessment is negative, the candidate will be informed. The processing of personal data in the context of the risk assessment is carried out on the legal basis of the GDPR: performing a public task in the public interest. You can find more information about this assessment on our website about knowledge security.

  • Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.


Faculty/Department: Faculty of Architecture and the Built Environment
Salary range: €2872 - €3670
Hours per week: 38-40
FTE: 1
Submission is possible until: 25 Jan 2026
ID job: 2910

jobs.title: Solutions Engineer, SMB (French-Speaking)
jobs.description:
Overview:

Working at Atlassian

Atlassians can choose where they work – whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity.

Your future team
With over 250,000 customers worldwide, Atlassian is helping organisations like NASA, IBM, Hubspot, Samsung and Coca-Cola advance humanity through the power of incredible software that unleashes the potential of every team.
With a focus on value selling, we help our customers understand how our products combine to create enterprise solutions that transform their business’s outcomes. We’re different from other organisations because we approach everything we do using our value of ‘play as a team'. We support each other, celebrate our wins together and share knowledge.

Responsibilities:

Atlassian is looking for a Pre-Sales Solutions Engineer for our SMB business (enterprise customers under 1000 employees) that’s passionate about being a solution expert in the sales cycle, solving our customer’s hardest business problems with our products and solutions, and helping close deals.

Our team enjoys high earnings potential with the enterprise white space opportunity ahead of us, selling impactful products that are at the forefront of cloud and artificial intelligence utilization.


In This Job, You Will:

  • Join Atlassian’s Solutions Engineering Team to partner with direct sales, partners and larger account teams on SMB Accounts, tracking the overall customer profile, business problems and complexities, roadmaps, and solution success to optimize the customers within your account team territory.

  • Participate in customer discovery to understand the customer's current state, what business problems they want to solve, and map back to the Atlassian products, platforms and solutions that will get them where they want to be.

  • Probe for and identify additional opportunities for cross-product/solution expansion.

  • Investigate, discover, and assess client pain points.

  • Be a product expert of Atlassian software in the pre-sales process, articulating and showing the customer the value of the software and how it can change their way of working.

  • Have a broad understanding of full Atlassian product and solution offerings and paint a compelling story of how they work together to unlock the power of teams.

  • Lead compelling value-based demonstrations, both standard and customized, flexing across multiple different stakeholder needs, from deep individual product demos to selling the large vision of the whole portfolio.

  • Understand, lead, and guide the customer's technical needs in the sales process to gain buy-in from the customer on Atlassian being the right decision.

  • Proactively forge strong partnerships with aligned SMB sellers, regularly discussing pipeline, current and upcoming opportunities and needs, bi-directional feedback, and ways to improve the selling cycle together.

  • Understand, track and document product feedback and competitive intelligence from customers and advocate for the development internally by documenting and sharing with product management.

  • Continuously learn, develop and refine your pre-sales and product, solution and platform offering knowledge and sales processes and Atlassian products progress.

Qualifications:

Your Background:

  • You have 3+ years of experience interacting with SMB customers in a pre-sales capacity, with excellent communication, strong presentation skills to multi-level audiences, and unmatched agility to do what it takes to get the job done.

  • You’re a creative problem solver who can interpret complex business problems, boil them down into solutions, and collaborate with prospects, partners, and the Atlassian sales team to deliver compelling value-based solutions.

  • You’re equally comfortable in both business and technical contexts, interacting with executives or talking shop with strong technical audiences.

  • You love to learn and continuously grow and challenge yourself. You are open to giving and receiving feedback, tolerate failure, love to win, hate to lose, and are passionate about making customers and Atlassian successful.

  • You have a customer-centric mindset, with a proven track record in building executive relationships with customers and rally the internal teams to collaborate across the company to meet our customers needs.

  • You are fluent in French and have business proficiency in English.

Benefits & Perks

Atlassian offers a wide range of perks and benefits designed to support you, your family and to help you engage with your local community. Our offerings include health and wellbeing resources, paid volunteer days, and so much more. To learn more, visit go.atlassian.com/perksandbenefits.

About Atlassian

At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team. Our software products help teams all over the planet and our solutions are designed for all types of work. Team collaboration through our tools makes what may be impossible alone, possible together.

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

To provide you the best experience, we can support with accommodations or adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process. Simply inform our Recruitment team during your conversation with them.

To learn more about our culture and hiring process, visit go.atlassian.com/crh.
jobs.companyDescription: Atlassian is committed to unleashing the potential of every team, helping them accomplish what’s impossible alone.

jobs.title: Mechanic Technician Processing
jobs.description:
Nestlé Nutrition, a global company in the Nestlé Group, helps to enhance peoples’ lives through science-based nutrition products and services for consumer groups with specific nutritional needs. Our brands include Nestlé and Gerber maternal and infant nutrition, PowerBar and Musashi performance nutrition and Jenny Craig weight management.

Mechanic Technician Processing, this is your challenge

If you are interested in the Mechanical maintenance aspects of a production department, then we are looking for you! You will join us as a Mechanical Technician. You will participate fully as a Mechanic within our Processing department at Nestlé Nunspeet. In this position you will work day shift. Nestlé also offers various opportunities to grow into other technical positions within the company.


Find out what it is like to work as an Electrician and Mechanic in our baby food factory in Nunspeet Netherlands.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XmgSjyQ5Bp4


Find out more about our factory in Nunspeet through our website!

https://www.nestle.nl/fabriek-nestle-nunspeet


As Mechanic you will have the following responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the Mechanical maintenance aspects of the production departments and associated machinery within the Processing department;
  • Planned preventive maintenance based on work orders and technical project work;
  • Initiating and/or providing relevant input on technical improvement proposals.


You will be part of the Engineering - Maintenance Processing department. You are part of 1 of the 3 maintenance teams in the factory. You will be working in an enthusiastic and flexible team of engineers and other technical specialists with a flat structure and therefore short communication lines. You will report to the Team Leader Maintenance - Processing.


What we are looking for in our Mechanic?

  • A completed technical MBO level 4 education in Mechanical Engineering, Service & Maintenance or similar;
  • Mechanical knowledge and work experience is a requirement;
  • experience of process installations is a plus;
  • knowledge of and experience in working with utility installations;
  • proactive work attitude, analytical ability, team player, flexible, eager to learn and enthusiastic.


The vacancy offers more than just a challenge:

  • A full-time position (36 hours a week);
  • Excellent terms of employment, with elements such as a 13th month, 25 holidays and a salary between €2900 and €3700;
  • You will be trained as a Mechanical Mechanic within the Maintenance department;
  • Internal (and possibly external) training opportunities;
  • You work on a product with a lot of significance for a very vulnerable target group;
  • Pleasant working environment, team spirit, company pride and motivated colleagues.


Respect is at the heart of Nestlé's culture, an important part of which is room for differences. Differences in people who buy our products and in our workplace. We believe it is important that everyone feels welcome and at home at Nestlé, regardless of your gender, religion, cultural background, age, disability or who you love. We are convinced that diversity leads to greater creativity and innovation and moves our organisation forward. Therefore, we actively work to create a culture and leadership that provides equal opportunities for all!


Any questions?
Our recruiters are ready to answer your questions. Send your question to careers@nl.nestle.com.


Applying for the role of Mechanic Technician Processing?
You can! If your profile fits the job description perfectly, we would like to receive your CV and motivation. Upload them now via the link!


We use an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Tool to schedule interviews with our candidates. So keep an eye on your email for the interview invitation! When registering your application, you will be asked if we may send you WhatsApp messages; if you answer 'yes' to this, you will receive communication via WhatsApp in addition to messages via email. Communication through our AI tool is in English, but our recruiters speak both English and Dutch.

Nestlé is 308,000 people strong and are driven by the purpose of enhancing the quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. With more than 91.4 billion CHF in 2018, we have an expansive presence with 413 factories in more than 85 countries. We believe our people are our most important asset, so we'll offer you a dynamic international working environment with constant opportunities for development. Want to learn more? Visit us at www.nestle.com.

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.description:
Wat ga je doen.

Organisaties zitten boordevol data. Jij bedenkt, ontwerpt en ontwikkelt als (Big) Data Engineer technische oplossingen voor ongestructureerde data vanuit de databron. Zodat deze data kan worden omgezet naar informatie, door bijvoorbeeld een dashboard te bouwen of door een grondige data-analyse te maken. Jouw werk heeft dus grote impact! Je draagt als Data Engineer direct bij aan de bestuurbaarheid en onderbouwing van de beslissingen die CEO’s en managementteams dagelijks nemen.

Door jouw ervaring met softwareontwikkeling en data-infrastructuur ben je van meerwaarde voor iedere klant. Je werkt graag samen met data scientists om de door hen getrainde machine learning modellen in de praktijk tot een succes te maken. Daarnaast haal je jouw plezier uit het zo efficiënt en effectief mogelijk inrichten van de streaming data pipelines van onze klanten.

Als Data Engineer begrijp je het belang van realtime kennis en zoek je dus zelfstandig naar mogelijke oplossingen voor de uitdagingen van onze klanten en werk je deze oplossingen uit. De technische rol die jij vertolkt helpt de klant bij de vertaling van hun probleem naar een oplossing door van het gebruik van de juiste Tech-stack.

Je werkt voor grote bedrijven zoals de Nederlandse overheid en top-200 bedrijven. En dat biedt jou de unieke kans om op grote schaal impact te maken. De complexiteit en omvang van de data bij deze bedrijven bieden uitdagende mogelijkheden voor een Data Engineer. Je bent betrokken bij projecten die de koers van deze bedrijven beïnvloeden en de besluitvorming van CEO’s en managementteams ondersteunen, waardoor je bijdraagt aan hun succes en groei.

Jij wil de beste zijn in je werk en werken met de nieuwste technieken. Van ons krijg je dus alle ruimte om je te blijven ontwikkelen en deel te nemen aan trainingen, cursussen en seminars. Ben jij de Data Engineer die onze community komt versterken?

Wij bieden.

  • Salaris. Een onvoorwaardelijk en gegarandeerd basisinkomen, wat jou zekerheid geeft.
  • Provisie. Naast het basissalaris deel je mee in de omzet met ons Solidshare beloningsmodel. En dat kan aardig oplopen.
  • Zekerheid. Uiteraard krijg je een vast contract met prima secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden.
  • Vakantiedagen. Onbeperkt!
  • Essentials. Een auto, laptop en telefoon, dat spreekt voor zich.
  • Projecten. Samen kiezen we de projecten waar jij helemaal op je plek zit.
  • Ontwikkeling. Opleidingen, trainingen en cursussen die bij je passen.
  • Een stem. Laat je horen in onze Data Analytics competence.
  • Our community. Deel kennis, successen en gezelligheid met collega’s die net zo bezeten zijn van IT als jij.
  • Events. Van onze jaarlijkse ski-trip naar Oostenrijk en de jubileumreis naar Dublin tot een MTB-clinic of running event. Van tweewekelijkse Dungeons & Dragons-avonden tot familiedagen naar de Efteling.

Dit ben jij.

Je hebt een relevant HBO of WO-diploma, bij voorkeur Computer Science of Artificial Intelligence. Je programmeert bij voorkeur met Java, Scala of Python.

Je bent de Data Engineer die alles weet van noodzakelijke pipeline tooling als Kafka, Spark, Cassandra en containertooling als Docker, Airflow of Kubernetes. Bij voorkeur heb je ook al ervaring met cloud oplossingen (Microsoft Azure of AWS).

Je bent analytisch sterk en kunt zelfstandig organisaties adviseren over de te nemen beslissingen. Tot slot spreek en schrijf je vloeiend Nederlands en Engels.

Bij Pancompany.

Ben je de beste in je vak.
Denk en handel je als een ondernemer.
Maak je plezier en geniet je volop.

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.description:
Make impact. Be human. Stay curious.

Who we are

AI is transforming the world – and we’re just getting started. With data growing exponentially, the need for smart, impact-driven minds has never been greater. At Rewire, we don’t just follow trends in Data & AI – we shape them.

If you're passionate about solving real challenges and creating tangible outcomes, then this is the perfect opportunity for you! With your innovative mindset and expertise, you're perfectly poised to help shape the future of Rewire, leveraging data and AI to develop cutting-edge solutions.

We're on a mission to grow Rewire's business by leaps and bounds, and we're looking for an Data Engineer to help us reach our goals. You'll have the incredible opportunity to engage in data and AI projects, collaborate closely with the client, and enable impactful results for our valued clients. Your role is going to be amazing! You'll support the day-to-day execution of transformation projects from a technical angle. This means, for example, working on technical design and development of data & AI solutions, shaping the vision on architecture with our clients, and assessing where organizations stand in their data transformation journey. You’ll get trained as a technical leader acting on the intersection of business, technology, data & AI.

Join a dynamic team of data and AI talents who tackle meaningful challenges, build smart solutions, and have fun along the way. Wanna join the ride?

Where you’ll make a difference

  • Build robust data & AI infrastructure – design and develop the pipelines, platforms, and systems that power our clients' data-driven ambitions

  • Advise clients on technical best practices – translate business needs into sound engineering decisions, bridging the gap between strategy and implementation

  • Develop scalable software solutions – write clean, maintainable code that turns complex requirements into reliable, production-ready systems

  • Contribute to organizational change – implement data & AI innovations supported by GAIN®, our certified education and training portfolio

  • Use technical expertise and communication skills – build scalable data & AI solutions that drive value across the organization

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams from both the client and Rewire – contribute from day one while learning from experienced leaders

What makes us the right choice for you

  • Be part of groundbreaking change as we scale a business in a fast-evolving industry with a dedicated international growth strategy, a team of experts, and the support of an experienced investor

  • Step into a role where you contribute ideas, support innovation, and help shape how organizations use data & AI to create real impact

  • Sharpen your engineering craft – work with modern tech stacks, cloud platforms, and best practices across diverse industries, while growing through hands-on projects and mentorship from experienced engineers

  • Join a vibrant, multidisciplinary team that’s ambitious, collaborative, and just the right amount of nerdy – where learning and laughter go hand in hand

  • Work alongside clients as a valued team member – building relationships based on trust, shared goals, and face-to-face collaboration whenever it matters most

  • Thrive in a culture that values autonomy, curiosity, and bold thinking – where your voice matters, ideas turn into action, and your impact is genuinely recognized and rewarded


What makes you shine

You’re a motivated problem solver and a curious learner – with a passion for turning data & AI into real business impact. You’ll thrive with us if you bring:

  • A Master’s degree with excellent results in a quantitative or STEM field (e.g., Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Econometrics)

  • Practical experience through internships, projects, or research – demonstrating your ability to build and maintain data pipelines, design scalable systems, and deliver reliable, production-ready solutions

  • A hands-on, growth mindset – you take ownership of your tasks, embrace challenges, and contribute to solutions that create real value

  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative spirit – you enjoy working in teams, explaining technical concepts clearly, and supporting a positive, inclusive work environment

  • Sharp analytical and technical skills – you excel at both problem-solving and implementing solutions that bridge business and technology

  • Fluency in Dutch and English (written and spoken), and willingness to travel regularly to client sites

Where you’ll work

Most projects require working onsite at client locations across the Netherlands, Germany, and occasionally other parts of Europe for several days each week.

When not onsite with clients, you’re warmly welcome to work from our Amsterdam office or from home. Rewire’s Amsterdam office is more than just a building – it’s a space designed to foster problem-solving, collaboration, innovation, and, simply put, where we build the future.

Discover more about its inspiring atmosphere here.

In their own words

“What I really enjoy about my job at Rewire is us being involved from the beginning to the end of implementing complex and innovative AI solutions. We go from designing, to prototyping, to implementing at scale. As a result, working here exposes me to so many aspects of engineering that I find incredibly interesting. Secondly, working with the people here is simply a great deal of fun.” – Jacco Broere, Data Engineer at Rewire


Sound like your kind of team?

Perfect! If you’re ready to kick-start your career and want to make real impact with data & AI, we’d love to hear from you.

Apply now! And let’s see where this journey takes us.

Questions? Feel free to ask them via talent@rewirenow.com – we’re happy to chat.


Who you are matters to us!

We welcome all applicants – regardless of gender, background, or LGBT+ identity – because diversity and inclusion are core values for us. We are convinced that a diverse and inclusive workplace fosters creativity, innovation, and success.

jobs.title: Senior Staff Engineer, Product Software
jobs.description:
Who are we?

Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, shortening the path to connectivity to enable the innovations that enrich our work, life and planet.

A place where tech thinkers and future builders turn bold ideas into breakthrough experiences, we welcome your unique perspective.

Help us challenge assumptions, uncover bias, and remove barriers—because progress starts with fresh ideas. You’ll find belonging, purpose, and a team that welcomes you—because when you feel valued, you’re empowered to do your best work.

Job Summary

We’re the Software Network Engineering team — Equinix’s orchestration and telemetry platform for network resources on select projects.
Our mission? To empower customers to run enterprise operations on their preferred hardware while managing devices with ease — enabling streamlined deployments in weeks (not months), seamless Fabric and Internet access, and API-driven network management for a more efficient, scalable future.

We deliver orchestration and telemetry through well-defined APIs, ensuring reliability, scalability, and interoperability — all in service of Equinix Digital Services’ goals.

What We Value

  • Asynchronous teamwork – work effectively across time zones

  • Honest communication & feedback – say what matters, listen actively

  • Retrospective mindset – learn, adapt, and improve continuously

  • Openness to perspectives – we thrive on diverse opinions and ideas

Our work sits at the intersection of software development and network infrastructure. We deploy infrastructure as code, orchestrate network devices in production, and follow DevOps best practices to deliver large-scale, high-impact solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and enhance software networking features

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to introduce new capabilities for our customers

  • Provide technical leadership and mentor less experienced engineers

  • Build distributed, scalable, and highly available services with simple APIs

  • Drive simplicity, reliability, and maintainability in production systems

  • Set and champion development and operational best practices

  • Contribute directly to code while influencing long-term technical direction

  • Continuously improve our software development lifecycle, tools, and processes

  • Communicate and document clearly in a remote-first environment

  • Participate in on-call rotations for our services

Qualifications

We’re looking for someone who has:

  • Strong software-defined networking experience

  • Expertise in building resilient, automated, production-ready network software

  • Experience with technologies like VRF, VxLAN, VRRP, BGP, EVPN, gNMI

  • Proficiency in designing distributed services with APIs (gRPC/HTTP)

  • Hands-on experience with Go or other modern programming languages

  • CI/CD expertise and a passion for test automation and fast feedback loops

  • Knowledge of Kubernetes, Docker, and containerized environments

  • Strong analytical skills and ability to solve complex problems

  • Proven ability to evaluate and adjust priorities in a dynamic environment

  • Comfortable working in a team with shared codebases

  • Familiarity with Agile practices and tools (Scrum, Jira, Git, peer review, CI/CD pipelines)

Why Join Us?

  • Work on cutting-edge network orchestration in a team that blends software and infrastructure expertise

  • Make an impact at global scale — your code will power critical infrastructure for enterprise customers worldwide

  • Collaborate with talented engineers who value autonomy, ownership, and continuous learning

  • Enjoy the flexibility of a remote-first environment with async-friendly workflows

  • Be part of a culture where your voice matters — from design discussions to retrospectives

The targeted pay range for this position in the following location is / locations are:

United States - CA Non-Bay Area, AK, CT, DC, IL, MD, MA, NJ, NY, VA, WA : 130,000 - 194,000 USD / Annual

United States - Other posted locations not specifically listed : 118,000 - 176,000 USD / Annual

Our pay ranges reflect the minimum and maximum target for new hire pay for the full-time position determined by role, level, and location.The pay range shown is based on our compensation structure in place at the time of posting and may be updated periodically based on business needs. Individual pay is based on additional factors including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education and/or training.

The targeted pay range listed reflects the base pay only and does not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Employees are eligible for bonus, and equity may be offered depending on the position.

Equinix Benefits

As an employee, you become important to Equinix’s success. We ensure all your benefits are in line with our core values: competitive, inclusive, sustainable, connected and efficient. We keep them competitive within the current marketplace to ensure we’re providing you with the best package possible. So, wherever you are in your career and life, you’ll be able to enhance your experience and bring your whole self to work.

Employee Assistance Program: An Employee Assistance program is available to all employees.

US Benefits: - Insurance: You may enroll in health, life, disability and voluntary plans that are designed for you and your eligible family members. - Retirement: You and Equinix may contribute to a retirement plan to help you plan for your financial future. - Paid Time Off (PTO) and Paid Holidays: You will receive an accrued amount of PTO each pay period along with various paid holidays for you to rest and recharge. Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to specific plan or program terms.

Equinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability. If you are a qualified candidate and need assistance or an accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.

We use artificial intelligence in our hiring process. Learn more here.
jobs.companyDescription: Equinix (Nasdaq: EQIX) is the world’s digital infrastructure company®.

jobs.title: PhD position: Automation & AI for clinical radiology workflow improvement
jobs.description:
Help us bring the promise of AI to clinical radiology. Join our multidisciplinary team to identify bottlenecks in clinical workflows and develop AI-driven automated solutions that improve efficiency and support our clinical teams.
Dit ga je doen


As a researcher you will:

  • Identify and analyse bottlenecks in clinical radiology workflows through observations, structured workflow mapping, and close collaboration with clinical staff.
  • Design, develop, and evaluate AI-based and automated workflow solutions, including training algorithms and preparing solutions for clinical implementation.
  • Assess the impact of your workflow solutions after implementation, determining whether the expected improvements are realized and identify opportunities for further refinement.
  • Develop a robust quality management framework for your AI-solutions, ensuring they can be safely evaluated, validated, and integrated within our clinical environment.
  • Collaborate closely with radiologists, technicians, data scientists, and engineers in a multidisciplinary research team that brings together academic partners (e.g., Utrecht University, Radboud University) and industry partners (e.g., Philips, Kalcio Healthcare).
  • Conduct and publish high-quality scientific research, including studies on workflow optimization, AI application in healthcare, and active participation in conferences.

You will join multidisciplinary projects analysing and enhancing the current liver cancer imaging workflow, with opportunities to address other workflow challenges moving forward.

Hier ga je werken


You will work at the Center for Image Sciences and the Radiology Department of UMC Utrecht. You will join the ImagO PhD Programme and its active PhD community. Your PhD colleagues regularly organize academic and social activities, helping you settle into our environment quickly.

Your role is set in the IMAGINE Open Innovation Lab, a collaboration between multiple institutions and industry partners that integrates clinical expertise with engineering innovation. Together, these partners drive advancements in imaging and image-guided interventions in oncology, cardiology, and other medical domains. The IMAGINE network fosters a truly multidisciplinary approach, enabling rapid innovation and effective translation of research into clinical practice.

Through close collaboration among clinicians, engineers, physicists, and researchers, IMAGINE aims to create personalized treatments that are more precise, less burdensome for patients, and more efficient for healthcare systems. At the same time, the program helps reduce strain on healthcare resources and contributes to lower healthcare costs. IMAGINE also plays a central role in training future-ready professionals within an inspiring and collaborative work environment.Your direct colleagues will include researchers and support staff from diverse backgrounds who share a strong commitment to improving patient outcomes. The team values a supportive, inclusive atmosphere where members inspire and challenge one another.

Dit neem je mee
  • You have a Master’s degree in a relevant field such as Biomedical Engineering, Technical Medicine, (Applied) Physics, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related discipline.
  • You are eager to work in a clinical environment (Radiology) and collaborate closely with clinicians, technicians, engineers, and researchers.
  • You excel at communicating and collaborating with diverse experts, and you deliver clear, well-tailored presentations to both technical and clinical audiences.
  • You are proactive, curious, and capable of working independently as well as in a multidisciplinary team.
  • You have demonstratable programming experience and preferably with data analysis and machine learning (e.g., Python, AI frameworks).
  • You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex clinical processes into structured workflows.
  • A good command of English (spoken and written) is required; Dutch is an asset but not mandatory.
Dit bieden we jou
  • A salary between € 3108 and € 3939 gross per month (salary scale OIO), based on full-time employment (36 hours).
  • A position for a period of 4 years.
  • Year-end bonus of 8.3% and holiday allowance of 8%.
  • Pension insurance with ABP. We take care of approximately 70% of the monthly contribution.
  • 100% public transport reimbursement. Are you coming on foot, by bike or by car? You will then receive a reimbursement of € 0.18 per km (by car up to a max. of 40 km one way).
  • Possibilities to develop yourself personally and professionally.
  • The option to select additional employment benefits in exchange for gross salary, such as purchasing a bicycle and memberships.

jobs.title: Senior Research Software Development Engineer, MSR AI for Science
jobs.description:
Overview


We are on the cusp of a new frontier in which machine learning and artificial intelligence are transforming scientific discovery. We seek to drive major advances in sciences with machine learning, with a focus on ‘fifth paradigm’ scenarios. Through these advances, we aim to empower real-world impact on some of the most pressing problems facing society including climate change, green energy, sustainable materials, and the discovery of new drugs.


AI for Science is a new global team in Microsoft Research focusing on the opportunity to transform scientific modelling and discovery through large-scale deep learning. We aim to advance this frontier and to drive real-world impact at a global scale. The AI for Science team encompasses multiple disciplines across machine learning, engineering, and the natural sciences and spans several sites in Europe.

The field of machine learning has evolved significantly in recent years, with many of the most impactful contributions coming from larger teams of people collaborating closely on well-defined and challenging goals. Furthermore, AI for Science in particular requires a combination of machine learning, engineering, and natural sciences, which again emphasises the importance of collaboration and teamwork.

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior RSDE with expertise in software engineering and distributed systems. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of distributed computing and be proficient in the design, planning, and implementation of tools and technology to support AI-driven scientific research.

To Apply: If you are excited about making a meaningful impact in AI-driven scientific research and possess the skills and experience outlined above, we encourage you to submit your resume. We look forward to reviewing your application!


Responsibilities
  • Architect, design, and implement scalable and robust solutions for machine learning and scientific research involving large volumes of heterogeneous data.
  • Build and optimize distributed data processing and model building pipelines.
  • Develop and maintain tools and technologies for building, training, optimizing, scaling machine learning solutions.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including scientists, researchers, and software engineers.
  • Document and share best practices across the organization.
  • Maintain the highest standards in code quality and software design.

Qualifications


Required:

  • Master's degree or equivalent work experience in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Chemistry, Mathematics or a related field.
  • Strong familiarity with Linux and the open-source ecosystem.
  • Proficient working with large datasets in a cloud or HPC environment.
  • Proficient in building and optimizing distributed systems and large-data applications, including those using tensor accelerators or GPUs.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
  • Passionate about pushing the boundaries of science. Prior experience developing high-performance scientific software is not required, but preferred.
  • Experience with open source machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, ggml, llama.cpp, vllm) is a plus.
  • Experience with Materials Science (in particular Density Functional theory) is a plus.

#Research #AI for Science



This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process.
jobs.companyDescription: Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.

jobs.title: Vice President of GenAI Engineering
jobs.description:
Meet Our Team:

Pegasystems is seeking a VP of Generative AI Engineering to define and lead our enterprise GenAI strategy and product roadmap. In this pivotal leadership role, you will drive the vision, architecture, and execution of AI-powered capabilities that transform how our clients leverage the Pega platform. You'll oversee the end-to-end development lifecycle of GenAI initiatives—from research and prototyping through production deployment—while building and leading a world-class global team of engineers and applied researchers.


As a key technical and strategic leader, you'll partner across Product Engineering, Go-To-Market, and executive stakeholders to embed cutting-edge AI capabilities (including LLM orchestration, RAG, and agentic systems) into enterprise workflows. You'll establish responsible AI governance, drive innovation in AI services, and serve as Pega's primary internal and external engineering evangelist for Generative AI.


This role requires at least 3 days in our Amsterdam office.

Picture Yourself at Pega:

This role requires a seasoned technology executive with deep expertise in AI/ML, proven success launching enterprise-scale AI products, and the ability to balance rapid innovation with enterprise-grade security, compliance, and governance requirements. You'll shape the future of AI-driven workflow automation and deliver measurable business value to global enterprise clients. You have already trialled multiple GenAI technologies in the last 2.5 years understanding the pitfalls and capabilties of different LLMs and approaches.

What You'll Do at Pega:

Strategic Leadership & Roadmap

Define and execute Pega’s Generative AI vision and multi-year technical roadmap aligned with business goals. Identify market opportunities, prioritize investments, and set KPIs and governance for responsible AI. Drive innovation in LLM orchestration, RAG, and agentic architectures.


Engineering, Architecture & Technical Execution

Lead end-to-end development from research to deployment and optimization. Ensure architectural consistency, performance, security, and compliance. Implement best practices for MLOps, model evaluation, prompt management, and observability. Manage vendor ecosystem for cost and risk balance.


Collaboration & Go-To-Market

Serve as GenAI evangelist; partner with Product, Engineering, GTM, and Customer Success to embed AI into workflows. Create reference architectures and enablement assets to accelerate adoption. Align with Legal, Security, and Compliance on responsible AI.


Talent Development

Recruit and mentor a global team across engineering and research. Foster a culture of experimentation and learning. Establish career paths, knowledge sharing, and engineering excellence.


Thought Leadership & Market Engagement

Publish insights on GenAI trends and Pegasystems’ approach. Engage with analysts, academia, and industry leaders. Represent Pegasystems at conferences and in strategic customer dialogues.

Who You Are:

  • 15+ years in software leadership, with 7+ years leading AI/ML initiatives.
  • 5+ years leading AI/ML initiatives with direct experience in Generative AI (LLMs, RAG - chunking, construction technqiues, agentic systems) and NLP. Proven track record launching and scaling AI-powered products/features at enterprise B2B scale.
  • Strong learning curiosity given the fast-moving nature of GenAI. Sees that Pega Blueprint is a game changer.
  • Outstanding ability to drive outcomes rather than be siloed by internal teams.
  • Deep technical expertise with modern AI stacks and enterprise SaaS architectures; strong knowledge of cloud-native deployments (e.g., microservices, Kubernetes, APIs).
  • Experience leading globally distributed engineering teams (50+ members) and driving cross-functional alignment.
  • Strong command of responsible AI, data privacy, security, and model governance in regulated environments.
  • Exceptional communication, executive presence, and stakeholder management; ability to translate complex technology into clear business value.

What You've Accomplished:

Additional Preferred Qualifications

  • Advanced degree (MS or PhD) in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field. Life long learner mindset outweighs academic credentials.
  • Demonstrated experience building research-oriented engineering teams and academic/industry partnerships.
  • Experience establishing MLOps practices, model evaluation frameworks, and AI observability at scale.
  • Familiarity with the AI vendor ecosystem and strategic build/buy/partner decision-making.
  • History of thought leadership (publications, patents, conference speaking) in AI/ML or GenAI.
  • Experience with Pega software.

Pega Offers You:

Pega is THE enterprise AI decisioning and workflow automation platform. Our Agentic orchestration unlocks business transforming outcomes for the World's largest companies. Our mantra of Build for Change® demonstrates our commitment towards continuous improvement, curiosity, and accountable execution. We are at a pivotal moment in our 40+ year history where our employees are empowered to “fuel the change” making their impact count as we excel beyond our Rule of 40 performance. Pega’s culture and values underpin how we work and the results and outcomes we achieve for our employees, clients, partners and investors.


  • Gartner Analyst acclaimed technology leadership across our categories of products
  • Continuous learning and development opportunities
  • An innovative, inclusive, agile, flexible, and fun work environment
  • Competitive global benefits program inclusive of pay + bonus incentive, employee equity in the company


#LI-AR1


AI in Action – Pega embraces the power of artificial intelligence. We encourage all employees to actively engage with AI technologies and continually explore ways to responsibly integrate AI into our products and processes. We may support parts of our recruitment process with automatic processing and, if required by law, you may in such cases have the right to request human intervention, challenge the outcome of such processing and comment on it.

Culture – At Pegasystems, we foster an environment where people feel valued and empowered to contribute their best. With global clients across industries and regions, we know our success depends on the unique perspectives, experiences, and talents of our people. Ours is a workplace where everyone can grow, collaborate, and deliver meaningful outcomes.

We encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences and focus on the core competencies and mindset needed to thrive in a role.

As an Equal Opportunity employer, Pegasystems will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran or disability status, or any other category protected by law.

Export Compliance – For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations such as this, Pegasystems may need to obtain export license approval from the U.S. Government and EU Authorities for certain individuals.

Accommodations – If you require reasonable accommodations under the Americans with Disabilities Act (US only) or comparable regional regulations in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please contact us here or contact (US only) 1-888-PEGA-NOW and/or 225 Wyman Street Waltham, MA 02451 ATTN: Benefits.

jobs.title: Embedded Software Engineer Machine Learning
jobs.description:
Embedded Software Engineer met Machine Learning kennis

Wat ga je doen?

Als Embedded Software Engineer Machine Learning bij 24Beta krijg je de kans om intelligente, zelflerende oplossingen te ontwikkelen voor een breed scala aan hightech (software) producten. Je werkt dicht op de hardware én aan de software daarboven. Je ontwerpt en implementeert slimme softwarearchitecturen waarin embedded software en Machine Learning samenkomen.

Je ontwikkelt robuuste, onderhoudbare en uitbreidbare code, voornamelijk in C++ en C, en waar nodig Python voor data-analyse, modelontwikkeling of tooling. Je past Machine Learning toe op embedded systemen, bijvoorbeeld voor signaalverwerking, patroonherkenning, predictive maintenance, computer vision of edge-AI toepassingen.

Je werkt in innovatieve R&D-teams en test jouw ontwerpen en ML-oplossingen op echte hardware, waarbij je rekening houdt met beperkingen zoals performance, geheugen, latency en energieverbruik. Of je nu geïnteresseerd bent in hightech, automotive, offshore, agrarische technologie, medische technologie of consumentenelektronica: bij 24Beta maak jij direct impact op de slimme producten van de toekomst.

Sluit je aan bij ons en maak het verschil met jouw technische én data-gedreven expertise.

Je werkt met de nieuwste technologieën op het snijvlak van Embedded Software en Machine Learning en draagt bij aan het bouwen van slimme, duurzame oplossingen. Tegelijkertijd ontwikkel je jezelf als engineer én als persoon, met begeleiding van zeer ervaren managers die klaarstaan om je te ondersteunen.

Je bent bezig met het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en testen van software voor microcontrollers en andere embedded systemen, met speciale aandacht voor ML-integratie, prestatie-optimalisatie en energiezuinigheid.

Jouw takenpakket bestaat uit:

  • Het opzetten van de software- en systeemarchitectuur, inclusief ML-componenten
  • Het maken van technische ontwerpen voor embedded systemen met intelligente functionaliteit
  • Het ontwikkelen van embedded software in C en C++ voor microcontroller- en embedded platforms
  • Het ontwikkelen, integreren en optimaliseren van Machine Learning modellen voor embedded/edge omgevingen
  • Het werken met Python voor data-analyse, modeltraining, prototyping en tooling
  • Het integreren van ML-algoritmen met hardware, sensoren en real-time software
  • Het testen en valideren van software en ML-oplossingen op target hardware
  • Het oplossen van bugs en uitvoeren van systeem- en performance-tests
  • Het optimaliseren van prestaties, geheugenverbruik, veiligheid en energie-efficiëntie
  • Uitvoeren van code reviews
  • Onderzoeken en toepassen van de nieuwste technieken en ontwikkelingen op het gebied van Embedded AI en ML

Onze missie

Een omgeving creëren waarin technisch talent floreert en waar duurzame samenwerkingen met opdrachtgevers leiden tot maximale impact.

24Beta is dé plek waar technisch talent en innovatie samenkomen. Met meer dan 40 jaar ervaring binnen technische software engineering bieden we jou als software engineer de kans om te werken aan uitdagende projecten bij de meest vooruitstrevende hightech bedrijven in de Randstad. Daarbij krijg je veel persoonlijke aandacht en optimale carrièrebegeleiding.

Embedded Software Engineering is een ambacht. Als consultant en engineer ben jij dé drijvende kracht achter innovatie.

24Beta is een snelgroeiend bedrijf dat jou de mogelijkheden biedt om jouw talenten te benutten, te groeien én impact te maken.

Sluit je aan bij 24Beta en bouw mee aan een slimmere wereld van morgen.
Solliciteer vandaag nog en bepaal zelf waar jouw carrière naartoe groeit.
Stuur je cv naar recruitment@24beta.nl of neem contact op met Pieter de Leuw voor meer informatie.

aFunctie-eisen

Wat we van jou verwachten:

  • 2–7 jaar ervaring in embedded softwareontwikkeling
  • Sterke kennis van C++ en/of C, en ervaring met Python
  • Ervaring met of aantoonbare interesse in Machine Learning, bijvoorbeeld:
  • klassieke ML-algoritmen
  • embedded/edge AI
  • signal processing, computer vision of data-analyse
  • Afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in een technische richting
  • Ervaring met ontwikkelprocessen zoals Agile/Scrum
  • Inzicht in ontwikkelprincipes zoals OOP, TDD, BDD, SOLID en GRASP
  • Affiniteit met hardware, sensoren en resource-constrained systemen

Wat jij van ons mag verwachten:

  • Een vast contract voor onbepaalde tijd en uitdagende innovatieprojecten
  • Een bovengemiddeld salaris
  • Aantrekkelijke bonusregeling bovenop je maandsalaris
  • Informele bedrijfscultuur waarin je actief kunt meedenken
  • Een community van technische software engineers
  • Onbeperkte mogelijkheden voor (online) trainingen en persoonlijke ontwikkeling
  • Aantrekkelijke mobiliteit-/lease-regeling
  • Maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding
  • Bijdrage aan oudedagsvoorziening volledig vergoed door 24Beta
  • Coaching: jij staat er nooit alleen voor

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime

Verwacht aantal uur: Niet minder dan 32 per week

Screeningsvragen:

  • In bezit van rijbewijs B

Opleiding:

  • HBO (Vereist)

Taal:

  • Nederlands (Vereist)

Werklocatie: Fysiek

jobs.title: AI Engineer
jobs.description:
As an AI Engineer at Terberg Special Vehicles, you’ll work in a multidisciplinary product team on the innovative “Mechanic of the Future” platform.


Your Impact

Do you want to help shape the digital future of our service technicians? You’ll develop, integrate, and maintain advanced AI solutions that directly contribute to more efficient service, improved customer satisfaction, and a future-proof organization. You’ll have the freedom to pioneer, innovate, and truly make a difference within a family-owned company with international ambitions.


What will you do?

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines (batch and real-time) and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines.
  • Integrate and manage data from diverse sources (cloud and on-premises), including setting up vector databases and embedding models.
  • Perform data preprocessing, feature engineering, model training, and evaluation using Python, (No)SQL, (Py)Spark, Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and relevant AI/ML libraries.
  • Fine-tune and evaluate large language models (LLMs) for domain-specific tasks, including prompt engineering.
  • Apply CI/CD, version control, and documentation for structured and reproducible development.
  • Ensure reliable, secure, and compliant data flows and AI models, following governance and ethical AI principles.
  • Monitor and optimize the performance and cost-efficiency of data pipelines and AI models.
  • Collaborate with software engineers, data scientists, product owners, and business stakeholders to deliver high-quality AI solutions.
  • Document model behavior, performance metrics, and decision logic for transparency and reproducibility.

Your Profile

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (Computer Science, Data Science, Software Engineering).
  • At least 3 years of experience as an AI/Data Engineer or similar role.
  • Experience with Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Python, (No)SQL, (Py)Spark, and CI/CD.
  • Knowledge of building and maintaining data pipelines, vector databases, and embedding models.
  • Proactive, independent, and strong communicator; you enjoy working in an agile team and take initiative.
  • Quality, security, and compliance are important to you, and you are always looking for improvement and innovation.

What do we offer?

  • A key role in an innovative team shaping Terberg’s digital transformation.
  • Work at a family-owned company with a friendly atmosphere, short lines of communication, and international ambitions.
  • Friday afternoons off, excellent employment conditions according to the Metal & Technology Collective Labor Agreement.
  • Opportunities for personal development via the Terberg Academy.
  • Hybrid working is possible.
  • Direct influence on the future of our products and services.

As a colleague at Terberg, you will enjoy a great role at one of the most prominent and largest manufacturing companies in the Netherlands. We work from Monday to Friday morning, leaving Friday afternoons free. The atmosphere in our family-owned company is pleasant, and you’ll be part of a motivated team. We value your input, and your ideas are always heard. Staying up-to-date in your field is important to us; you’ll have access to numerous training and growth opportunities through the Terberg Academy. This position comes with an excellent benefits package and we adhere to the Metal and Technology Collective Labor Agreement (CAO).


Is this your dreamjob?

Are you the AI Engineer who will help us make the Mechanic of the Future a reality? Apply directly via our website or contact Bjorn Frank, 0031-6-42 52 27 74 for more information. You can also contact Diederik Stratenus at +31 6 51 49 12 05. We look forward to your contribution to our team!


Terberg Special Vehicles is a global leader in the development, production, and service of specialized vehicles. As a family business, we have been committed to our people for over 150 years! Innovation is our strength, and sustainability is our answer. Since 2014, we have been investing in electrically powered vehicles and are actively testing hydrogen solutions. We aim to care for our environment responsibly so that future generations can also enjoy a good life on our planet.


We do not appreciate acquisition efforts in response to this vacancy. Unsolicited submissions of candidates will not be taken into consideration.
jobs.companyDescription: Royal Terberg Group is wereldwijd actief in de ontwikkeling, productie, modificatie en service van speciale voertuigen en systemen voor logistiek en afvalinzameling.

jobs.title: Lead AI Engineer
jobs.description:
Are you an ambitious Lead AI Engineer ready to bridge the gap between high-level strategy and production-ready code? At Enjins, we apply a software engineering mindset to all things AI - from traditional ML models to modern LLMs and Agentic architectures. As a Lead, you won’t just build; you will coach a talented team of engineers and lead complex GenAI projects in Climate Tech from design to deployment, while playing a defining role in the growth of our Utrecht hub.


About us

Since 2018, we have been engineering AI systems designed to provide long-term and meaningful value. Operating from our offices in Utrecht and Berlin, we partner with innovative tech companies throughout Northwest Europe to solve complex problems. Our client portfolio includes names like Crisp, PlanBlue, NextSense, and Groendus, and we actively prioritize partnerships within Climate Tech where our technology delivers a measurable, positive impact.

At our core, we are engineers first, prioritizing clean code, MLOps best practices, and system reliability over academic novelty. We remain deeply committed to building trustworthy and explainable AI. When you join us, you become part of a high-performing, growth-oriented team of expert engineers who value collaboration, continuous learning, and knowledge sharing.


What? [You'll be doing]

As a Lead AI Engineer, you will work at the intersection of technical mastery and strategic leadership. You will act as a hands-on lead in a consultancy context, embedded within client teams while managing a portfolio of accounts and mentoring the next generation of Enjins engineers.


Key responsibilities:

  • Team Leadership: Lead the AI Engineering team alongside other Leads, fostering a culture of technical excellence and pragmatic innovation.
  • Project Delivery: Own the end-to-end technical roadmap for client projects, ensuring AI/ML systems are scalable, reliable, and production-ready.
  • Strategic Advisory: Act as a technical partner for client executives (CTO, CEO, CIO), translating complex AI architectures into clear business value.
  • Operational Growth: Involve yourself in business-critical decisions regarding team growth, innovation roadmaps, and account management.

Requirements

We are looking for seasoned leaders who thrive on solving "unsolvable" problems with clean, scalable code.

Expertise & Skills

  • Experience: Minimum of 3–5 years of relevant experience as AI/ML Engineer in a consultancy context, with a proven track record of bringing models to production.
  • Technical Stack: Deep expertise in Python, SQL, and Git, with hands-on experience in containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and ETL/ELT orchestration.
  • Cloud & MLOps: Mastery of at least one major cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP) and experience spearheading MLOps/LLMOps architectures.
  • Leadership: Experience in coaching engineers, managing project delivery, and managing client accounts.


Mindset & Approach ✨

  • Consultative Leader: Comfortable engaging with board-level stakeholders to drive results and define AI strategy.
  • Pragmatic Engineer: You prioritize "production-ready" over "academic hype" and have a passion for Climate Tech impact.
  • Communicator: Excellent ability to translate complex technical findings into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.


Requirements

  • Fluent in English and eligible to work in the Netherlands.

Benefits

We invest heavily in your leadership journey, ensuring you remain at the technical forefront while growing as a business leader.

Accelerate your Growth & Development

  • M-Leap Journey: A structured leadership learning journey (mentoring, learning, and practice) with a dedicated budget for advanced certifications, and a specialised program for our Seniors.
  • C-Level Coaching: Regular 1-on-1 mentoring sessions with our founders and C-level team to support your growth toward senior leadership.
  • Transparent Reviews: A 360-degree feedback process and project-based assessments to ensure continuous professional evolution.


Innovation & Work Environment ️

  • Modern Workspace: Work from our office centrally located in Utrecht along the picturesque Oudegracht. (Note: Our office is not yet fully accessible to individuals with physical disabilities).
  • Top-tier Tools: Receive an Apple MacBook Pro and the latest tools to do your best work.
  • Competitive Salary: A monthly gross salary ranging indicative from €5.500 to €7.000, but depending on your experience and expertise. This base salary indication excludes holiday allowance, pension contributions, performance bonus, equity and benefits related to M-Leap's collective and personal investments.
  • Performance Bonus: An annual bonus equivalent to 1,5 months’ salary, specifically designed to recognise and value your individual contribution to our yearly success.
  • Equity Incentive: Inclusion in our VSOP (Virtual Stock Option Plan), giving you the potential to share in the long-term growth and financial upside of the company.


Work-life Balance & Culture

  • Time Off: 28 total vacation days (including flexibility for 3 national holidays).
  • Team Spirit: Monthly social events, from themed parties and sports tournaments to pub quizzes.
  • Sustainability: OV-First (Public Transport) travel policy fully covering your commute and meat-free catering during events.

jobs.title: UX Researcher
jobs.description:
32-36 uur | vanaf € 4.400,- | Den Haag (Hybride)


Lefebvre Sdu is dé toonaangevende kennispartner voor professionals in de juridische en fiscale sector. We transformeren van een traditionele uitgever naar een AI-first kennisplatform. Met GenIA-L, onze AI-platform, brengen we innovatieve oplossingen die professionals helpen om slimmer en sneller te werken. We zijn onderdeel van de internationale Lefebvre Group en werken vanuit Nederland aan cutting-edge technologie voor de legal tech markt.

Als UX Researcher ben je cruciaal in het vormgeven van gebruikerservaringen die complexe juridische en fiscale informatie toegankelijk maken. Je werkt nauw samen met product owners, designers, en AI engineers om inzichten te verzamelen die onze producten naar een hoger niveau tillen. Je onderzoekt hoe professionals in de praktijk werken en vertaalt dat naar concrete product verbeteringen.

Wat ga je doen?

  • Opzetten en uitvoeren van kwalitatief en kwantitatief gebruikersonderzoek (interviews, usability tests, surveys, data-analyse)
  • Onderzoeken hoe gebruikers omgaan met AI-gestuurde tools en interfaces
  • Samenwerken met het product team om research roadmaps te ontwikkelen
  • Vertalen van gebruikersinzichten naar concrete aanbevelingen en requirements
  • Opbouwen en onderhouden van user personas, journey maps en andere UX deliverables
  • Adviseren van stakeholders over UX best practices en onderzoeksresultaten
  • Bijdragen aan een data-driven product cultuur

Wat breng je mee?

  • Minimaal 3-5 jaar ervaring als UX Researcher
  • Sterke kennis van diverse onderzoeksmethoden (zowel kwalitatief als kwantitatief)
  • Ervaring met het onderzoeken van complexe, professionele software (B2B)
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met het presenteren van research uitkomsten aan stakeholders
  • Affiniteit met AI/ML toepassingen is een grote plus
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels
  • Je bent analytisch, nieuwsgierig en gebruikersgericht

Wat bieden wij?

Je krijgt een sleutelrol in de AI transformatie van een gerenommeerde organisatie. Je zal werken met state-of-the-art technologie en AI-toepassingen. We zijn een gedreven team van 15 specialisten dat snel groeit in een competitieve markt. Dat betekent veel autonomie en impact, maar ook ambiguïteit. Als je behoefte hebt aan duidelijke processen en volledig uitgewerkte briefs, is dit (nog) niet de juiste plek. Als je energie krijgt van meebouwen en dingen beter maken, wel.

Praktisch

  • Marktconform salaris
  • 36-urige werkweek
  • Eindejaarsuitkering en winstdeling
  • Persoonlijk keuzebudget (extra verlof, flexibel vakantiegeld)
  • MacBook en tooling naar keuze
  • Learning & Development budget
  • Hybride werken mogelijk (maar we zijn wel op kantoor voor samenwerking)
  • Kantoor in Den Haag (op loopafstand station Voorburg)

Klaar voor jouw start?

Top! Reageer dan snel en simpel via de solliciteer-knop! Heb je nog vragen dan kun je contact opnemen met Liza Kleijberg via sollicitatie@sdu.nl

Let op:

  • Wij nemen alleen sollicitanten aan die in Nederland wonen.
  • Wij werken zonder tussenkomst of hulp van werving- en selectiebureaus. Als wij daar toch gebruik van maken, werken wij samen met vaste leveranciers.

Over Lefebvre Sdu

Welkom bij Lefebvre Sdu. Hier zit je goed. Waarom? Omdat jouw ambitie, talent en inzet hier maximaal op hun plek zijn. Samen met het team bouw je elke dag aan vernieuwing. Met jullie krachten en ervaring brengen jullie complexe materie tot leven met innovatieve tools, producten en oplossingen. Door slimme integraties van content, data en technologie maken jullie wet- en regelgeving toegankelijk en toepasbaar. Zodat professionals die hiermee werken iedere dag succesvoller worden. Daar wordt de maatschappij ook nog eens beter van. Dat klinkt toch als de ideale werkomgeving?

Meer over Lefebvre Sdu
