jobs.title: Product Owner - AI-Driven Content Engineering
jobs.description:
32-36 uur | vanaf € 5.400,- | Den Haag (Hybride)


Bij Lefebvre Sdu zijn we volop bezig met een transformatie: van traditionele juridische en fiscale uitgever naar een AI-first knowledge platform. Met GenIA-L bouwen we aan de toekomst van juridische intelligence, waarbij hoogwaardige content centraal staat.

Wij zoeken een TechnicalProduct Owner met data science DNA die niet alleen de brug slaat tussen content en technologie, maar vooral zelf de eerste prototypes bouwt die laten zien hoe we met AI slimmere, schaalbare content pipelines kunnen creëren.

Wat ga je doen?

1. AI Model Development & Integration (60% van je tijd)

  • Je identificeert kansen waar AI/ML modellen het content proces kunnen verbeteren.
  • Je bouwt zelf MVPs en proof-of-concepts met Python, scikit-learn, transformers, LangChain om te valideren wat werkt.
  • Je experimenteert met verschillende modellen en evalueert hun performance op echte content data.
  • Je werkt samen met het AI-engineeringteam om succesvolle modellen in productie te brengen.

2. Content Process Innovation (30%)

  • Je werkt samen met redacties en experts om te begrijpen waar AI de grootste waarde kan toevoegen.
  • Je definieert samen met stakeholders wat 'goede' content is voor AI-verwerking.
  • Je ontwikkelt metrics en dashboards om content kwaliteit en AI-performance te monitoren en bouwt workflows waarin menselijke expertise en AI elkaar versterken.

3. Product Ownership & Stakeholder Management (10%)

  • Je vertaalt technische mogelijkheden naar business value voor niet-technische stakeholders.
  • Je prioriteert experimenten op basis van potentiële impact.
  • Je beheert verwachtingen en communiceert over wat wel/niet mogelijk is.

Wat breng je mee?

  • Data science background: minimaal 3-5 jaar ervaring als data scientist waarbij je zelf modellen hebt gebouwd en in productie gebracht
  • Hands-on mindset: je schrijft zelf Python code en kunt snel prototypes bouwen
  • AI/ML toolkit: ervaring met LLMs, NLP, text classification, embeddings, retrieval systems
  • 0-to-1 mentaliteit: je vindt het leuk om dingen van scratch op te bouwen zonder perfecte requirements
  • Business savvy: je snapt waarom dingen waarde moeten leveren en bent niet alleen aan het experimenteren
  • Je bent een sterke communicator, data-driven en ondernemend
  • Je bent Data-driven
  • Je bent ondernemend en praktisch
  • Een Uitstekende beheersing van Nederlands en Engels, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk
  • Je bent comfortabel in een omgeving die volop in transformatie is
  • HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau (bij voorkeur technische richting)

Wat bieden wij?

  • Een unieke rol waarin je zowel strategisch denkt als hands-on bouwt aan AI-oplossingen
  • De kans om van scratch MVPs te ontwikkelen en deze door te laten groeien naar productie
  • Een sleutelrol in de AI-transformatie van een traditionele uitgever naar een toonaangevend knowledge platform
  • Nauw samenwerken met een sterk team van AI engineers en data scientists
  • Werken aan producten die door duizenden juridische professionals dagelijks worden gebruikt
  • Ruimte voor experimenteren en innoveren met cutting-edge AI-technologie
  • Hybride werken met flexibiliteit in tijd en plaats
  • Uitstekende primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden

Klaar voor jouw start?

Top! Reageer dan snel en simpel via de solliciteer-knop! Heb je nog vragen dan kun je contact opnemen met Koen Aarns via sollicitatie@sdu.nl

Let op:

  • Wij nemen alleen sollicitanten aan die in Nederland wonen.
  • Wij werken zonder tussenkomst of hulp van werving- en selectiebureaus. Als wij daar toch gebruik van maken, werken wij samen met vaste leveranciers.

Over Lefebvre Sdu

Welkom bij Lefebvre Sdu. Hier zit je goed. Waarom? Omdat jouw ambitie, talent en inzet hier maximaal op hun plek zijn. Samen met het team bouw je elke dag aan vernieuwing. Met jullie krachten en ervaring brengen jullie complexe materie tot leven met innovatieve tools, producten en oplossingen. Door slimme integraties van content, data en technologie maken jullie wet- en regelgeving toegankelijk en toepasbaar. Zodat professionals die hiermee werken iedere dag succesvoller worden. Daar wordt de maatschappij ook nog eens beter van. Dat klinkt toch als de ideale werkomgeving?

jobs.title: Experienced AI Engineer
jobs.description:
At ML6, we believe in using the full potential of artificial intelligence to spark innovation, increase efficiency, accelerate growth, and create lasting impact.

Our mission is clear: ensure that the next wave of technological breakthroughs drives progress not just for businesses, but for humanity as a whole. We bring AI ambitions to life.

As a senior, you take up a tech lead role on a per-project basis, and lead your more junior colleagues in both the technical and client-facing aspects of a project. Internally, you take a leading role in driving forward the company’s technical capabilities and client offerings.

YOUR IMPACT

  • Design & Build Innovative AI: Architect and implement end-to-end ML solutions, from data engineering to deploying sophisticated models (including TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Generative AI systems) and deploy them on all major cloud providers (GCP, AWS, Azure).
  • Engineer agentic systems and complex workflows using advanced prompt engineering techniques.
  • Guide Projects to Success: Lead your team's projects, ensuring high-quality delivery and translating client business needs into clear technical roadmaps.
  • Mentor & Empower the Team: Act as a technical guide for other engineers, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and coaching them to grow their skills.
  • Partner Across the Business: Collaborate with our sales team to explore and shape exciting new client opportunities, lending your technical expertise to the conversation.

WHY YOU

  • 4+ years of work experience with Machine Learning and software development, with proficiency in Python and Cloud (AWS, Azure or GCP).
  • A proven ability to lead technical projects and guide fellow engineers with a coaching mindset.
  • A degree in computer science or a related field.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with a talent for explaining complex technical ideas to clients and non-technical stakeholders in a clear, structured way.
  • Familiarity with MLOps principles and a passion for building robust, scalable systems.

We're actively building a diverse team with a broad range of skills and backgrounds. This job description is a starting point, if you're passionate about this role and eager to learn, we strongly encourage you to apply.

WHY ML6

At ML6, our 'people first' culture is how we bring innovation to life. We've built a place where we truly love working, and we think you will too. Here’s what you can expect:

  • Lead with Impact: Your work will directly deliver value to our clients and contribute to positive change.
  • Growth & Learning: We invest in your development with opportunities to work on diverse, challenging projects, dedicated learning tracks & opportunities and clear opportunities for advancement.
  • A Culture of Trust: Thrive in an inclusive environment built on trust and transparent communication, where every voice is heard and valued.
  • Rewarding You: We offer an attractive salary package and an optimized benefits program that reflects your expertise and impact. You can view our rewarding philosophy and offerings here.

Job Type: Full-time

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • 1011 EM Amsterdam, Netherlands: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Work authorization:

  • Nederland (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 1011 EM Amsterdam, Netherlands

jobs.title: Azure Solution Architect (Data & AI)
jobs.description:
How you can make your mark

Make your mark as an Azure Solution Architect at Boskalis!

As the Azure Solution Architect for Data and AI, you are responsible for architecting, designing, and overseeing initiatives within the IT Data Services team, which consists of three sub-teams: Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, and AI.

You act as a key liaison between IT Data Services and other operational IT teams, including Infrastructure Platform Operations and Cyber Risk Management, ensuring secure, scalable, and compliant solutions.

The mission of IT Data Services is to maximize the value of data and AI across Boskalis. We are building a robust data platform based on data products and data pipelines, supported by modern Azure landing zone principles. On this foundation, we develop BI and AI solutions using Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, Azure Databricks, a proprietary Boskalis AI chatbot, and an Azure Digital Twin solution for real-time project monitoring, simulations, and intelligent automation.

Your responsibilities Azure Solution Architect

  • Design, own, and evolve the end-to-end Azure architecture for data, BI, and AI platforms.
  • Define architectural standards, patterns, and best practices aligned with Azure landing zone principles.
  • Translate business needs into scalable, secure, and future-proof solution architectures.
  • Guide and review solution designs from data engineers, BI developers, and AI engineers.
  • Architect and oversee:
    • Data platforms and pipelines (e.g. lakehouse, streaming, batch processing).
    • BI architectures using Power BI and Microsoft Fabric.
    • AI solutions using Azure Databricks and MLOps practices.
    • Azure Digital Twin solutions integrated with simulation software and real-time events.
  • Ensure solutions comply with security, privacy, and governance requirements in close cooperation with Cyber Risk Management.
  • Collaborate with Infrastructure Platform Operations on networking, identity, connectivity, and platform services.
  • Support teams with architectural decision-making during implementation and delivery.
  • Stay up to date with Azure, data, BI, and AI developments, and actively introduce innovations where valuable.
  • Contribute to roadmap development for the Data & AI platform at Boskalis.
  • Act as a technical sparring partner for stakeholders across IT and the business.

Your qualities and experience
You can move ahead as an Azure Solution Architect if you have:

  • At least 2,5 years of relevant work experience.
  • Proven experience as a Solution Architect in complex enterprise environments.
  • Strong hands-on and architectural experience with Microsoft Azure, including:
    • Azure Data services (e.g. Azure Data Lake, Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, Microsoft Fabric).
    • Azure Databricks.
    • Azure AI services.
    • Azure networking, identity (Entra ID), and security concepts.
  • Solid understanding of data engineering, BI, and AI/ML architectures.
  • Experience designing data platforms based on data products and domain-oriented approaches is a plus.
  • Familiarity with Power BI and transition paths to Microsoft Fabric.
  • Experience with Digital Twin, simulation, or event-driven architectures is an advantage.
  • Knowledge of DevOps / DataOps / MLOps practices.

Skills & Competencies

  • Strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
  • Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong stakeholder management and collaboration skills.
  • Able to balance strategic vision with pragmatic, hands-on decision-making.
  • Fluent in English (spoken and written).

We offer

What you can expect

  • A dynamic environment: A job that allows you to collaborate with a talented team of experts from different backgrounds and contribute to making a significant impact.
  • Rewarding conditions: A competitive salary and much more, including holiday allowance, holiday entitlement of 26 days (based on a full-time contract) and a number of collective scheduled days off, a non-contributory pension scheme, collective schemes such as company health insurance and travel allowance.
  • Career development: We offer you plenty of opportunities to bring out the best in yourself for example through (online) courses at our Boskalis academy.
  • The Boskalis campus: Experience the unique Boskalis vibe at our Papendrecht site, complete with restaurants, sports field, and a wharf where our vessels dock. We offer a state-of-the-art auditorium, brainstorming rooms, experience center for client meetings, and a barista corner where you can connect with colleagues.
  • Young Boskalis: Are you under 36? Come and join Young Boskalis! Have fun and join in social and sports activities ranging from pub quizzes to yoga, bootcamps and an annual sailing boat race. Networking and knowledge sharing are a vital part of Young Boskalis as well.

Extra information

  • Your team: You will work within the IT Data Services team together with 16 colleagues working in the data, BI, and AI teams. You will report to the Manager IT Data Services.
  • Where you will work: For office-based roles, in consultation with your manager and your team, you work partly at home and partly in the office.
  • Full/part-time job: The position of Azure Solution Architect is a full-time job (40 hours a week).
  • Next steps: Apply easily by completing the online application form. Interviews are held online or in the office. Once it’s clear we’re a good match, we’ll make you an offer – and look forward to welcoming you to the company.

About Boskalis

Working at Boskalis is about creating new horizons and sustainable solutions. In a world where population growth, an increase of global trade, demand for (new) energy and climate change are driving forces, we challenge you to make your mark in finding innovative and relevant solutions for complex infrastructural and marine projects.

Interested?

We’ll be happy to answer your questions about the position of Azure Solution Architect. Please contact Robert Smits, senior corporate recruiter via 078-696 83 98

Please note: Boskalis never requests a financial contribution to arrange visas or other documents related to a job vacancy. Be wary of individuals who pretend to be our recruiters and do ask for such contributions.

Disclaimer for Recruiters and Recruitment Agencies
We appreciate your interest in our vacancies and understand that your candidate might be enthusiastic about this exciting opportunity. However, our recruitment process is not structured this way, at Boskalis we handle recruitment ourselves. There fore we do not accept unsolicited applications or CVs from recruitment agencies. Any submission will be treated as a direct application.

#LI-RS1

jobs.title: AI Automation Engineer / AI Systems Builder
jobs.description:
Locatie: flexibel / hybride
Dienstverband: fulltime (32–40 uur)

Bouw jij AI omdat je niet anders kunt?

Ben jij iemand die liever iets werkends oplevert dan er een PowerPoint over maakt? En krijg je energie van slimme automatisering, data en schaalbare systemen die échte impact maken?

Dan pas je waarschijnlijk goed bij LUCRATIEF.

Wij zoeken een AI Automation Engineer die samen met ons AI-systemen bouwt die processen versnellen, kosten besparen en bedrijven slimmer laten werken.

Wat ga je doen?

Bij LUCRATIEF werk je aan concrete AI-oplossingen voor ons eigen bedrijf en een beperkt aantal klanten. Geen eindeloze trajecten, maar: bouwen, testen en live zetten.

Je houdt je onder andere bezig met:

  • Bouwen van AI-oplossingen met Python, JavaScript, LLM’s en machine learning
  • Automatiseren en optimaliseren van bedrijfsprocessen
  • Ontwerpen van slimme workflows (o.a. RAG, agents, decision support)
  • Werken met data: structureren, opschonen, analyseren en toepassen
  • Bouwen en beheren van n8n / Zapier workflows (webhooks, routers, data transforms)
  • Integreren met externe tools via API’s (OAuth2, rate limits, retries)
  • Inrichten van logging, monitoring en alerts
  • Werken met klantdata volgens AVG/GDPR (security, secrets & permissions)
  • Meedenken over wat wel en niet gebouwd moet worden (business first)
  • Systemen schaalbaar, onderhoudbaar en productie-klaar maken

Je werkt in een klein, scherp AI-team met korte lijnen. Iedereen die hier zit, bouwt.

Hoe wij werken

  • Lean & mean (geen vergadercultuur, geen onzin)
  • Focus op impact en winstgevendheid
  • Alles wat we bouwen draait in productie
  • Continu verbeteren (technisch én inhoudelijk)
  • Veel vrijheid, met bijbehorend eigenaarschap

Wat verwachten we van jou? (Must-haves)

  • Goede kennis van Python en/of JavaScript
  • Begrip van AI / ML / LLM’s en ervaring met toepassen ervan
  • Je kunt zelfstandig oplossingen uitzoeken en bouwen
  • Ervaring met automations (n8n, Zapier of vergelijkbaar)
  • Ervaring met API-koppelingen
  • Basiskennis van productie-omgevingen: error handling, retries, logging, version control (Git)
  • Comfortabel met JSON, webhooks en databases/spreadsheets
  • Je denkt in oplossingen, niet in beperkingen
  • Nieuwsgierig en continu bezig met leren

Nice-to-haves (geen dealbreakers)

  • Ervaring met LLM’s, RAG en vector databases
  • Kennis van PyTorch, scikit-learn of vergelijkbare libraries
  • Ervaring met cloud (AWS / Azure) en/of Docker
  • Affiniteit met processen, automatisering en businesslogica

Opleiding? Leuk als je die hebt, niet verplicht. Wij kijken naar wat je kunt, niet naar je diploma.

Wat bieden wij?

  • Werken aan echte AI-systemen met echte impact
  • Veel vrijheid in hoe je problemen oplost
  • Klein team met hoge technische standaard
  • Ruimte om te experimenteren én te shippen
  • Marktconform salaris, afhankelijk van je ervaring
  • Flexibel werken (locatie en tijden in overleg)
  • Meegroeien met een bedrijf dat AI serieus neemt

Waarom LUCRATIEF?

Omdat wij:

  • AI zien als gereedschap, niet als hype
  • Geen consultants zijn, maar bouwers
  • Snappen dat slimme systemen geld moeten opleveren

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime

Salaris: €3.000,00 - €5.000,00 per maand

Verwacht aantal uur: 24 – 40 per week

Arbeidsvoorwaarden:

  • Auto van de zaak
  • Bedrijfsfeesten
  • Dienstreizen vergoeding
  • Fietsplan
  • Kosteloos parkeren
  • Mogelijkheid tot promotie
  • Reiskostenvergoeding
  • Vrijdagmiddagborrel
  • Werk vanuit huis

Werklocatie: Hybride werken in 3454 Utrecht

jobs.title: Android Full-stack AI Engineer
jobs.description:
About Fairphone

Fairphone is more than just a company - we are a global leader in sustainable, modular electronics, on a mission to change the electronics industry from the inside out. Built on strong social and environmental values, we are a diverse and inclusive team from all walks of life creating market consumer electronics that make a real impact.

At Fairphone, you will find a supportive and safe space where everyone can be themselves, collaborate openly, and have the freedom to learn and grow - because that’s how we innovate and drive change together!

So… are you a proactive, self-motivated team player who loves taking initiative and bringing positive energy? Do you thrive in a fast-moving start-up or scale-up environment? Are you a great communicator who values collaboration and embraces different perspectives? And most importantly, do you feel a strong connection to Fairphone’s mission and values? If you're nodding along and thinking, “Yes, that’s me!”, then check out our vacancy below!

Please know that we acknowledge that we are living in a time where the use of AI can bring many efficiencies and support. However, we want to know the real YOU. Please try to limit the use of AI tools to generate answers to the application; we value authenticity and encourage you to use your creativity!

  • Location: Amsterdam (you should have the right to work in the Netherlands)

  • Hours: 32-40 hours per week

  • Contract duration: 6 months

  • Deadline to apply: We review applications on a rolling basis. Please apply as soon as possible.

About your role

This is a unique opportunity to join our Software Engineering team, where you will be instrumental in developing cutting-edge, full-stack predictive maintenance features for our acclaimed mobile phones. You will drive the creation of sophisticated, data-driven systems designed to preemptively detect and mitigate hardware or software issues. This role signifies a critical strategic shift for Fairphone, moving the maintenance paradigm from reactive fixing to proactive, intelligent intervention, which will directly enhance the longevity and reliability of Fairphone devices, contributing measurably to our mission of building a more sustainable future for mobile technology.

Your profile


  • You feel a strong and intrinsic connection with Fairphone’s vision, mission and values.

  • You are hands-on, take initiative and see opportunities where others see issues, and apply them via constructive, creative thinking.

  • You love technical challenges.

  • You embrace diversity in thoughts, opinions, levels of seniority and backgrounds and feel good working with many nationalities in a multicultural environment.

  • You are passionate about improving the quality of our software. A small fix delivered to many people has a big impact.

Key Responsibilities & Objectives

  • Designing and developing new features for predictive maintenance for the Android platform to anticipate hardware failures (e.g., battery degradation, storage corruption, overheating), software glitches, or performance bottlenecks.

  • Architect, implement, and maintain the end-to-end stack—from the device kernel (data acquisition) to the cloud (model training/serving) and the Android application (user feedback/alerts).

  • Utilise real-time device data, advanced analytics, and machine learning models to accurately anticipate potential failures, degradation, or performance bottlenecks before they impact the user experience.

  • Take ownership of both the Android (Frontend) components, including user-facing predictive diagnostics and actionable insights, and the Backend infrastructure (Microservices) necessary for large-scale data ingestion, model serving, and continuous learning.

  • Clean and manage large datasets for model training.

  • Version, track, package, and deploy models into a production environment, treating ML models as first-class citizens in a CI/CD pipeline.

  • Unit and integration testing code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability.

  • Bug fixing and improving application performance.

  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.

  • Working with data sources and APIs.

  • Continuously discovering, evaluating, and implementing new technologies to maximise development efficiency.

Your Skills & Experience

  • Proven software development experience in Android front-end and back-end development.

  • You are a programmer and are comfortable with Kotlin.

  • You know about Compose.

  • Deep knowledge of the Android SDK.

  • Experience with working on Android framework and server-side technologies with Spring Framework.

  • Theoretical and practical knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms, Deep Learning concepts, and Neural Network Architectures.

  • Familiarity with major AI/ML Frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.

  • Experience with Large Language Models (LLMs), including using and integrating APIs, and applying techniques like Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)

  • You have experience/knowledge with working in an agile environment.

  • You have experience/knowledge working with software development tools such as Git, Gerrit, Gitlab and Jenkins.

  • Excellent debugging skills to solve challenging problems.

  • Experience working with remote data via REST, JSON and XML.

  • Experience with third-party libraries and APIs.

  • A solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle.

  • You appreciate Free and Open Source software and want to collaborate with the community.

What Fairphone can offer you?

  • The opportunity to create an impact on the electronics industry around the world.

  • A diverse work environment full of international, passionate, warm-hearted team members.

  • 25 paid holidays per year (based on a full-time contract) next to the other public holidays in the Netherlands. You’ll also get a day off on your birthday! Additionally, the longer you stay, the more holidays you get!

  • Daily, healthy lunch, organic FairChain coffee, and many more tasty things.

  • You will join Fairphone’s collective pension scheme, and we will contribute to building your pension.

  • You will receive a MacBook, Fairbuds, and a Fairphone as working devices.

  • Hybrid working model - We are remote-friendly, and you can work up to 60% of your time per month from home or any other location you want. We also contribute up to €250 for your home office set-up.

  • Public transport allowance – we fully cover your 2nd class commute from your home to the office

  • Bike allowance – We support you with a bike purchase of up to €300, and you’ll also have a yearly repair budget of up to €100! We also cover 23 cents per km for your biking distance from home to the office (or train station) and back!

  • Grow with us! We encourage you to develop at Fairphone. That’s why we’ll support your career goals with coaching (Inuka), trainings, workshops, or courses that you can join with your development budget.

  • Kitchen with beautiful views to the IJ waterfront.

  • There’s a gym and recreation and yoga rooms in the building where you can build healthy habits, stay active and have fun with your colleagues, as well as a subscription to our mental & physical well-being services (Inuka & Urban Sports)

About us

DEI @Fairphone

At Fairphone, we care about people, planet and you. It’s natural that we see diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) as an essential part of how we work together and do business.


We support and further strengthen our inclusive work environment and culture by more formally implementing various DEI efforts to ensure all Fairphoners feel included, respected, and supported.

jobs.title: PhD Position in Foundation Model for Architectural Engineering
jobs.description:
PhD Position in Foundation Model for Architectural Engineering

Challenge: Developing novel representation and foundation model for architectural engineering subjects.

Change: Advancing human-in-the-loop systems of architectural engineering knowledge tasks, with a focus on enhanced digital-human agency in design, engineering and construction coordination.

Impact: Enhancing adaptability and scalability of AI models in building engineering.


Job description


We are seeking a highly motivated PhD candidate to pioneer the integration of architectural knowledge and logic directly into the latent manifold of Generative AI. This position operates at the cutting edge of AI and the Built Environment, challenging you to architect a native Multimodal Foundation Model for Architectural Engineering designed for "Constraint-to-BIM (Building Information Modelling)" synthesis. You will investigate how deep neural networks can internalize complex building dynamics (e.g., structural load paths, material thermodynamics) and regulatory logic (e.g., zoning envelopes) as native languages, facilitating rigorous, carbon-centric decision-making. If you are driven to transcend generic, task-agnostic generation and advance frontier AI toward structurally and functionally viable design, join us in defining this new scientific paradigm.


Your core research will target three novel frontiers: (1) heterogeneous input encoding, where you will develop architectures to unify disparate modalities into a coherent embedding space; (2) causal chain-of-thought, engineering mechanisms for the model to manage long-horizon dependencies in construction sequencing and system-level planning; and (3) constraint-aware latent reasoning, innovating tokenization strategies that semantically bind geometric primitives with performance constraints to ensure "construction-valid" generation. You will apply parameter-efficient fine-Tuning (e.g., low-rank adaptation) to an open-source Multimodal Foundation Model (MMLM) for domain-specific adaptation, combining it with novel pretraining objectives (e.g., topology-preserving loss, consistency-based self-supervision) to overcome engineering data scarcity and enable autonomous reasoning for tasks such as structural integrity, HVAC routing, and climate-adaptive design.


You will work within an interdisciplinary ecosystem of domain experts and stakeholders from industry and the public sector. A critical component of your work will be establishing rigorous evaluation protocols to probe the model's physics-consistency and logic-adherence, moving the field beyond standard perceptual metrics. Your contributions will define the state-of-the-art through publications in leading AI and built-environment venues, the release of open benchmarks for architectural reasoning, and the formulation of methodological guidelines for reliable domain-specific foundation models. Ultimately, your research will deliver a unified native foundation model, providing the multi-level disciplinary intelligence essential for the early-stage development of sustainable, high-performance buildings.


Requirements

  • You hold an MSc in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science or Architectural Engineering (with strong computational focus), demonstrating a solid portfolio at the intersection of Deep Learning and geometric/physical data.
  • You have a keen interest and/or experience in large-scale model architectures, specifically focusing on self-supervised learning, latent space alignment, or multimodal representation learning.
  • You have solid programming skills (e.g. Python) and are familiar with modern ML frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
  • You are motivated to work with complex and heterogeneous AEC (Architecture, Engineering, and Construction) data.
  • You possess hands-on experience in at least one of the following frontier areas: Geometric Deep Learning (GNNs, 3D-CNNs), Computer Vision, or Vision-Language Models (VLMs).
  • You have excellent scientific communication skills in English and a driven ambition to publish high-impact research in top-tier AI and Built Environment venues.
  • You thrive in bridging disciplines, capable of working translating complex problems into potential solutions and collaborating effectively with domain experts and industry stakeholders.


TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)

Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.


At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.


Challenge. Change. Impact!


Faculty Architecture & the Built Environment

The Faculty of Architecture and the Built Environment has a leading role in education and research worldwide. The driving force behind the faculty’s success is its robust research profile combined with the energy and creativity of its student body and academic community. It is buzzing with energy from early in the morning until late at night, with four thousand people studying, working, designing, conducting research and acquiring and disseminating knowledge. Our faculty has a strong focus on 'design-oriented research’, which has given it a top position in world rankings.


Staff and students are working to improve the built environment with the help of a broad set of disciplines, including architectural design, urban planning, building technology, social sciences, process management, and geo-information science. The faculty works closely with other faculties, universities, private parties, and the public sector, and has an extensive network in the Netherlands as well as internationally.


about this role, please contact Dr ir. Pei-Yu Wu, Assistant Professor, via +31 (0)634115402 or p.y.wu@tudelft.nl or Dr ir. Michela Turrin, Associate Professor, via +31 (0)62921839 or m.turrin@tudelft.nl.


For information about the application procedure, please contact Paulien Stastra, HR advisor, e-mail: recruitment-BK@tudelft.nl.


Application procedure

Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply before 25 January 2026 (local Dutch time + 2 hrs) upload:

  • Motivation letter (maximum 1 page) addressing your interests and describing how your experience and plans fit with the position.

  • Detailed CV.

  • Undergraduate and graduate transcripts.

  • The names of two references, with contact information (letters not required at this stage).



Please address you application to Dr.ir. Pei-Yu Wu, Assistant Professor at the Digital Technology Section at the Department of Architectural Engineering and Technology.


The initial interviews will take place in mid-Februay 2026.

Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.


Please note:

  • You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.

  • As part of knowledge security, TU Delft conducts a risk assessment during the recruitment of personnel. We do this, among other things, to prevent the unwanted transfer of sensitive knowledge and technology. The assessment is based on information provided by the candidates themselves, such as their motivation letter and CV, and takes place at the final stages of the selection process. When the outcome of the assessment is negative, the candidate will be informed. The processing of personal data in the context of the risk assessment is carried out on the legal basis of the GDPR: performing a public task in the public interest. You can find more information about this assessment on our website about knowledge security.

  • Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.


Faculty/Department: Faculty of Architecture and the Built Environment
Salary range: €2872 - €3670
Hours per week: 38-40
FTE: 1
Submission is possible until: 25 Jan 2026

jobs.title: Advisory Enterprise Architect
jobs.description:
Company Description


It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.


Job Description


ServiceNow is seeking Enterprise Architects to join our Team. The Enterprise Architecture Team is part of our pre-sales organization focused on building credibility and trust with the technical leaders in our largest customers by developing cross-functional strategies and solutions. Our team brings technical expertise, real-world experience, strong executive engagement skills and an inspirational mindset to help our customers understand the opportunities of the “platform of platforms” vision. We act as technical leaders for our customers most complex solutions, designed to ensure that they can realize the value they need. We do this by leveraging best practice and industry standards to build customer trust and architect best in class solutions.

While collaborating with customers, partners, and the wider ServiceNow sales team, the right candidate will create and communicate high-level architectures and strategies that are both written and verbal, to audiences up to and including the CIO/CTO level. The Enterprise Architect will elegantly articulate the advantage of ServiceNow being built on a single cloud platform consisting of a single user interface, one code base and one data model. The Enterprise Architect will also lead and participate in the delivery of workshops, best practice overviews, and educational sessions to existing customers and partners.

What you get to do in this role:

  • Engage with customer executives to identify pain points and opportunities to deliver value and then translate them into solutions from ServiceNow
  • Work with a wide variety of customers, colleagues and partners to help them understand the power of the Now platform and the potential opportunities of the future of work
  • Lead architecture and design engagements to demonstrate how ServiceNow meets the needs of strategic customers, including; IT Transformation, Digital Products/Services, Platform as a Service, Enterprise Service Management, and the co-creation of industry specific solutions.
  • Understand the business strategy of the customer and articulate how ServiceNow can enable and deliver value to their organization, seamlessly integrating into their current and future technology landscape
  • Understand the detail behind the ServiceNow and platform of platforms architecture and communicate it at various levels
  • Work with architecture development methods, modelling approaches and architecture patterns for integration
  • Interact at multiple levels within a customer account (Enterprise Architects, Domain Architects, Directors, VPs, and CXOs) and maintain these relationships throughout their customer journey.
  • Provide thought leadership and collaborate with internal ServiceNow business units
  • Identify, lead and contribute to the creation of best practices, white papers, workshops, etc

Qualifications


To be successful in this role you have:

  • Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
  • Passion and energy for building business relationships and is accustomed to driving the simplification of complex concepts into compelling customer proposals
  • Drive for results using out-of-the-box innovative thinking together with excellent problem-solving skills
  • An intrinsic ability to understand and prioritize work and is willing to make big bets when the time is right, to invest time and energy in the right areas.
  • Willingness to jump-in and roll-up their sleeves alongside customers, colleagues and partners to get things done faster and better.
  • 10 or more years of proven success in influencing senior technology leaders to drive change in a pre-sales, customer, or delivery focused role.
  • A track record of success in using Human Centered Design techniques to explore the customers current reality and set a vision for the future.
  • Expertise designing, implementing and managing advanced architectures in an application domain and integrating multiple systems or platforms
  • Experience with Enterprise Architecture or Application Architecture pre-sales in a software vendor or professional services environment.
  • Familiarity with common Enterprise and Industry Architecture frameworks such as: TOGAF, Zachman, IT4IT, BIAN, TMForum, etc.
  • Excellent understanding of the architectural principles for cloud-based platforms that include SaaS, PaaS, multi-tenancy, and automation
  • Experience and understanding of multiple technical domains - application, data, DevOps, AI/ML, integration, big data, mobility, analytics, etc.
  • Intrinsically curious and passionate about researching current and emerging technologies and developing innovative solutions
  • Experience presenting architecture concepts, designs, and goals to technology leaders and partners
  • Either Public Healthcare, Retail or Manufacturing Industry expertise is required

TR21


Additional Information


Work Personas

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

Equal Opportunity Employer

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

Accommodations

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

Export Control Regulations

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

From Fortune. ©2025 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.

jobs.title: Senior AI Architect - Telecommunicatie
jobs.description:
Position Description:

(Note: This job posting is only open to native level or near-native level Dutch speakers. If you are not proficient in Dutch, please have a look at our other job postings instead!)
Spreek jij native of near-native Nederlands? Lees dan verder!

Ben jij een strategische denker met diepe technische kennis van AI, LLM’s, machine learning en cloudplatformen? Wil jij organisaties helpen om AI op schaal te ontwerpen, integreren en veilig te implementeren? Dan is deze rol als Senior AI Architect precies voor jou!

Jouw rol in ons team
Als AI Architect ben jij de visionair én technisch leider achter belangrijke AI-initiatieven. Je ontwerpt end-to-end AI-architecturen, bepaalt de technologische richting en zorgt dat AI-, ML- en LLM-oplossingen veilig, schaalbaar en betrouwbaar worden gebouwd.
In jouw rol werk je op het snijvlak van business, technologie en data. Je adviseert stakeholders, begeleidt teams en vertaalt complexe vraagstukken naar robuuste AI-architecturen die waarde leveren. Je bouwt mee aan enterprise AI-platformen en helpt de organisatie volwassen te worden in verantwoord, data-gedreven werken.

Wat ga je doen?
  • Ontwerpen van Enterprise AI-architecturen, inclusief LLM-, ML-, NLP- en automatiseringsoplossingen.
  • Opstellen van AI- en data-architectuurprincipes, kaders en best practices om AI schaalbaar en veilig uit te rollen.
  • Leiden van de technische AI-strategie en roadmap; bepalen van technologiekeuzes, platformstandaarden en integraties.
  • Vertalen van businessdoelen naar technische AI-oplossingen en referentiearchitecturen.
  • Samenwerken met data engineers, MLOps-teams, securityspecialisten en productteams om AI van POC naar productie te brengen.
  • Waarborgen van compliance (AVG), security, governance en ethische AI-richtlijnen.
  • Ontwerpen en implementeren van MLOps-/LLMOps-processen voor deployment, monitoring, lifecycle management en continuous improvement.
  • Evalueren van nieuwe AI-technologieën, frameworks en Cloud services, en advies geven over vendorselectie.
  • Coachen van engineers, data scientists en AI-specialisten binnen projecten of teams.
  • Sparren met leiders, architecten en C-level stakeholders over AI-strategie, risico’s en waardecreatie.

Wat breng je mee?
  • Je hebt een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in AI, Informatica, Data Science of een verwant vakgebied.
  • Minimaal 5–8 jaar ervaring binnen AI-, ML- of data-architectuur (senior) of ervaring met AI-architectuur én aansturen van teams (manager).
  • Diepgaande kennis van AI/ML-concepten, LLM’s, GenAI, NLP, vector databases en retrieval augmented generation (RAG).
  • Sterke technische ervaring met Cloud platformen zoals Azure, AWS of GCP (ML-, AI- en data services).
  • Vaardig in Python of vergelijkbare talen, inclusief ML/AI-frameworks (bijv. PyTorch, TensorFlow).
  • Ervaring met MLOps/LLMOps, CI/CD, feature stores, model registries en geautomatiseerde pipelines.
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden en in staat om complexe AI-concepten helder uit te leggen.
  • Je kunt schakelen tussen strategisch denken en hands-on architectuurwerk.
  • Ervaring met Enterprise-omgevingen, security-by-design en data governance is een grote pré.

Wat typeert jou?
Je bent nieuwsgierig, vernieuwend en hebt een sterke visie op de toekomst van AI. Je ziet kansen, durft richting te bepalen en krijgt mensen mee in verandering. Je combineert technische diepgang met leiderschap en weet hoe je AI-oplossingen schaalbaar, veilig en waardevol maakt.

Wat bieden wij?
  • Een sleutelrol in de vormgeving van onze Enterprise AI-strategie en -architectuur.
  • Mogelijkheid om innovatieve AI-technologieën en LLM’s op schaal te implementeren.
  • Veel vrijheid om te bouwen, experimenteren en te innoveren.
  • Ruimte om teams te coachen, leiderschap te tonen en de AI-richting te bepalen.
  • Hybride werken, flexibele werktijden en uitstekende doorgroeimogelijkheden.
  • Een ambitieuze werkomgeving waar AI-topprioriteit is.

Waarom CGI
CGI is één van 's werelds grootste IT-consultancy bedrijven en speelt een grote rol in sectoren zoals Overheid, finance, lucht- en ruimtevaart, infrastructurele organisaties, telecom, retail sector en energie- en productiebedrijven. Bij ons werk je niet alleen aan innovatieve projecten, maar ook aan je eigen toekomst.

  • Werken in kleine, zelfsturende teams met experts in jouw vakgebied.
  • Direct een vast contract en een uitstekend salaris.
  • Flexibele werktijden en parttime mogelijkheden.
  • Ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en de regie over je eigen carrière.
  • Werken met de nieuwste technologieën.
  • De mogelijkheid om aandeelhouder te worden van CGI.
Bij CGI geloven we in diversiteit en inclusie, omdat dit leidt tot betere samenwerking en innovatie. We kijken uit naar jouw bijdrage aan ons team!

Sluit je aan bij ons team van experts en solliciteer direct!
We nemen dan zo snel mogelijk contact met je op! Heb je nog vragen over de inhoud van de vacature, stel ze aan Director Consulting Services Roxanne Krijsman via roxanne.kruijsman@cgi.com Vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure? Neem contact op met Recruitment Business Partner Natrah Pula via 06 11218723 of via Natrah.pula@cgi.com.

We werken niet samen met externe recruitment bureau’s. Acquisitie wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.

#LI-SP4

What you can expect from us:

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

In 1976 opgericht als een familiebedrijf, is CGI vandaag de dag een van de grootste onafhankelijke zakelijke en ICT-dienstverleners ter wereld. Bij ons draait het om ownership, teamwork en respect. Je krijgt de ruimte om al je talenten volledig te ontplooien.

Vanaf je eerste werkdag ben je mede-eigenaar van CGI. We profiteren samen van ons succes en je krijgt de kans én verantwoordelijkheid om actief bij te dragen aan de koers en strategie van ons bedrijf.

Jouw inzet voegt waarde toe. Je werkt aan innovatieve oplossingen en bouwt aan je netwerk van collega's en klanten. Je hebt toegang tot wereldwijde kansen om je ideeën te realiseren, mogelijkheden te benutten en te profiteren van onze kennis van de industrie en technologische expertise.

Ontdek bij ons de mogelijkheden voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling en zet de volgende stap in je carrière. Hier staat jouw succes centraal!
jobs.companyDescription: Founded in 1976, CGI is among the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

jobs.title: Lead (AI) Platform Engineer
jobs.description:
Utrecht

Lead (AI) Platform Engineer

About the Role

Are you the kind of engineer who sees infrastructure as a playground for innovation? At Blue Harvest, you’ll architect and automate the cloud (or on-prem) foundations that power advanced solutions for leading clients in the financial industry.

Most projects have an AI-native or AI-enhanced flavor, but you’ll also help clients modernize their core tech stack and contribute to internal R&D, tooling, or community initiatives that keep us ahead of the curve.

As a Lead, you’ll guide teams, set technical direction, and help shape the engineering culture, establishing yourself as a local thought leader while growing your market impact.

The Blue Harvest Story

We are a startup within an enterprise, a specialized unit built to move fast and break the 'consultancy' mold. We believe that true engineering leadership isn't about managing tickets, it's about owning the solution and challenging the status quo.

We foster a culture where technical mastery meets emotional intelligence. Whether it's hackathons, building the next 'secret weapon' for our engineering community or Friday afternoon beers, we are a place for those who want to speak, lead, and leave a legacy.

What You'll Do
  • Design and build robust, secure, and scalable platforms on Azure (or on-prem), making “production-ready” the default.
  • Lead the charge in AI infrastructure: automate deployment, serving, and monitoring of LLMs and multi-agent systems.
  • Mentor and guide engineers, championing DevOps culture (“You build it, you run it”) and raising the bar for automation and security.
  • Collaborate with clients and stakeholders to modernize their tech landscape, optimize costs, and drive innovation.
  • When not working on client projects, contribute to internal innovation—think hackathons, open source, or building the next “secret weapon” for our engineering community.
  • Grow your career with us: Blue Harvest invests heavily in your learning, with clear career paths, mentorship, and opportunities to become a recognized expert.
What You Bring
  • Cloud Native: Deep expertise in Azure (preferred), but AWS/GCP also valued. You know your way around Terraform, Bicep, Kubernetes, Helm, and service meshes.
  • MLOps & Data: Hands-on with MLOps tools (Azure ML, Databricks), vector databases (Pinecone, Milvus), and AI observability (LangSmith, OpenTelemetry).
  • Automation: Strong scripting skills in Python, Go, or Bash.
  • Mindset: Passion for automation, security, and building platforms that make engineers (and AI models) happy.
  • Fluent in English; Strong network and market vision.
Nice-to-haves
  • Experience as a consultant, working directly with clients to deliver value.
  • Experience with FinOps, cost optimization, or regulatory compliance in financial services.
  • Familiarity with hybrid cloud or on-premise security models.
  • Contributions and active participation to open source, tech talks, blogs or developer communities.
  • A knack for translating complex tech into clear, actionable advice for clients.
  • Fluent in Dutch.
Why Blue Harvest?
  • Best of Both Worlds: The agility and fun of a startup, with the stability and resources of Capgemini.
  • Growth: Clear career paths and a dedicated budget for learning, certifications, and conferences. We support you to become a thought leader and want you on stage, sharing your knowledge.
  • Culture: A team that values curiosity, connection, and the occasional octopus-level multitasking
  • Rewards: Competitive salary and performance bonuses that reflect your impact.
Our offer

Of course, you will get a competitive salary with other interesting benefits. But more importantly, you will work at a fantastic and pleasant place where you can do more than just engineering. You will be learning, developing yourself, organizing events and speaking at conferences.

Are you ready to harvest and do you think you are the next Lead Platform Engineer we are looking for? Do not hesitate to apply.

(By applying to this vacancy, you agree with a background check if applicable.)

jobs.title: AI and Data Engineer
jobs.description:
Department

The AI Center of Excellence ( CoE ) is the strategic enabler within the technology organization, helping business domains and technology delivery teams shape and mature their AI ideas into secure, scalable, and production-ready solutions. Our mission is to accelerate AI adoption across Robeco by providing expertise , frameworks, and governance that empower teams to innovate responsibly and transition smoothly from concept to enterprise deployment.

In addition to AI, the new ‘AI CoE & Technology Innovation’ department will monitor emerging technologies and, together with delivery teams and Enterprise Architecture, assess their applicability for Robeco.

Position & Requirements

We’re looking for a skilled AI and Data Engineer, who is excited to play a foundational role in building a new, high-impact team from the ground up. Within this team, you will drive AI adoption within our business. You will design, develop, and deploy AI solutions which optimize operations, unlock new insights for our clients, and drive marketing impact.

As an AI and Data Engineer, you will report to the Head of AI & Technology Innovation.

Core Responsibilities

As an AI Engineer within the Robeco AI Center of Excellence your key responsibilities would be to:

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with business and technology teams to translate ideas into actionable solutions;
  • Collect, clean, and analyze structured and unstructured data;
  • Design and implement rapid, functional prototypes that follow best practices to validate AI concepts and demonstrate feasibility;
  • Build predictive and generative models using modern ML and AI frameworks;
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to test strategic AI use cases/ models align with organizational goals;
  • Work closely with data scientists and architects to ensure prototypes can transition smoothly into scalable solutions once validated;
  • Conduct experiments and evaluate model performance using appropriate metrics and ensuring reproducibility;
  • Stay current with the latest AI/ML research and technologies, integrating innovative approaches into solutions;
  • Act as a trusted advisor and sparring partner for our AI champions within business teams, fostering adoption and knowledge sharing;
  • Build strong relationships with business and technology delivery teams to ensure the AI Center of Excellence is deeply embedded within core business processes, fostering trust and alignment; and
  • Contribute to shaping a newly established team by promoting collaboration, defining best practices, and helping create a culture of innovation and adaptability.

What We’re Looking For

Must have qualifications include:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field (or equivalent experience);
  • We are hiring for a range of experience levels but expected a minimum of 2 years' experience in an engineering or similar role.
  • Strong programming skills in Python and SQL as well as familiarity with best coding practices;
  • Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation;
  • Experience with cloud platforms (preferably Azure and Snowflake) and version control systems (Git);
  • Understanding of AI/ML capabilities in business applications (e.g. Cortex on Snowflake, Copilot in Microsoft CRM);
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with attention to detail; and
  • Ability to communicate complex concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Preferred qualifications include:

  • Master's or PhD in Computer Science, AI/ML, or related field;
  • Experience with LLMs and AI;
  • Experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn);
  • Experience with containerization (Kubernetes) and API development;
  • Contributions to open-source AI/ML projects or published research or papers in AI/ML conferences or journals;
  • Understanding data privacy, security and AI regulations;
  • Understanding of AI use cases in Sales, Marketing and Service processes; and
  • Understanding of AI use cases in Financial services.

Other considerations

  • The position is for a minimum of 32 hours per week.
  • This is a hybrid role, requiring the candidate to work in office (Rotterdam based) for 60% of the time.
  • Working permit for working in the Netherlands

Why Join Us

You’ll work at the intersection of finance, technology, and innovation, shaping how investments leverage AI responsibly. We foster a culture of collaboration, adaptability, and inclusion, where your voice matters.

Research shows that female candidates only apply if they meet 100% of the requirements, while male candidates already do so at 60%. Please do apply, we’re looking forward to hearing from you.

All applications will be treated with the utmost confidentiality. An assessment and integrity test may be used in the selection procedure.

Robeco Recruiting Team

jobs.title: Senior VLSI Verification Engineer (AI Compute SoC) – Poland / EU remote / Kraków hybrid
jobs.description:
Our client is a fast-growing deep-tech company building a next-generation AI compute SoC, combining high-performance AI processing with advanced networking capabilities. They have 70+ engineers across Israel, Europe, and the US, and with their first silicon already taped out and functioning they are now expanding their VLSI team in Poland.

They are looking for a highly independent Senior VLSI Verification Engineer who can own a verification domain end-to-end and operate as an extension of the Israeli VLSI team. This is a senior, impact-heavy role requiring strong technical leadership, autonomy, and experience with complex SoCs.

What You Will Do
  • Take full ownership of block/cluster verification from specification to sign-off.
  • Build and evolve SystemVerilog UVM verification environments.
  • Drive unit-level, subsystem, and full-chip verification flows.
  • Define verification strategy and methodology for your domain.
  • Collaborate closely with architecture, RTL, and AI compute teams (mostly IL-based).
  • Work on a state-of-the-art SoC that includes NoC, CPU subsystems, PCIe, DMA, memory hierarchies, and AI accelerators.

What We’re Looking For
  • 7+ years of ASIC/SoC pre-silicon verification (senior-level autonomy is essential).
  • Deep knowledge of SystemVerilog and UVM.
  • Experience building verification from scratch and owning a block/cluster.
  • Hands-on experience across unit, subsystem, and full-chip verification.
  • Solid understanding of SoC architecture.
  • B.Sc./M.Sc. in Electrical or Computer Engineering.

Nice to Have
  • AMBA/AXI, NoC, CPU subsystems, PCIe, DMA, networking hardware.
  • Experience with AI/ML accelerators or high-throughput pipelines.
  • Prior tape-out experience.

Why This Role Is Unique
  • Work on a real AI compute SoC with a successfully taped-out first generation.
  • High autonomy: you will operate as a senior extension of the IL VLSI team.
  • Low bureaucracy, fast decision-making, strong engineering culture.
  • Chance to influence architecture, methodology, and silicon quality.
  • Direct access to the VP of VLSI and CEO—rare for a hardware role.
  • Hybrid office in Kraków: typically 2 days/week on-site, flexible for non-local candidates.
  • EU remote possible with occasional office visits.

Location
  • Preferred: Kraków (hybrid).
  • Possible: Anywhere in EU time zones with periodic travel to Kraków.

Hiring Process:
  • 30-minute prescreen call with an external recruiter – initial experience check and role alignment.
  • Initial phone interview (15–30 minutes) with the Site Manager in Poland.
  • 2–3 technical interviews with the VLSI team
  • HR interview with the company’s HR representative.
  • Final decision & offer.

If you’re looking for depth, ownership, and the chance to build verification for cutting-edge AI silicon — we’d love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer (Cloud / Data Platform)
jobs.description:
Our client is a Dutch telecom provider focused on building digital experiences that are more human and more inclusive. They’re hiring a Senior Cloud Data Engineer for their Digital IT Data Platform, a team where people learn together and every voice matters.

You’ll work on cloud native systems and data driven services that support millions of customers. If you enjoy building systems that make life easier for real people, this role offers meaningful work and a team that values growth and collaboration.

Your Day-to-Day: Engineering, Ownership, Impact

  • Build production services and APIs in Python using frameworks such as FastAPI, Flask or Django

  • Create event driven workflows and batch jobs using AWS Lambda, SQS, SNS and DynamoDB

  • Design cloud native solutions on AWS using services like ECS, Lambda, S3 and API Gateway

  • Use Terraform and GitHub Actions to deliver infrastructure as code and CI automation

  • Partner with product, data and cloud teams to shape features and platform direction

  • Support secure engineering practices, observability and FinOps

  • Share knowledge, mentor teammates and contribute to engineering standards

  • Help maintain an open, inclusive, learning oriented team culture

What You Bring (and What You’ll Grow Into)

You don’t need to meet every requirement to apply. If the work inspires you and you see yourself growing here, we encourage you to apply.

  • 3-5 years of hands on AWS engineering experience

  • Experience building production Python services using FastAPI, Flask or Django

  • Experience with event driven systems or batch processing

  • Terraform experience and basic CI knowledge

  • Understanding of IAM, VPC concepts and secure cloud design

  • Clear communication skills, both technical and non technical

  • Based in the Netherlands and fluent in English

Nice to have: Kafka or Kinesis, observability tools, Kubernetes or ECS, or experience with ML or data engineering tooling.

Designed to Support You

  • Competitive salary + variable bonus scheme

  • Hybrid working

  • Progressive pension plan

  • 30 vacation days + an extra day off after Ascension Day

  • Redeemable holidays

  • Employee telecom subscription

  • Real opportunities for growth and advancement

  • Personal annual learning budget + access to over 200 digital courses

  • Team events, learning weeks, social gatherings, and an annual ski trip

If this role speaks to you, we’d love to hear from you! Apply directly or contact jobs@shematters.nl.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer – LLMs
jobs.description:
Join our AI team at Prosus, the largest consumer internet company in Europe and one of the biggest tech investors in the world. You'll be working on the team that drives growth and innovation across the company, with your work directly impacting how millions of people shop online.

Who we’re looking for

We're seeking an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to develop our domain-specific language models. You'll own the full training pipeline - from continued pre-training on proprietary data, through fine-tuning, to advanced post-training techniques. You have hands-on experience training language models at scale (from embedding models to specialized LLMs), deep understanding of distributed systems and excel at turning research concepts into robust production systems. You're motivated by seeing your work deployed and used by millions of real users. You thrive in fast-paced environments where you balance research insights with practical business impact.

What you’ll do

  • Analyze model performance and training data to identify improvement opportunities and formulate hypotheses for enhancement
  • Design, execute, and rigorously evaluate experiments to improve model quality, training efficiency, and downstream task performance
  • Train large language models for our domain through continued pre-training and full parameter fine-tuning on proprietary datasets
  • Design and implement post-training pipelines using RLHF, DPO, GRPO, and other reinforcement learning techniques
  • Build and optimize distributed training infrastructure across multi-node GPU clusters using frameworks like DeepSpeed, FSDP, Megatron-LM, or Axolotl
  • Own large-scale data preparation: filtering, quality assessment, deduplication, and data mixture strategies for training corpora at 100B+ token scale
  • Generate and curate high-quality synthetic data for instruction fine-tuning and capability enhancement
  • Debug training stability issues, optimize training throughput, and monitor model performance throughout long-running distributed jobs
  • Implement techniques from recent papers and adapt them to our use cases
  • Build robust evaluation frameworks to measure model quality and guide training decisions
  • Write production-grade, well-tested code and contribute to team engineering standards

Minimum qualifications

  • 5+ years of ML engineering experience
  • Proven experience training and deploying language models to production (embedding models, encoder models, or large language models) including pre-training, continued pre-training, or fine-tuning with rigorous evaluation
  • Experience preparing large-scale training datasets: data filtering, quality assessment, deduplication strategies, and data mixture design
  • Hands-on experience with distributed training frameworks (DeepSpeed, FSDP, Megatron-LM, or Axolotl) including orchestrating multi-node jobs, debugging failures, and optimizing throughput
  • Strong understanding of training dynamics at scale: debugging loss instabilities, tuning learning rate schedules, managing training stability across long-running multi-node jobs
  • Expert Python and PyTorch with production experience using training libraries (Transformers, DeepSpeed, Accelerate)
  • Strong software engineering practices: version control, testing, CI/CD, code review

Preferred qualifications

  • Published research at ML conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, ACL, EMNLP), released models on Hugging Face, created public benchmarks, or contributed to open-source projects
  • Experience with post-training methods: RLHF, DPO, GRPO, or other reinforcement learning approaches for alignment and instruction-following
  • Experience optimizing models for production inference: quantization, model compression, distillation, and serving frameworks (vLLM)
  • Understanding of memory optimization: gradient checkpointing, mixed precision training (FP16, BF16, FP8), ZeRO optimization
  • Track record of building synthetic data generation pipelines for instruction tuning or domain adaptation
  • Research contributions: published papers at ML conferences, released models on Hugging Face, or created benchmarks used by the community
  • Contributions to open-source LLM training projects or tools

What we offer

  • High-impact AI projects that are strategically vital to the company, with direct engagement from senior leadership including the CEO
  • State-of-the-art infrastructure: H200 GPU fleet, massive proprietary datasets, access to frontier models (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Together.ai) for evaluation and baselines
  • Expert colleagues who have released top Hugging Face models, authored papers at NeurIPS, created well-known benchmarks, and built multiple production AI systems
  • Significant autonomy and freedom to test ideas, experiment with new approaches, and drive technical decisions
  • Modern tooling: Latest ML frameworks, coding assistants, best-in-class development environment
  • Hybrid work model with our Amsterdam office - home to the AI House, bringing together 200+ AI professionals through events, meetups, and startup collaborations
  • Competitive compensation, top-spec MacBook Pro, and an environment genuinely built for professional growth and learning

  • If you're excited to apply your LLM training expertise to high-impact applications at scale and see your work make a tangible difference globally, let's talk.
Our Diversity & Inclusion Commitment

We respect the dignity and human rights of individuals and communities wherever we operate in the world. Building an inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome and can thrive is critical for us. We provide access to education, which helps everyone understand the important role they play and the positive impact they can have.

For a deeper look at our journey and future plans, explore our latest Annual Report. Stay up to date with our latest news to see what makes Prosus stand out. Learn more at www.prosus.com.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer Go - AI platform
jobs.description:
Who we are
At Prosus, we improve everyday life for billions across the globe through cutting-edge technology. As a leading global consumer internet group and one of the world's largest technology investors, we nurture and support industry-leading businesses that empower individuals and enrich communities. Guided by our core values, Innovation, Results, People, Impact, and Entrepreneurship, we push boundaries, encourage collaboration,
and create an environment where diversity and inclusion thrive. We value curiosity, ownership, and resilience. We hire people who take initiative, embrace change, and bring fresh perspectives to everything they do.

We are proud to lead the charge in AI innovation, making significant strides in this transformative field. With operations in over 100 countries, our extensive global portfolio includes over 90 companies. We drive progress in sectors such as online classifieds, food delivery, payments & fintech, and e-commerce , consistently pushing the boundaries of technology. Our brands, like iFood, OLX, PayU, EMAG, and Takealot, are changing the way
people live and work.
Join the development team in designing and implementing innovative AI-driven tools that empower our users. Enhance our internal processes, seamlessly integrating AI capabilities into every aspect of our operations.
You will tackle sophisticated technical challenges involving multiple technology stacks, including AI and machine learning, and will play a key role in architectural design, provide initiative and technical leadership to build reliable, high-quality, high-performance solutions that scale.

This position will be based in our Amsterdam office.

About the role

  • Mentor and support your fellow teammates.
  • Deliver and review technical design, code and documentation.
  • Coordinate with stakeholders and decision-makers to test and improve services
  • Provide analytical approaches to solve various problems
  • Troubleshoot issues where needed
  • Code back-end components and integrate applications to other web services
  • Understand software requirements and translate them into products

Basic qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in computer science or similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7+ years professional software development experience
  • Provable proficiency in Go programming, common frameworks, and tools (3+ years experience)
  • AI Experience - both as a user but also working on AI/ML systems
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Attention to detail, and able to qualify the need for detail

  • Strong analytical skills
  • Time management and organizational skills

Preferred qualifications

  • Experience using Generative AI and Machine Learning Infrastructure to concretely impact engineering efficiency
  • Experience building and iterating on code review (GitHub), automation test infrastructure (unit, integration, E2E), build systems and deploying to AWS cloud infrastructure

What we offer

Global Impact: Play a crucial role in shaping the future of global commerce. Be part of a dynamic ecosystem of tech-led companies across markets, from emerging disruptors to established platforms, all working to create positive change at scale.
Growth Opportunities: Expand your expertise through high-stakes challenges within our diverse portfolio. You'll gain access to a network of businesses, leaders, and learning opportunities that span continents and industries.
Innovative Culture: Join a forward-thinking team that values strategic insights and bold ideas. You’ll operate at the intersection of venture-building, innovation, and investment, where experimentation is encouraged and cross-company collaboration drives breakthroughs.
Creative Environment: Engage in work that encourages creativity and constant improvement. We challenge assumptions, explore new frontiers, and believe great ideas can come from anywhere in our ecosystem.
Collaborative Atmosphere: Benefit from autonomy and self-management in a supportive, outcome-driven workspace. You’ll work alongside sharp, motivated peers across our portfolio, all united by a shared ambition to move the needle.
Hybrid Work: Experience the satisfaction of our flexible model tailored to balance work and life.
Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a salary package that reflects your skills and contributions.
Comprehensive Benefits: From health and wellness to learning, commuting, and everyday perks, we offer a well rounded package designed to help you thrive at work and beyond.
