jobs.title: Product Manager - Generative AI
jobs.description:
Join Prosus - one of the world's largest technology investors and Europe's leading consumer internet company. We're building high-impact AI solutions by innovating on top of the latest GenAI technologies, transforming bold experiments into production systems that reshape how businesses operate and accelerate innovation across our global portfolio.

You'll lead the expansion of GenAI innovation from the core AI team into multiple Prosus companies, helping them discover, experiment, and scale their own AI-powered solutions. This role sits at the intersection of product, data, and enablement - ideal for someone who can move comfortably between strategy and hands-on problem-solving.

Who we're looking for

We're seeking a Product Manager to drive GenAI adoption across Prosus portfolio companies. You'll turn AI experiments into measurable business impact by defining product strategy, coordinating rollouts, and working hands-on with local teams. You understand how LLMs create value, can reason through data and system trade-offs, and excel at translating complex AI capabilities into practical applications that solve real business problems. You have strong technical fluency with LLMs, proven experience shipping AI products, and thrive managing stakeholders across engineering and business teams in ambiguous, fast-moving environments.

What you'll do

  • Orchestrate the core AI team’s efforts: Oversee planning, prioritization, and execution of the team’s initiatives to ensure clear progress, accountability, and alignment with partner-company goals - delivering timely, high-quality support for adoption and experimentation.
  • Lead a multi-company adoption program: Plan and coordinate rollouts across Prosus portfolio companies, from onboarding to first production use cases.
  • Educate and enable stakeholders: Deliver demos, workshops, and ideation sessions that help teams identify high-value GenAI opportunities.
  • Scope first use cases: Work with local teams to define MVPs, success criteria, and experimentation plans - then oversee A/B testing and validation.
  • Assess data readiness: Evaluate data quality, access, and privacy constraints; define what's needed to start experimentation responsibly.
  • Gauge technical maturity: Understand each company's team structure and capabilities to design an effective collaboration model.
  • Be hands-on when needed: Explore data, prototype prompts, test LLM outputs, and help shape evaluation approaches.
  • Stay informed on emerging GenAI methods and tools: Track new models, frameworks, and evaluation techniques to guide teams toward the most effective solutions.
  • Build the playbook: Capture what works (and what doesn't) from each experiment and turn it into guidance that others can reuse and improve.
  • Communicate with clarity: Craft clear, concise updates for executives, engineers, and business leaders alike.

What you'll bring

  • 3+ years of product management experience in AI-driven or data-intensive products.
  • Strong technical fluency in generative AI concepts (prompts, embeddings, evaluation), with enough hands-on comfort to prototype or analyze outcomes independently - without being an engineer.
  • Proven ability to lead cross-functional projects with technical, data, and business stakeholders.
  • Analytical mindset and experience designing and interpreting experiments or A/B tests.
  • Awareness of responsible AI and data privacy principles, ensuring experimentation and deployment adhere to safe and compliant practices.
  • Exceptional communication and storytelling skills, both written and verbal.
  • Comfort with ambiguity - you thrive in fast-moving environments where playbooks are still being written.

Bonus points for

  • Experience launching or scaling GenAI products.
  • Familiarity with enterprise data, governance, and privacy standards.
  • Background in commerce, marketplaces, or operations-focused AI applications.
  • Prior experience working in enablement programs that support multiple business units.
  • Degree in computer science

What we offer

  • High-impact, greenfield work that influences how millions of people shop, transact, and interact online.
  • A chance to shape how Prosus companies adopt and scale generative AI across industries.
  • Close collaboration with world-class ML engineers, data scientists, and product leaders.
  • Significant autonomy to experiment, iterate, and ship.
  • Hybrid work model with our Amsterdam office - home to the newly opened AI House, bringing together 200+ AI professionals through events, meetups, and startup collaborations (plus great barista coffee!).
  • Fast-paced environment where you'll engage deeply with diverse problems, iterate quickly, and learn continuously across different business contexts.
  • Competitive compensation, top-tier equipment, and excellent benefits.
MORE ABOUT PROSUS

Our purpose is to improve everyday life for billions of people through technology. We are a global consumer internet group and one of the largest technology investors in the world. Operating and investing globally in markets with long-term growth potential, Prosus builds leading consumer internet companies that empower people and enrich communities.

The group is focused on building meaningful businesses in the online classifieds, food delivery, payments and fintech, and education technology sectors in markets including India and Brazil. Through our ventures team, we invest in areas including health, logistics, blockchain, and social commerce. We actively seek new opportunities to partner with exceptional entrepreneurs who are using technology to improve people’s everyday lives.

Every day, billions of customers use the products and services of companies that Prosus has invested in, acquired or built. For an overview, please visit companies page

For listed companies where we have an interest, please see: Tencent, Delivery Hero Despegar, Remitly, Udemy, Skillsoft, Sinch, and Similarweb. For more information, please visit www.prosus.com To get a real flavour of who we are – and where we’re heading – take a look at our latest Annual Report And you’ll probably be pretty interested in the most up to date news about Prosus.

OUR DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION COMMITMENT

We respect the dignity and human rights of individuals and communities wherever we operate in the world. Building an inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome and can thrive is critical for us. We provide access to education, which helps everyone understand the important role they play and the positive impact they can have.

jobs.title: AI Engineer
jobs.description:
Wil jij met data en AI échte impact maken op de mentale gezondheid in Nederland? Heb je een sterke technische basis in data- en AI-engineering en vind je het leuk om te bouwen in een omgeving die nog volop in ontwikkeling is? Dan is dit de baan voor jou.

Wat ga je doen?

Over de rol

Als AI Engineer word je één van de eerste leden van ons nieuwe Data & AI-team. Je werkt niet alleen aan het dataplatform, maar aan een breed portfolio van data- en AI-projecten binnen Psyned. We groeien hard, professionaliseren onze organisatie en zetten stevig in op innovatie van onze zorg. De komende jaren bouwen we aan een modern dataplatform én een reeks AI-toepassingen om onze zorg, processen en dienstverlening slimmer en effectiever te maken. Denk aan voorspelmodellen, matching-algoritmes, triage-optimalisatie, kwaliteitsmonitoring, procesautomatisering en het ontsluiten van inzichten uit ongestructureerde data.

Je krijgt veel eigenaarschap: over de stack, de modellen én de manier waarop we Data & AI verder vormgeven in de organisatie. Je werkt daarin nauw samen met externe experts én interne stakeholders uit zorg, operations, commercie, kwaliteit en compliance en management.

In deze rol is veel ruimte voor groei, experimenteren en het oppakken van end-to-end verantwoordelijkheid. Je gaat onder andere:

  • Volwaardig lid worden van het nieuwe AI/Data Engineering-team.

  • Eigenaarschap nemen over onze groeiende data- en AI-stack.

  • Intensief worden ingewerkt door experts in data engineering en AI.

  • Nieuwe dataflows en databronnen aansluiten op ons dataplatform (ELT-set-up met Fivetran en dbt).

  • Ruwe data transformeren naar semantisch rijke datamodellen volgens de Medallion-architectuur.

  • AI-initiatieven vormgeven samen met onze externe AI-partner en interne stakeholders.

  • Nieuwe AI-use cases ontwikkelen, implementeren en in productie brengen (predictive modellen, classificatiemodellen, LLM-toepassingen).

  • LLM-technologie inzetten om inzichten uit ongestructureerde data (zoals tekst of audio) te halen en een robuust LLMOps-framework opzetten.

  • Onze cloudomgeving in GCP beheren en uitbreiden met Infrastructure as Code (bijvoorbeeld met Terraform).

  • Werken met moderne principes op het gebied van CI/CD, datakwaliteit, DevOps, MLOps en LLMOps.

  • Verantwoordelijkheid nemen voor de anonimisering en beveiliging van privacygevoelige data van cliënten en medewerkers.

  • Zelfstandig nieuwe projecten oppakken, nieuwe vaardigheden ontwikkelen en je kennis delen binnen het team en de organisatie.

Werken bij Psyned: samen maken we Nederland mentaal gezonder

Bij Psyned vinden we dat iedereen het verdient om zich mentaal fit te voelen. Dat begint met snelle, persoonlijke hulp, bij psychische klachten én om die te voorkomen.

Wij koppelen onze cliënten altijd binnen één werkdag aan een psycholoog die écht bij hen past, zorgvuldig gekozen uit ons landelijke netwerk van meer dan 300 ervaren behandelaars. Snel geregeld, beter geholpen.

Waarom je bij ons wil werken:

  • Je maakt impact. Elke dag help je mee om mensen écht verder te helpen.

  • Je krijgt vertrouwen. We werken zelfstandig én samen. Je krijgt veel vrijheid om jouw rol op jouw manier in te vullen. Liever leren van fouten dan niets proberen.

  • We zijn snel, persoonlijk en onafhankelijk. Korte lijnen, directe communicatie en duidelijke resultaten, dat werkt motiverend.

  • We blijven groeien. In wat we doen en hoe we het doen. Dat vraagt flexibiliteit én biedt uitdaging. Je krijgt alle ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen.

Wie ben jij?

Je bent een ambitieuze engineer met brede interesse in data én AI, die graag in een klein team grote stappen zet. Je vindt het leuk om zowel te bouwen als te experimenteren en je voelt je prettig bij verantwoordelijkheid en eigenaarschap.

Over jou:

  • Je beschikt over een Bachelor- of Masterdiploma in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science of een vergelijkbare technische studie.

  • Je hebt 2–5 jaar relevante werkervaring in een data engineering-, AI engineering- of ML engineering-rol.

  • Je werkt graag in compacte, wendbare teams en vindt het leuk om end-to-end verantwoordelijkheid te nemen over onderdelen van het platform of een AI-project.

  • Je bent leergierig, pakt nieuwe onderwerpen snel op en zoekt actief naar kansen om Data & AI in te zetten.

  • Je voelt je verbonden met de missie van Psyned en wilt met je technische werk bijdragen aan een mentaal gezonder Nederland.

  • Je kunt complexe systemen overzien, keuzes uitleggen en helder communiceren met zowel technische als niet-technische collega’s.


Jouw technische skills:

  • Een sterke basis in SQL en Python.

  • Ervaring met datawarehouses/datalakes en het bouwen van ELT- of ETL-pipelines.

  • Ervaring met het ontwikkelen en toepassen van ML- en AI-modellen (predictive modellen, classificatiemodellen, LLMs) en het in productie brengen ervan (MLOps / LLMOps).

  • Kennis van data-anonimisering en -beveiliging en het werken met gevoelige data.

  • Ervaring met Git, CI/CD-principes en werken in de cloud (ervaring met GCP is een pré).

  • Basiskennis van of affiniteit met Infrastructure as Code (bijvoorbeeld Terraform).

  • Je hebt (een deel van) bovenstaande ervaring opgedaan in eerdere banen of serieuze (side) projecten.

We verwachten niet dat je in alles al een expert bent. We zoeken iemand met een sterke basis, nieuwsgierigheid en de wil om te groeien, de rest bouwen we samen verder op.

Wat bieden wij?

Wij geloven dat goede zorg begint bij de mensen die het geven. Daarom zorgen we net zo goed voor onze medewerkers als voor onze cliënten. Je krijgt:

  • Salaris: Je krijgt een bruto maandsalaris tussen €5000,- en €6000,- op basis van 40 uur, afhankelijk van opleiding en ervaring.

  • Een pensioenregeling: De pensioenregeling bedraagt in totaal 12%, waarvan 8% door de werkgever wordt betaald en 4% door de werknemer. Ook valt onder de regeling een partnerpensioen en een premievrijstelling bij arbeidsongeschiktheid beide voor kosten van werkgever.

  • Reiskostenvergoeding: Reis je met het ov? Wij vergoeden 100% van je kosten.

  • Een arbeidsovereenkomst voor 7 maanden: Bij wederzijdse tevredenheid hebben we de intentie om je daarna een arbeidsovereenkomst voor onbepaalde tijd te geven.

  • Vakantiegeld & vakantiedagen: Je krijgt 8% vakantiegeld en 25 vakantiedagen (op basis van een dienstverband van 40 uur per week).

Interesse?

Ben jij de AI Engineer die we zoeken? Solliciteer! Wil je eerst meer informatie? Neem dan contact op met Floris Lantermans via
floris@psyned.nl. We kijken uit naar je sollicitatie!

jobs.title: junior analytics engineer
jobs.description:
Description


Another Star is a global lifestyle hotel management company involved in the in-stay part of the customer journey.
This gives us an incredibly rich dataset to collect, transform, and analyze in order to improve the effectiveness of the operating model and therefore guest experience. Much of this data flows through and lives in Another Star’s data platform. If you love the idea of turning complex raw data into well-modeled, accessible insights — then you’ve found your hive.

As a junior analytics engineer, you’ll help shape the data foundations that power decision-making across Another Star. You’ll work with our data engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders to transform raw data from multiple systems into well-structured, analytics-ready models and dashboards. You’ll be hands-on with our data platform; building, optimizing, and modeling datasets that make our business smarter every day. This role bridges data engineering and analytics: you’ll create data pipelines, develop business logic in SQL/Python, and visualize the results through dashboards and ad hoc analyses.

You will report into the Data & Analytics team within the Tech & Data department and collaborate closely with both our technical platform owner and business platform owner to ensure data reliability, clarity, and accessibility across the company.


Key Responsibilities


  • Build and maintain clean, reliable data pipelines (ELT/ETL) within our data platform (Databricks / SQL / PySpark).
  • Model datasets across the bronze–silver–gold layers to support analytical and operational use cases.
  • Collaborate with analysts to design & maintain reusable metrics and tables that serve multiple business domains (commercial, operations, finance, etc.).
  • Develop and maintain dashboards (PowerBI) that surface business insights in a clear, self-service way.
  • Perform ad hoc data analysis and exploration to answer specific business questions.
  • Work with the senior data engineers on improving data quality, performance, and observability across the platform.
  • Document data models, transformations, and key business logic.
  • Continuously learn and contribute ideas for improving data workflows, pipelines, and analytics processes.

Qualifications / skills


  • Bachelor’s degree (Master’s preferred) in Data Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, or Business Analytics.
  • Strong proficiency in SQL and familiarity with relational / dimensional modeling.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (PowerBI preferred).
  • Intermediate level of Python for data wrangling, scripting and data engineering.
  • Exposure to ETL/ELT workflows (Databricks Jobs, Airflow etc.) is a plus.
  • Understanding of data pipelines, transformations, and version-controlled development (Git).
  • Interest in learning modern data stack tools (Databricks, Delta Lake, dbt, PowerBI).
  • Interest/familiarity with practical use cases of ML and AI frameworks.
  • Attention to detail, analytical mindset, and curiosity to explore data deeply.
  • Strong communication skills to translate technical concepts into clear business understanding.
  • Experience working in an agile team environment is a plus.
  • Previous Experience in a business analytics related role is a plus

What's in it for you?


  • citizenM experience nights for you (and friends and family)
  • Personal and professional development opportunities and programs
  • Latest tech devices and all the tools you need to be successful in your role
  • Commuting travel costs covered (by car or public transport)
  • Pension and cycle-to-work scheme
  • Subsidized fresh daily lunches at our support office
  • Flexible public holidays
  • Employee assistance program
  • Varied team days and social events (from food trucks and quizzes at the office to parties on boats)
Timeline: please note we will get in touch with candidates as of December 17th. First interview round will start as of January 2026


About citizenM
jobs.companyDescription: citizenM is a new breed of hotels welcoming lovers of affordable luxury 18 cities, 30 hotels and more on the way

jobs.title: MLOps Engineer I
jobs.description:
Company Description

We’re Checkout.com – you might not know our name, but companies like eBay, ASOS, Klarna, Uber Eats, and Sony do. That moment when you check out online? We make it happen.

Checkout.com is where the world checks out. Our global network powers billions of transactions every year, making money move without making a fuss. We spent years perfecting a service most people will never notice. Because when digital payments just work, businesses grow, customers stay, and no one stops to think about why.

With 19 offices spanning six continents, we feel at home everywhere – but London is our HQ. Wherever our people work their magic, they’re fast-moving, performance-obsessed, and driven by being better every day. Ideal. Because a role here isn’t just another job; it’s a career-defining opportunity to build the future of fintech.

Job Description

As a ML (Machine Learning) Ops Engineer at Checkout.com in the ML Platform team, you will contribute to the development of scalable systems that power real-time fraud detection and payment optimization. This is your opportunity to grow alongside top-tier engineers while making a tangible impact on millions of transactions globally.

The solutions that you will be building will power our stack of value added services in the Payments Performance area. We’re a growing team in an expanding area within the company and we’re looking for individuals who have strong ownership, are passionate about productionising ML and have a pragmatic approach to converting big problems into smaller iterations to constantly deliver value.

How you’ll make an impact

  • Build systems for training, deploying and monitoring machine learning models used in our payments platform, at scale
  • Scale our feature store to more and increasingly complex use-cases both online and offline
  • Deliver end to end features with full ownership under mentorship of talented engineers

Qualifications

  • Proficiency in writing clear, production-ready Python code
  • Familiarity with production ML models (online or offline) and standard MLOps practices
  • Familiarity with monitoring and observability of production systems, with a strong sense of ownership
  • Familiarity in Cloud-based application development (we use AWS)
  • Familiarity with one or more ML frameworks and technologies: scikit-learn, xgboost, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark, Databricks, SageMaker, Vertex AI, Kubeflow, Seldon, Triton
  • Strong communication skills, able to express ideas clearly and collaborate across teams
  • Growth mindset, always on the lookout for stretch challenges
  • Curiosity to tackle open-ended problems and learn from failures

Bring all of you to work

We create the conditions for high performers to thrive – through real ownership, fewer blockers, and work that makes a difference from day one.

Here, you’ll move fast, take on meaningful challenges, and be recognized for the impact you deliver. It’s a place where ambition gets met with opportunity – and where your growth is in your hands.

We work as one team, and we back each other to succeed. So whatever your background or identity, if you’re ready to grow and make a difference, you’ll be right at home here.

It’s important we set you up for success and make our process as accessible as possible. So let us know in your application, or tell your recruiter directly, if you need anything to make your experience or working environment more comfortable.


Life at Checkout.com

We understand that work is just one part of your life. Our hybrid working model offers flexibility, with three days per week in the office to support collaboration and connection.

Curious about what it’s like to be part of our team? Visit our Careers Page to learn more about our culture, open roles, and what drives us.

For a closer look at daily life at Checkout.com, follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram
jobs.companyDescription: Checkout.com is one of the most exciting and valuable fintechs in the world. Our mission is to enable businesses and their communities to thrive in the digital economy.

jobs.title: Vice President of GenAI Engineering
jobs.description:
Meet Our Team:

Pegasystems is seeking a VP of Generative AI Engineering to define and lead our enterprise GenAI strategy and product roadmap. In this pivotal leadership role, you will drive the vision, architecture, and execution of AI-powered capabilities that transform how our clients leverage the Pega platform. You'll oversee the end-to-end development lifecycle of GenAI initiatives—from research and prototyping through production deployment—while building and leading a world-class global team of engineers and applied researchers.


As a key technical and strategic leader, you'll partner across Product Engineering, Go-To-Market, and executive stakeholders to embed cutting-edge AI capabilities (including LLM orchestration, RAG, and agentic systems) into enterprise workflows. You'll establish responsible AI governance, drive innovation in AI services, and serve as Pega's primary internal and external engineering evangelist for Generative AI.


This role requires at least 3 days in our Amsterdam office.

Picture Yourself at Pega:

This role requires a seasoned technology executive with deep expertise in AI/ML, proven success launching enterprise-scale AI products, and the ability to balance rapid innovation with enterprise-grade security, compliance, and governance requirements. You'll shape the future of AI-driven workflow automation and deliver measurable business value to global enterprise clients. You have already trialled multiple GenAI technologies in the last 2.5 years understanding the pitfalls and capabilties of different LLMs and approaches.

What You'll Do at Pega:

Strategic Leadership & Roadmap

Define and execute Pega’s Generative AI vision and multi-year technical roadmap aligned with business goals. Identify market opportunities, prioritize investments, and set KPIs and governance for responsible AI. Drive innovation in LLM orchestration, RAG, and agentic architectures.


Engineering, Architecture & Technical Execution

Lead end-to-end development from research to deployment and optimization. Ensure architectural consistency, performance, security, and compliance. Implement best practices for MLOps, model evaluation, prompt management, and observability. Manage vendor ecosystem for cost and risk balance.


Collaboration & Go-To-Market

Serve as GenAI evangelist; partner with Product, Engineering, GTM, and Customer Success to embed AI into workflows. Create reference architectures and enablement assets to accelerate adoption. Align with Legal, Security, and Compliance on responsible AI.


Talent Development

Recruit and mentor a global team across engineering and research. Foster a culture of experimentation and learning. Establish career paths, knowledge sharing, and engineering excellence.


Thought Leadership & Market Engagement

Publish insights on GenAI trends and Pegasystems’ approach. Engage with analysts, academia, and industry leaders. Represent Pegasystems at conferences and in strategic customer dialogues.

Who You Are:

  • 15+ years in software leadership, with 7+ years leading AI/ML initiatives.
  • 5+ years leading AI/ML initiatives with direct experience in Generative AI (LLMs, RAG - chunking, construction technqiues, agentic systems) and NLP. Proven track record launching and scaling AI-powered products/features at enterprise B2B scale.
  • Strong learning curiosity given the fast-moving nature of GenAI. Sees that Pega Blueprint is a game changer.
  • Outstanding ability to drive outcomes rather than be siloed by internal teams.
  • Deep technical expertise with modern AI stacks and enterprise SaaS architectures; strong knowledge of cloud-native deployments (e.g., microservices, Kubernetes, APIs).
  • Experience leading globally distributed engineering teams (50+ members) and driving cross-functional alignment.
  • Strong command of responsible AI, data privacy, security, and model governance in regulated environments.
  • Exceptional communication, executive presence, and stakeholder management; ability to translate complex technology into clear business value.

What You've Accomplished:

Additional Preferred Qualifications

  • Advanced degree (MS or PhD) in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field. Life long learner mindset outweighs academic credentials.
  • Demonstrated experience building research-oriented engineering teams and academic/industry partnerships.
  • Experience establishing MLOps practices, model evaluation frameworks, and AI observability at scale.
  • Familiarity with the AI vendor ecosystem and strategic build/buy/partner decision-making.
  • History of thought leadership (publications, patents, conference speaking) in AI/ML or GenAI.
  • Experience with Pega software.

Pega Offers You:

Pega is THE enterprise AI decisioning and workflow automation platform. Our Agentic orchestration unlocks business transforming outcomes for the World's largest companies. Our mantra of Build for Change® demonstrates our commitment towards continuous improvement, curiosity, and accountable execution. We are at a pivotal moment in our 40+ year history where our employees are empowered to “fuel the change” making their impact count as we excel beyond our Rule of 40 performance. Pega’s culture and values underpin how we work and the results and outcomes we achieve for our employees, clients, partners and investors.


  • Gartner Analyst acclaimed technology leadership across our categories of products
  • Continuous learning and development opportunities
  • An innovative, inclusive, agile, flexible, and fun work environment
  • Competitive global benefits program inclusive of pay + bonus incentive, employee equity in the company


#LI-AR1


AI in Action – Pega embraces the power of artificial intelligence. We encourage all employees to actively engage with AI technologies and continually explore ways to responsibly integrate AI into our products and processes. We may support parts of our recruitment process with automatic processing and, if required by law, you may in such cases have the right to request human intervention, challenge the outcome of such processing and comment on it.

Culture – At Pegasystems, we foster an environment where people feel valued and empowered to contribute their best. With global clients across industries and regions, we know our success depends on the unique perspectives, experiences, and talents of our people. Ours is a workplace where everyone can grow, collaborate, and deliver meaningful outcomes.

We encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences and focus on the core competencies and mindset needed to thrive in a role.

As an Equal Opportunity employer, Pegasystems will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran or disability status, or any other category protected by law.

Export Compliance – For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations such as this, Pegasystems may need to obtain export license approval from the U.S. Government and EU Authorities for certain individuals.

Accommodations – If you require reasonable accommodations under the Americans with Disabilities Act (US only) or comparable regional regulations in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please contact us here or contact (US only) 1-888-PEGA-NOW and/or 225 Wyman Street Waltham, MA 02451 ATTN: Benefits.
jobs.companyDescription: Pega develops software applications for customer engagement and operational excellence.

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.description:
About Atos Group

Atos is a global leader in digital transformation with approximately 78,000 employees and annual revenue of €10 billion. As the European number one in cybersecurity, cloud, and high-performance computing, Atos provides tailored end-to-end solutions across all industries in 68 countries. A pioneer in decarbonization services and products, Atos is committed to delivering secure and sustainable digital solutions for its clients. Listed on Euronext Paris as a Societas Europaea (SE), Atos supports the development of knowledge, education, and research through a multicultural approach, contributing to scientific and technological excellence worldwide.

As part of our continued growth, we are looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our team and play a key role in designing and developing powerful dashboards and reports for our clients.


As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining robust data pipelines and architectures that enable advanced analytics and AI-driven solutions. You will work closely with data scientists, architects, and business stakeholders to ensure data availability, quality, and scalability across cloud and hybrid environments. This role is critical in supporting digital transformation initiatives by delivering secure, high-performance data platforms that empower organizations to make data-driven decisions.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement scalable data pipelines and integration patterns.
  • Develop and optimize data architectures using Azure Data Services and/or other cloud platforms.
  • Ensure data quality, governance, and security compliance.
  • Collaborate with data scientists and business teams to translate requirements into technical solutions.
  • Apply performance tuning and troubleshooting for large-scale data processing.
  • Contribute to DevOps for Data (CI/CD, version control) and automation of deployments.
  • Mentor junior colleagues and share best practices within the team.

Your Profile:
  • 5+ years in data engineering or related roles; proven track record in delivering complex data solutions.
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
  • Familiarity with MLOps, ML pipelines, and advanced AI concepts.
  • Ability to translate business needs into technical solutions and troubleshoot complex issues.
  • Proficiency in SQL, Python, PySpark.
  • Knowledge and experience with Databricks and/or Snowflake.
  • Strong knowledge of Azure; experience with AWS or GCP is a plus.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in Dutch and English.
  • Agile team experience (Scrum, DevOps).
  • Willingness to travel and work at client locations.

What We Offer:

  • Participation in exciting consulting projects with room for innovation. Work on end-to-end digital and data transformation projects across various sectors, with impact from start to finish.
  • Excellent career opportunities in a global organization, including international mobility.
  • Personal and professional growth through certified training and access to the latest technologies.
  • Competitive salary, year-end bonus, and pension scheme.
  • 29 vacation days per year.
  • Flexible and hybrid working arrangements.
  • An energetic and supportive team culture that values diversity.

Here at Atos, diversity and inclusion are embedded in our DNA. Read more about our commitment to a fair work environment for all.

Atos is a recognized leader in its industry across Environment, Social and Governance (ESG) criteria. Find out more on our CSR commitment.

Choose your future. Choose Atos.
jobs.companyDescription: Across the world, Atos enables its customers and employees, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably, in a safe and secure information space.

jobs.title: AI Engineer
jobs.description:
As an AI Engineer at Terberg Special Vehicles, you’ll work in a multidisciplinary product team on the innovative “Mechanic of the Future” platform.


Your Impact

Do you want to help shape the digital future of our service technicians? You’ll develop, integrate, and maintain advanced AI solutions that directly contribute to more efficient service, improved customer satisfaction, and a future-proof organization. You’ll have the freedom to pioneer, innovate, and truly make a difference within a family-owned company with international ambitions.


What will you do?

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines (batch and real-time) and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines.
  • Integrate and manage data from diverse sources (cloud and on-premises), including setting up vector databases and embedding models.
  • Perform data preprocessing, feature engineering, model training, and evaluation using Python, (No)SQL, (Py)Spark, Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and relevant AI/ML libraries.
  • Fine-tune and evaluate large language models (LLMs) for domain-specific tasks, including prompt engineering.
  • Apply CI/CD, version control, and documentation for structured and reproducible development.
  • Ensure reliable, secure, and compliant data flows and AI models, following governance and ethical AI principles.
  • Monitor and optimize the performance and cost-efficiency of data pipelines and AI models.
  • Collaborate with software engineers, data scientists, product owners, and business stakeholders to deliver high-quality AI solutions.
  • Document model behavior, performance metrics, and decision logic for transparency and reproducibility.

Your Profile

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (Computer Science, Data Science, Software Engineering).
  • At least 3 years of experience as an AI/Data Engineer or similar role.
  • Experience with Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Python, (No)SQL, (Py)Spark, and CI/CD.
  • Knowledge of building and maintaining data pipelines, vector databases, and embedding models.
  • Proactive, independent, and strong communicator; you enjoy working in an agile team and take initiative.
  • Quality, security, and compliance are important to you, and you are always looking for improvement and innovation.

What do we offer?

  • A key role in an innovative team shaping Terberg’s digital transformation.
  • Work at a family-owned company with a friendly atmosphere, short lines of communication, and international ambitions.
  • Friday afternoons off, excellent employment conditions according to the Metal & Technology Collective Labor Agreement.
  • Opportunities for personal development via the Terberg Academy.
  • Hybrid working is possible.
  • Direct influence on the future of our products and services.

As a colleague at Terberg, you will enjoy a great role at one of the most prominent and largest manufacturing companies in the Netherlands. We work from Monday to Friday morning, leaving Friday afternoons free. The atmosphere in our family-owned company is pleasant, and you’ll be part of a motivated team. We value your input, and your ideas are always heard. Staying up-to-date in your field is important to us; you’ll have access to numerous training and growth opportunities through the Terberg Academy. This position comes with an excellent benefits package and we adhere to the Metal and Technology Collective Labor Agreement (CAO).


Is this your dreamjob?

Are you the AI Engineer who will help us make the Mechanic of the Future a reality? Apply directly via our website or contact Bjorn Frank, 0031-6-42 52 27 74 for more information. You can also contact Diederik Stratenus at +31 6 51 49 12 05. We look forward to your contribution to our team!


Terberg Special Vehicles is a global leader in the development, production, and service of specialized vehicles. As a family business, we have been committed to our people for over 150 years! Innovation is our strength, and sustainability is our answer. Since 2014, we have been investing in electrically powered vehicles and are actively testing hydrogen solutions. We aim to care for our environment responsibly so that future generations can also enjoy a good life on our planet.


We do not appreciate acquisition efforts in response to this vacancy. Unsolicited submissions of candidates will not be taken into consideration.
jobs.companyDescription: Royal Terberg Group is wereldwijd actief in de ontwikkeling, productie, modificatie en service van speciale voertuigen en systemen voor logistiek en afvalinzameling.

jobs.title: Lead AI Engineer
jobs.description:
Are you an ambitious Lead AI Engineer ready to bridge the gap between high-level strategy and production-ready code? At Enjins, we apply a software engineering mindset to all things AI - from traditional ML models to modern LLMs and Agentic architectures. As a Lead, you won’t just build; you will coach a talented team of engineers and lead complex GenAI projects in Climate Tech from design to deployment, while playing a defining role in the growth of our Utrecht hub.


About us

Since 2018, we have been engineering AI systems designed to provide long-term and meaningful value. Operating from our offices in Utrecht and Berlin, we partner with innovative tech companies throughout Northwest Europe to solve complex problems. Our client portfolio includes names like Crisp, PlanBlue, NextSense, and Groendus, and we actively prioritize partnerships within Climate Tech where our technology delivers a measurable, positive impact.

At our core, we are engineers first, prioritizing clean code, MLOps best practices, and system reliability over academic novelty. We remain deeply committed to building trustworthy and explainable AI. When you join us, you become part of a high-performing, growth-oriented team of expert engineers who value collaboration, continuous learning, and knowledge sharing.


What? [You'll be doing]

As a Lead AI Engineer, you will work at the intersection of technical mastery and strategic leadership. You will act as a hands-on lead in a consultancy context, embedded within client teams while managing a portfolio of accounts and mentoring the next generation of Enjins engineers.


Key responsibilities:

  • Team Leadership: Lead the AI Engineering team alongside other Leads, fostering a culture of technical excellence and pragmatic innovation.
  • Project Delivery: Own the end-to-end technical roadmap for client projects, ensuring AI/ML systems are scalable, reliable, and production-ready.
  • Strategic Advisory: Act as a technical partner for client executives (CTO, CEO, CIO), translating complex AI architectures into clear business value.
  • Operational Growth: Involve yourself in business-critical decisions regarding team growth, innovation roadmaps, and account management.

Requirements

We are looking for seasoned leaders who thrive on solving "unsolvable" problems with clean, scalable code.

Expertise & Skills

  • Experience: Minimum of 3–5 years of relevant experience as AI/ML Engineer in a consultancy context, with a proven track record of bringing models to production.
  • Technical Stack: Deep expertise in Python, SQL, and Git, with hands-on experience in containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and ETL/ELT orchestration.
  • Cloud & MLOps: Mastery of at least one major cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP) and experience spearheading MLOps/LLMOps architectures.
  • Leadership: Experience in coaching engineers, managing project delivery, and managing client accounts.


Mindset & Approach ✨

  • Consultative Leader: Comfortable engaging with board-level stakeholders to drive results and define AI strategy.
  • Pragmatic Engineer: You prioritize "production-ready" over "academic hype" and have a passion for Climate Tech impact.
  • Communicator: Excellent ability to translate complex technical findings into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.


Requirements

  • Fluent in English and eligible to work in the Netherlands.

Benefits

We invest heavily in your leadership journey, ensuring you remain at the technical forefront while growing as a business leader.

Accelerate your Growth & Development

  • M-Leap Journey: A structured leadership learning journey (mentoring, learning, and practice) with a dedicated budget for advanced certifications, and a specialised program for our Seniors.
  • C-Level Coaching: Regular 1-on-1 mentoring sessions with our founders and C-level team to support your growth toward senior leadership.
  • Transparent Reviews: A 360-degree feedback process and project-based assessments to ensure continuous professional evolution.


Innovation & Work Environment ️

  • Modern Workspace: Work from our office centrally located in Utrecht along the picturesque Oudegracht. (Note: Our office is not yet fully accessible to individuals with physical disabilities).
  • Top-tier Tools: Receive an Apple MacBook Pro and the latest tools to do your best work.
  • Competitive Salary: A monthly gross salary ranging indicative from €5.500 to €7.000, but depending on your experience and expertise. This base salary indication excludes holiday allowance, pension contributions, performance bonus, equity and benefits related to M-Leap's collective and personal investments.
  • Performance Bonus: An annual bonus equivalent to 1,5 months’ salary, specifically designed to recognise and value your individual contribution to our yearly success.
  • Equity Incentive: Inclusion in our VSOP (Virtual Stock Option Plan), giving you the potential to share in the long-term growth and financial upside of the company.


Work-life Balance & Culture

  • Time Off: 28 total vacation days (including flexibility for 3 national holidays).
  • Team Spirit: Monthly social events, from themed parties and sports tournaments to pub quizzes.
  • Sustainability: OV-First (Public Transport) travel policy fully covering your commute and meat-free catering during events.

jobs.title: UX Researcher
jobs.description:
32-36 uur | vanaf € 4.400,- | Den Haag (Hybride)


Lefebvre Sdu is dé toonaangevende kennispartner voor professionals in de juridische en fiscale sector. We transformeren van een traditionele uitgever naar een AI-first kennisplatform. Met GenIA-L, onze AI-platform, brengen we innovatieve oplossingen die professionals helpen om slimmer en sneller te werken. We zijn onderdeel van de internationale Lefebvre Group en werken vanuit Nederland aan cutting-edge technologie voor de legal tech markt.

Als UX Researcher ben je cruciaal in het vormgeven van gebruikerservaringen die complexe juridische en fiscale informatie toegankelijk maken. Je werkt nauw samen met product owners, designers, en AI engineers om inzichten te verzamelen die onze producten naar een hoger niveau tillen. Je onderzoekt hoe professionals in de praktijk werken en vertaalt dat naar concrete product verbeteringen.

Wat ga je doen?

  • Opzetten en uitvoeren van kwalitatief en kwantitatief gebruikersonderzoek (interviews, usability tests, surveys, data-analyse)
  • Onderzoeken hoe gebruikers omgaan met AI-gestuurde tools en interfaces
  • Samenwerken met het product team om research roadmaps te ontwikkelen
  • Vertalen van gebruikersinzichten naar concrete aanbevelingen en requirements
  • Opbouwen en onderhouden van user personas, journey maps en andere UX deliverables
  • Adviseren van stakeholders over UX best practices en onderzoeksresultaten
  • Bijdragen aan een data-driven product cultuur

Wat breng je mee?

  • Minimaal 3-5 jaar ervaring als UX Researcher
  • Sterke kennis van diverse onderzoeksmethoden (zowel kwalitatief als kwantitatief)
  • Ervaring met het onderzoeken van complexe, professionele software (B2B)
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met het presenteren van research uitkomsten aan stakeholders
  • Affiniteit met AI/ML toepassingen is een grote plus
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels
  • Je bent analytisch, nieuwsgierig en gebruikersgericht

Wat bieden wij?

Je krijgt een sleutelrol in de AI transformatie van een gerenommeerde organisatie. Je zal werken met state-of-the-art technologie en AI-toepassingen. We zijn een gedreven team van 15 specialisten dat snel groeit in een competitieve markt. Dat betekent veel autonomie en impact, maar ook ambiguïteit. Als je behoefte hebt aan duidelijke processen en volledig uitgewerkte briefs, is dit (nog) niet de juiste plek. Als je energie krijgt van meebouwen en dingen beter maken, wel.

Praktisch

  • Marktconform salaris
  • 36-urige werkweek
  • Eindejaarsuitkering en winstdeling
  • Persoonlijk keuzebudget (extra verlof, flexibel vakantiegeld)
  • MacBook en tooling naar keuze
  • Learning & Development budget
  • Hybride werken mogelijk (maar we zijn wel op kantoor voor samenwerking)
  • Kantoor in Den Haag (op loopafstand station Voorburg)

Klaar voor jouw start?

Top! Reageer dan snel en simpel via de solliciteer-knop! Heb je nog vragen dan kun je contact opnemen met Liza Kleijberg via sollicitatie@sdu.nl

Let op:

  • Wij nemen alleen sollicitanten aan die in Nederland wonen.
  • Wij werken zonder tussenkomst of hulp van werving- en selectiebureaus. Als wij daar toch gebruik van maken, werken wij samen met vaste leveranciers.

Over Lefebvre Sdu

Welkom bij Lefebvre Sdu. Hier zit je goed. Waarom? Omdat jouw ambitie, talent en inzet hier maximaal op hun plek zijn. Samen met het team bouw je elke dag aan vernieuwing. Met jullie krachten en ervaring brengen jullie complexe materie tot leven met innovatieve tools, producten en oplossingen. Door slimme integraties van content, data en technologie maken jullie wet- en regelgeving toegankelijk en toepasbaar. Zodat professionals die hiermee werken iedere dag succesvoller worden. Daar wordt de maatschappij ook nog eens beter van. Dat klinkt toch als de ideale werkomgeving?

Meer over Lefebvre Sdu
jobs.companyDescription: Het op tijd aanpassen aan de wereld van morgen, daar weten wij alles van. We ontwikkelen innovatieve oplossingen om de juridische en fiscale sector future-proof te maken. De toekomst begint vandaag!

jobs.title: Product Owner - AI-Driven Content Engineering
jobs.description:
32-36 uur | vanaf € 5.400,- | Den Haag (Hybride)


Bij Lefebvre Sdu zijn we volop bezig met een transformatie: van traditionele juridische en fiscale uitgever naar een AI-first knowledge platform. Met GenIA-L bouwen we aan de toekomst van juridische intelligence, waarbij hoogwaardige content centraal staat.

Wij zoeken een TechnicalProduct Owner met data science DNA die niet alleen de brug slaat tussen content en technologie, maar vooral zelf de eerste prototypes bouwt die laten zien hoe we met AI slimmere, schaalbare content pipelines kunnen creëren.

Wat ga je doen?

1. AI Model Development & Integration (60% van je tijd)

  • Je identificeert kansen waar AI/ML modellen het content proces kunnen verbeteren.
  • Je bouwt zelf MVPs en proof-of-concepts met Python, scikit-learn, transformers, LangChain om te valideren wat werkt.
  • Je experimenteert met verschillende modellen en evalueert hun performance op echte content data.
  • Je werkt samen met het AI-engineeringteam om succesvolle modellen in productie te brengen.

2. Content Process Innovation (30%)

  • Je werkt samen met redacties en experts om te begrijpen waar AI de grootste waarde kan toevoegen.
  • Je definieert samen met stakeholders wat 'goede' content is voor AI-verwerking.
  • Je ontwikkelt metrics en dashboards om content kwaliteit en AI-performance te monitoren en bouwt workflows waarin menselijke expertise en AI elkaar versterken.

3. Product Ownership & Stakeholder Management (10%)

  • Je vertaalt technische mogelijkheden naar business value voor niet-technische stakeholders.
  • Je prioriteert experimenten op basis van potentiële impact.
  • Je beheert verwachtingen en communiceert over wat wel/niet mogelijk is.

Wat breng je mee?

  • Data science background: minimaal 3-5 jaar ervaring als data scientist waarbij je zelf modellen hebt gebouwd en in productie gebracht
  • Hands-on mindset: je schrijft zelf Python code en kunt snel prototypes bouwen
  • AI/ML toolkit: ervaring met LLMs, NLP, text classification, embeddings, retrieval systems
  • 0-to-1 mentaliteit: je vindt het leuk om dingen van scratch op te bouwen zonder perfecte requirements
  • Business savvy: je snapt waarom dingen waarde moeten leveren en bent niet alleen aan het experimenteren
  • Je bent een sterke communicator, data-driven en ondernemend
  • Je bent Data-driven
  • Je bent ondernemend en praktisch
  • Een Uitstekende beheersing van Nederlands en Engels, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk
  • Je bent comfortabel in een omgeving die volop in transformatie is
  • HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau (bij voorkeur technische richting)

Wat bieden wij?

  • Een unieke rol waarin je zowel strategisch denkt als hands-on bouwt aan AI-oplossingen
  • De kans om van scratch MVPs te ontwikkelen en deze door te laten groeien naar productie
  • Een sleutelrol in de AI-transformatie van een traditionele uitgever naar een toonaangevend knowledge platform
  • Nauw samenwerken met een sterk team van AI engineers en data scientists
  • Werken aan producten die door duizenden juridische professionals dagelijks worden gebruikt
  • Ruimte voor experimenteren en innoveren met cutting-edge AI-technologie
  • Hybride werken met flexibiliteit in tijd en plaats
  • Uitstekende primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden

Klaar voor jouw start?

Top! Reageer dan snel en simpel via de solliciteer-knop! Heb je nog vragen dan kun je contact opnemen met Koen Aarns via sollicitatie@sdu.nl

Let op:

  • Wij nemen alleen sollicitanten aan die in Nederland wonen.
  • Wij werken zonder tussenkomst of hulp van werving- en selectiebureaus. Als wij daar toch gebruik van maken, werken wij samen met vaste leveranciers.

Over Lefebvre Sdu

Welkom bij Lefebvre Sdu. Hier zit je goed. Waarom? Omdat jouw ambitie, talent en inzet hier maximaal op hun plek zijn. Samen met het team bouw je elke dag aan vernieuwing. Met jullie krachten en ervaring brengen jullie complexe materie tot leven met innovatieve tools, producten en oplossingen. Door slimme integraties van content, data en technologie maken jullie wet- en regelgeving toegankelijk en toepasbaar. Zodat professionals die hiermee werken iedere dag succesvoller worden. Daar wordt de maatschappij ook nog eens beter van. Dat klinkt toch als de ideale werkomgeving?

Meer over Lefebvre Sdu

jobs.title: Azure Solution Architect (Data & AI)
jobs.description:
How you can make your mark

Make your mark as an Azure Solution Architect at Boskalis!

As the Azure Solution Architect for Data and AI, you are responsible for architecting, designing, and overseeing initiatives within the IT Data Services team, which consists of three sub-teams: Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, and AI.

You act as a key liaison between IT Data Services and other operational IT teams, including Infrastructure Platform Operations and Cyber Risk Management, ensuring secure, scalable, and compliant solutions.

The mission of IT Data Services is to maximize the value of data and AI across Boskalis. We are building a robust data platform based on data products and data pipelines, supported by modern Azure landing zone principles. On this foundation, we develop BI and AI solutions using Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, Azure Databricks, a proprietary Boskalis AI chatbot, and an Azure Digital Twin solution for real-time project monitoring, simulations, and intelligent automation.

Your responsibilities Azure Solution Architect

  • Design, own, and evolve the end-to-end Azure architecture for data, BI, and AI platforms.
  • Define architectural standards, patterns, and best practices aligned with Azure landing zone principles.
  • Translate business needs into scalable, secure, and future-proof solution architectures.
  • Guide and review solution designs from data engineers, BI developers, and AI engineers.
  • Architect and oversee:
    • Data platforms and pipelines (e.g. lakehouse, streaming, batch processing).
    • BI architectures using Power BI and Microsoft Fabric.
    • AI solutions using Azure Databricks and MLOps practices.
    • Azure Digital Twin solutions integrated with simulation software and real-time events.
  • Ensure solutions comply with security, privacy, and governance requirements in close cooperation with Cyber Risk Management.
  • Collaborate with Infrastructure Platform Operations on networking, identity, connectivity, and platform services.
  • Support teams with architectural decision-making during implementation and delivery.
  • Stay up to date with Azure, data, BI, and AI developments, and actively introduce innovations where valuable.
  • Contribute to roadmap development for the Data & AI platform at Boskalis.
  • Act as a technical sparring partner for stakeholders across IT and the business.

Your qualities and experience
You can move ahead as an Azure Solution Architect if you have:

  • At least 2,5 years of relevant work experience.
  • Proven experience as a Solution Architect in complex enterprise environments.
  • Strong hands-on and architectural experience with Microsoft Azure, including:
    • Azure Data services (e.g. Azure Data Lake, Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, Microsoft Fabric).
    • Azure Databricks.
    • Azure AI services.
    • Azure networking, identity (Entra ID), and security concepts.
  • Solid understanding of data engineering, BI, and AI/ML architectures.
  • Experience designing data platforms based on data products and domain-oriented approaches is a plus.
  • Familiarity with Power BI and transition paths to Microsoft Fabric.
  • Experience with Digital Twin, simulation, or event-driven architectures is an advantage.
  • Knowledge of DevOps / DataOps / MLOps practices.

Skills & Competencies

  • Strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
  • Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong stakeholder management and collaboration skills.
  • Able to balance strategic vision with pragmatic, hands-on decision-making.
  • Fluent in English (spoken and written).

We offer

What you can expect

  • A dynamic environment: A job that allows you to collaborate with a talented team of experts from different backgrounds and contribute to making a significant impact.
  • Rewarding conditions: A competitive salary and much more, including holiday allowance, holiday entitlement of 26 days (based on a full-time contract) and a number of collective scheduled days off, a non-contributory pension scheme, collective schemes such as company health insurance and travel allowance.
  • Career development: We offer you plenty of opportunities to bring out the best in yourself for example through (online) courses at our Boskalis academy.
  • The Boskalis campus: Experience the unique Boskalis vibe at our Papendrecht site, complete with restaurants, sports field, and a wharf where our vessels dock. We offer a state-of-the-art auditorium, brainstorming rooms, experience center for client meetings, and a barista corner where you can connect with colleagues.
  • Young Boskalis: Are you under 36? Come and join Young Boskalis! Have fun and join in social and sports activities ranging from pub quizzes to yoga, bootcamps and an annual sailing boat race. Networking and knowledge sharing are a vital part of Young Boskalis as well.

Extra information

  • Your team: You will work within the IT Data Services team together with 16 colleagues working in the data, BI, and AI teams. You will report to the Manager IT Data Services.
  • Where you will work: For office-based roles, in consultation with your manager and your team, you work partly at home and partly in the office.
  • Full/part-time job: The position of Azure Solution Architect is a full-time job (40 hours a week).
  • Next steps: Apply easily by completing the online application form. Interviews are held online or in the office. Once it’s clear we’re a good match, we’ll make you an offer – and look forward to welcoming you to the company.

About Boskalis

Working at Boskalis is about creating new horizons and sustainable solutions. In a world where population growth, an increase of global trade, demand for (new) energy and climate change are driving forces, we challenge you to make your mark in finding innovative and relevant solutions for complex infrastructural and marine projects.

Interested?

We’ll be happy to answer your questions about the position of Azure Solution Architect. Please contact Robert Smits, senior corporate recruiter via 078-696 83 98

Please note: Boskalis never requests a financial contribution to arrange visas or other documents related to a job vacancy. Be wary of individuals who pretend to be our recruiters and do ask for such contributions.

Disclaimer for Recruiters and Recruitment Agencies
We appreciate your interest in our vacancies and understand that your candidate might be enthusiastic about this exciting opportunity. However, our recruitment process is not structured this way, at Boskalis we handle recruitment ourselves. There fore we do not accept unsolicited applications or CVs from recruitment agencies. Any submission will be treated as a direct application.

#LI-RS1

jobs.title: AI Automation Engineer / AI Systems Builder
jobs.description:
Locatie: flexibel / hybride
Dienstverband: fulltime (32–40 uur)

Bouw jij AI omdat je niet anders kunt?

Ben jij iemand die liever iets werkends oplevert dan er een PowerPoint over maakt? En krijg je energie van slimme automatisering, data en schaalbare systemen die échte impact maken?

Dan pas je waarschijnlijk goed bij LUCRATIEF.

Wij zoeken een AI Automation Engineer die samen met ons AI-systemen bouwt die processen versnellen, kosten besparen en bedrijven slimmer laten werken.

Wat ga je doen?

Bij LUCRATIEF werk je aan concrete AI-oplossingen voor ons eigen bedrijf en een beperkt aantal klanten. Geen eindeloze trajecten, maar: bouwen, testen en live zetten.

Je houdt je onder andere bezig met:

  • Bouwen van AI-oplossingen met Python, JavaScript, LLM’s en machine learning
  • Automatiseren en optimaliseren van bedrijfsprocessen
  • Ontwerpen van slimme workflows (o.a. RAG, agents, decision support)
  • Werken met data: structureren, opschonen, analyseren en toepassen
  • Bouwen en beheren van n8n / Zapier workflows (webhooks, routers, data transforms)
  • Integreren met externe tools via API’s (OAuth2, rate limits, retries)
  • Inrichten van logging, monitoring en alerts
  • Werken met klantdata volgens AVG/GDPR (security, secrets & permissions)
  • Meedenken over wat wel en niet gebouwd moet worden (business first)
  • Systemen schaalbaar, onderhoudbaar en productie-klaar maken

Je werkt in een klein, scherp AI-team met korte lijnen. Iedereen die hier zit, bouwt.

Hoe wij werken

  • Lean & mean (geen vergadercultuur, geen onzin)
  • Focus op impact en winstgevendheid
  • Alles wat we bouwen draait in productie
  • Continu verbeteren (technisch én inhoudelijk)
  • Veel vrijheid, met bijbehorend eigenaarschap

Wat verwachten we van jou? (Must-haves)

  • Goede kennis van Python en/of JavaScript
  • Begrip van AI / ML / LLM’s en ervaring met toepassen ervan
  • Je kunt zelfstandig oplossingen uitzoeken en bouwen
  • Ervaring met automations (n8n, Zapier of vergelijkbaar)
  • Ervaring met API-koppelingen
  • Basiskennis van productie-omgevingen: error handling, retries, logging, version control (Git)
  • Comfortabel met JSON, webhooks en databases/spreadsheets
  • Je denkt in oplossingen, niet in beperkingen
  • Nieuwsgierig en continu bezig met leren

Nice-to-haves (geen dealbreakers)

  • Ervaring met LLM’s, RAG en vector databases
  • Kennis van PyTorch, scikit-learn of vergelijkbare libraries
  • Ervaring met cloud (AWS / Azure) en/of Docker
  • Affiniteit met processen, automatisering en businesslogica

Opleiding? Leuk als je die hebt, niet verplicht. Wij kijken naar wat je kunt, niet naar je diploma.

Wat bieden wij?

  • Werken aan echte AI-systemen met echte impact
  • Veel vrijheid in hoe je problemen oplost
  • Klein team met hoge technische standaard
  • Ruimte om te experimenteren én te shippen
  • Marktconform salaris, afhankelijk van je ervaring
  • Flexibel werken (locatie en tijden in overleg)
  • Meegroeien met een bedrijf dat AI serieus neemt

Waarom LUCRATIEF?

Omdat wij:

  • AI zien als gereedschap, niet als hype
  • Geen consultants zijn, maar bouwers
  • Snappen dat slimme systemen geld moeten opleveren

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime

Salaris: €3.000,00 - €5.000,00 per maand

Verwacht aantal uur: 24 – 40 per week

Arbeidsvoorwaarden:

  • Auto van de zaak
  • Bedrijfsfeesten
  • Dienstreizen vergoeding
  • Fietsplan
  • Kosteloos parkeren
  • Mogelijkheid tot promotie
  • Reiskostenvergoeding
  • Vrijdagmiddagborrel
  • Werk vanuit huis

Werklocatie: Hybride werken in 3454 Utrecht

jobs.title: Android Full-stack AI Engineer
jobs.description:
About Fairphone

Fairphone is more than just a company - we are a global leader in sustainable, modular electronics, on a mission to change the electronics industry from the inside out. Built on strong social and environmental values, we are a diverse and inclusive team from all walks of life creating market consumer electronics that make a real impact.

At Fairphone, you will find a supportive and safe space where everyone can be themselves, collaborate openly, and have the freedom to learn and grow - because that’s how we innovate and drive change together!

So… are you a proactive, self-motivated team player who loves taking initiative and bringing positive energy? Do you thrive in a fast-moving start-up or scale-up environment? Are you a great communicator who values collaboration and embraces different perspectives? And most importantly, do you feel a strong connection to Fairphone’s mission and values? If you're nodding along and thinking, “Yes, that’s me!”, then check out our vacancy below!

Please know that we acknowledge that we are living in a time where the use of AI can bring many efficiencies and support. However, we want to know the real YOU. Please try to limit the use of AI tools to generate answers to the application; we value authenticity and encourage you to use your creativity!

  • Location: Amsterdam (you should have the right to work in the Netherlands)

  • Hours: 32-40 hours per week

  • Contract duration: 6 months

  • Deadline to apply: We review applications on a rolling basis. Please apply as soon as possible.

About your role

This is a unique opportunity to join our Software Engineering team, where you will be instrumental in developing cutting-edge, full-stack predictive maintenance features for our acclaimed mobile phones. You will drive the creation of sophisticated, data-driven systems designed to preemptively detect and mitigate hardware or software issues. This role signifies a critical strategic shift for Fairphone, moving the maintenance paradigm from reactive fixing to proactive, intelligent intervention, which will directly enhance the longevity and reliability of Fairphone devices, contributing measurably to our mission of building a more sustainable future for mobile technology.

Your profile


  • You feel a strong and intrinsic connection with Fairphone’s vision, mission and values.

  • You are hands-on, take initiative and see opportunities where others see issues, and apply them via constructive, creative thinking.

  • You love technical challenges.

  • You embrace diversity in thoughts, opinions, levels of seniority and backgrounds and feel good working with many nationalities in a multicultural environment.

  • You are passionate about improving the quality of our software. A small fix delivered to many people has a big impact.

Key Responsibilities & Objectives

  • Designing and developing new features for predictive maintenance for the Android platform to anticipate hardware failures (e.g., battery degradation, storage corruption, overheating), software glitches, or performance bottlenecks.

  • Architect, implement, and maintain the end-to-end stack—from the device kernel (data acquisition) to the cloud (model training/serving) and the Android application (user feedback/alerts).

  • Utilise real-time device data, advanced analytics, and machine learning models to accurately anticipate potential failures, degradation, or performance bottlenecks before they impact the user experience.

  • Take ownership of both the Android (Frontend) components, including user-facing predictive diagnostics and actionable insights, and the Backend infrastructure (Microservices) necessary for large-scale data ingestion, model serving, and continuous learning.

  • Clean and manage large datasets for model training.

  • Version, track, package, and deploy models into a production environment, treating ML models as first-class citizens in a CI/CD pipeline.

  • Unit and integration testing code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability.

  • Bug fixing and improving application performance.

  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.

  • Working with data sources and APIs.

  • Continuously discovering, evaluating, and implementing new technologies to maximise development efficiency.

Your Skills & Experience

  • Proven software development experience in Android front-end and back-end development.

  • You are a programmer and are comfortable with Kotlin.

  • You know about Compose.

  • Deep knowledge of the Android SDK.

  • Experience with working on Android framework and server-side technologies with Spring Framework.

  • Theoretical and practical knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms, Deep Learning concepts, and Neural Network Architectures.

  • Familiarity with major AI/ML Frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.

  • Experience with Large Language Models (LLMs), including using and integrating APIs, and applying techniques like Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)

  • You have experience/knowledge with working in an agile environment.

  • You have experience/knowledge working with software development tools such as Git, Gerrit, Gitlab and Jenkins.

  • Excellent debugging skills to solve challenging problems.

  • Experience working with remote data via REST, JSON and XML.

  • Experience with third-party libraries and APIs.

  • A solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle.

  • You appreciate Free and Open Source software and want to collaborate with the community.

What Fairphone can offer you?

  • The opportunity to create an impact on the electronics industry around the world.

  • A diverse work environment full of international, passionate, warm-hearted team members.

  • 25 paid holidays per year (based on a full-time contract) next to the other public holidays in the Netherlands. You’ll also get a day off on your birthday! Additionally, the longer you stay, the more holidays you get!

  • Daily, healthy lunch, organic FairChain coffee, and many more tasty things.

  • You will join Fairphone’s collective pension scheme, and we will contribute to building your pension.

  • You will receive a MacBook, Fairbuds, and a Fairphone as working devices.

  • Hybrid working model - We are remote-friendly, and you can work up to 60% of your time per month from home or any other location you want. We also contribute up to €250 for your home office set-up.

  • Public transport allowance – we fully cover your 2nd class commute from your home to the office

  • Bike allowance – We support you with a bike purchase of up to €300, and you’ll also have a yearly repair budget of up to €100! We also cover 23 cents per km for your biking distance from home to the office (or train station) and back!

  • Grow with us! We encourage you to develop at Fairphone. That’s why we’ll support your career goals with coaching (Inuka), trainings, workshops, or courses that you can join with your development budget.

  • Kitchen with beautiful views to the IJ waterfront.

  • There’s a gym and recreation and yoga rooms in the building where you can build healthy habits, stay active and have fun with your colleagues, as well as a subscription to our mental & physical well-being services (Inuka & Urban Sports)

About us

DEI @Fairphone

At Fairphone, we care about people, planet and you. It’s natural that we see diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) as an essential part of how we work together and do business.


We support and further strengthen our inclusive work environment and culture by more formally implementing various DEI efforts to ensure all Fairphoners feel included, respected, and supported.

jobs.title: Advisory Enterprise Architect
jobs.description:
Company Description


It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.


Job Description


ServiceNow is seeking Enterprise Architects to join our Team. The Enterprise Architecture Team is part of our pre-sales organization focused on building credibility and trust with the technical leaders in our largest customers by developing cross-functional strategies and solutions. Our team brings technical expertise, real-world experience, strong executive engagement skills and an inspirational mindset to help our customers understand the opportunities of the “platform of platforms” vision. We act as technical leaders for our customers most complex solutions, designed to ensure that they can realize the value they need. We do this by leveraging best practice and industry standards to build customer trust and architect best in class solutions.

While collaborating with customers, partners, and the wider ServiceNow sales team, the right candidate will create and communicate high-level architectures and strategies that are both written and verbal, to audiences up to and including the CIO/CTO level. The Enterprise Architect will elegantly articulate the advantage of ServiceNow being built on a single cloud platform consisting of a single user interface, one code base and one data model. The Enterprise Architect will also lead and participate in the delivery of workshops, best practice overviews, and educational sessions to existing customers and partners.

What you get to do in this role:

  • Engage with customer executives to identify pain points and opportunities to deliver value and then translate them into solutions from ServiceNow
  • Work with a wide variety of customers, colleagues and partners to help them understand the power of the Now platform and the potential opportunities of the future of work
  • Lead architecture and design engagements to demonstrate how ServiceNow meets the needs of strategic customers, including; IT Transformation, Digital Products/Services, Platform as a Service, Enterprise Service Management, and the co-creation of industry specific solutions.
  • Understand the business strategy of the customer and articulate how ServiceNow can enable and deliver value to their organization, seamlessly integrating into their current and future technology landscape
  • Understand the detail behind the ServiceNow and platform of platforms architecture and communicate it at various levels
  • Work with architecture development methods, modelling approaches and architecture patterns for integration
  • Interact at multiple levels within a customer account (Enterprise Architects, Domain Architects, Directors, VPs, and CXOs) and maintain these relationships throughout their customer journey.
  • Provide thought leadership and collaborate with internal ServiceNow business units
  • Identify, lead and contribute to the creation of best practices, white papers, workshops, etc

Qualifications


To be successful in this role you have:

  • Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
  • Passion and energy for building business relationships and is accustomed to driving the simplification of complex concepts into compelling customer proposals
  • Drive for results using out-of-the-box innovative thinking together with excellent problem-solving skills
  • An intrinsic ability to understand and prioritize work and is willing to make big bets when the time is right, to invest time and energy in the right areas.
  • Willingness to jump-in and roll-up their sleeves alongside customers, colleagues and partners to get things done faster and better.
  • 10 or more years of proven success in influencing senior technology leaders to drive change in a pre-sales, customer, or delivery focused role.
  • A track record of success in using Human Centered Design techniques to explore the customers current reality and set a vision for the future.
  • Expertise designing, implementing and managing advanced architectures in an application domain and integrating multiple systems or platforms
  • Experience with Enterprise Architecture or Application Architecture pre-sales in a software vendor or professional services environment.
  • Familiarity with common Enterprise and Industry Architecture frameworks such as: TOGAF, Zachman, IT4IT, BIAN, TMForum, etc.
  • Excellent understanding of the architectural principles for cloud-based platforms that include SaaS, PaaS, multi-tenancy, and automation
  • Experience and understanding of multiple technical domains - application, data, DevOps, AI/ML, integration, big data, mobility, analytics, etc.
  • Intrinsically curious and passionate about researching current and emerging technologies and developing innovative solutions
  • Experience presenting architecture concepts, designs, and goals to technology leaders and partners
  • Either Public Healthcare, Retail or Manufacturing Industry expertise is required

TR21


Additional Information


Work Personas

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

Equal Opportunity Employer

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

Accommodations

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

Export Control Regulations

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.
