jobs.title: Senior AI Architect - Telecommunicatie
jobs.description:
Position Description:

(Note: This job posting is only open to native level or near-native level Dutch speakers. If you are not proficient in Dutch, please have a look at our other job postings instead!)
Spreek jij native of near-native Nederlands? Lees dan verder!

Ben jij een strategische denker met diepe technische kennis van AI, LLM’s, machine learning en cloudplatformen? Wil jij organisaties helpen om AI op schaal te ontwerpen, integreren en veilig te implementeren? Dan is deze rol als Senior AI Architect precies voor jou!

Jouw rol in ons team
Als AI Architect ben jij de visionair én technisch leider achter belangrijke AI-initiatieven. Je ontwerpt end-to-end AI-architecturen, bepaalt de technologische richting en zorgt dat AI-, ML- en LLM-oplossingen veilig, schaalbaar en betrouwbaar worden gebouwd.
In jouw rol werk je op het snijvlak van business, technologie en data. Je adviseert stakeholders, begeleidt teams en vertaalt complexe vraagstukken naar robuuste AI-architecturen die waarde leveren. Je bouwt mee aan enterprise AI-platformen en helpt de organisatie volwassen te worden in verantwoord, data-gedreven werken.

Wat ga je doen?
  • Ontwerpen van Enterprise AI-architecturen, inclusief LLM-, ML-, NLP- en automatiseringsoplossingen.
  • Opstellen van AI- en data-architectuurprincipes, kaders en best practices om AI schaalbaar en veilig uit te rollen.
  • Leiden van de technische AI-strategie en roadmap; bepalen van technologiekeuzes, platformstandaarden en integraties.
  • Vertalen van businessdoelen naar technische AI-oplossingen en referentiearchitecturen.
  • Samenwerken met data engineers, MLOps-teams, securityspecialisten en productteams om AI van POC naar productie te brengen.
  • Waarborgen van compliance (AVG), security, governance en ethische AI-richtlijnen.
  • Ontwerpen en implementeren van MLOps-/LLMOps-processen voor deployment, monitoring, lifecycle management en continuous improvement.
  • Evalueren van nieuwe AI-technologieën, frameworks en Cloud services, en advies geven over vendorselectie.
  • Coachen van engineers, data scientists en AI-specialisten binnen projecten of teams.
  • Sparren met leiders, architecten en C-level stakeholders over AI-strategie, risico’s en waardecreatie.

Wat breng je mee?
  • Je hebt een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in AI, Informatica, Data Science of een verwant vakgebied.
  • Minimaal 5–8 jaar ervaring binnen AI-, ML- of data-architectuur (senior) of ervaring met AI-architectuur én aansturen van teams (manager).
  • Diepgaande kennis van AI/ML-concepten, LLM’s, GenAI, NLP, vector databases en retrieval augmented generation (RAG).
  • Sterke technische ervaring met Cloud platformen zoals Azure, AWS of GCP (ML-, AI- en data services).
  • Vaardig in Python of vergelijkbare talen, inclusief ML/AI-frameworks (bijv. PyTorch, TensorFlow).
  • Ervaring met MLOps/LLMOps, CI/CD, feature stores, model registries en geautomatiseerde pipelines.
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden en in staat om complexe AI-concepten helder uit te leggen.
  • Je kunt schakelen tussen strategisch denken en hands-on architectuurwerk.
  • Ervaring met Enterprise-omgevingen, security-by-design en data governance is een grote pré.

Wat typeert jou?
Je bent nieuwsgierig, vernieuwend en hebt een sterke visie op de toekomst van AI. Je ziet kansen, durft richting te bepalen en krijgt mensen mee in verandering. Je combineert technische diepgang met leiderschap en weet hoe je AI-oplossingen schaalbaar, veilig en waardevol maakt.

Wat bieden wij?
  • Een sleutelrol in de vormgeving van onze Enterprise AI-strategie en -architectuur.
  • Mogelijkheid om innovatieve AI-technologieën en LLM’s op schaal te implementeren.
  • Veel vrijheid om te bouwen, experimenteren en te innoveren.
  • Ruimte om teams te coachen, leiderschap te tonen en de AI-richting te bepalen.
  • Hybride werken, flexibele werktijden en uitstekende doorgroeimogelijkheden.
  • Een ambitieuze werkomgeving waar AI-topprioriteit is.

Waarom CGI
CGI is één van 's werelds grootste IT-consultancy bedrijven en speelt een grote rol in sectoren zoals Overheid, finance, lucht- en ruimtevaart, infrastructurele organisaties, telecom, retail sector en energie- en productiebedrijven. Bij ons werk je niet alleen aan innovatieve projecten, maar ook aan je eigen toekomst.

  • Werken in kleine, zelfsturende teams met experts in jouw vakgebied.
  • Direct een vast contract en een uitstekend salaris.
  • Flexibele werktijden en parttime mogelijkheden.
  • Ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en de regie over je eigen carrière.
  • Werken met de nieuwste technologieën.
  • De mogelijkheid om aandeelhouder te worden van CGI.
Bij CGI geloven we in diversiteit en inclusie, omdat dit leidt tot betere samenwerking en innovatie. We kijken uit naar jouw bijdrage aan ons team!

Sluit je aan bij ons team van experts en solliciteer direct!
We nemen dan zo snel mogelijk contact met je op! Heb je nog vragen over de inhoud van de vacature, stel ze aan Director Consulting Services Roxanne Krijsman via roxanne.kruijsman@cgi.com Vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure? Neem contact op met Recruitment Business Partner Natrah Pula via 06 11218723 of via Natrah.pula@cgi.com.

We werken niet samen met externe recruitment bureau’s. Acquisitie wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.

#LI-SP4

What you can expect from us:

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

In 1976 opgericht als een familiebedrijf, is CGI vandaag de dag een van de grootste onafhankelijke zakelijke en ICT-dienstverleners ter wereld. Bij ons draait het om ownership, teamwork en respect. Je krijgt de ruimte om al je talenten volledig te ontplooien.

Vanaf je eerste werkdag ben je mede-eigenaar van CGI. We profiteren samen van ons succes en je krijgt de kans én verantwoordelijkheid om actief bij te dragen aan de koers en strategie van ons bedrijf.

Jouw inzet voegt waarde toe. Je werkt aan innovatieve oplossingen en bouwt aan je netwerk van collega's en klanten. Je hebt toegang tot wereldwijde kansen om je ideeën te realiseren, mogelijkheden te benutten en te profiteren van onze kennis van de industrie en technologische expertise.

Ontdek bij ons de mogelijkheden voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling en zet de volgende stap in je carrière. Hier staat jouw succes centraal!
jobs.companyDescription: Founded in 1976, CGI is among the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

jobs.title: AI and Data Engineer
jobs.description:
Department

The AI Center of Excellence ( CoE ) is the strategic enabler within the technology organization, helping business domains and technology delivery teams shape and mature their AI ideas into secure, scalable, and production-ready solutions. Our mission is to accelerate AI adoption across Robeco by providing expertise , frameworks, and governance that empower teams to innovate responsibly and transition smoothly from concept to enterprise deployment.

In addition to AI, the new ‘AI CoE & Technology Innovation’ department will monitor emerging technologies and, together with delivery teams and Enterprise Architecture, assess their applicability for Robeco.

Position & Requirements

We’re looking for a skilled AI and Data Engineer, who is excited to play a foundational role in building a new, high-impact team from the ground up. Within this team, you will drive AI adoption within our business. You will design, develop, and deploy AI solutions which optimize operations, unlock new insights for our clients, and drive marketing impact.

As an AI and Data Engineer, you will report to the Head of AI & Technology Innovation.

Core Responsibilities

As an AI Engineer within the Robeco AI Center of Excellence your key responsibilities would be to:

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with business and technology teams to translate ideas into actionable solutions;
  • Collect, clean, and analyze structured and unstructured data;
  • Design and implement rapid, functional prototypes that follow best practices to validate AI concepts and demonstrate feasibility;
  • Build predictive and generative models using modern ML and AI frameworks;
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to test strategic AI use cases/ models align with organizational goals;
  • Work closely with data scientists and architects to ensure prototypes can transition smoothly into scalable solutions once validated;
  • Conduct experiments and evaluate model performance using appropriate metrics and ensuring reproducibility;
  • Stay current with the latest AI/ML research and technologies, integrating innovative approaches into solutions;
  • Act as a trusted advisor and sparring partner for our AI champions within business teams, fostering adoption and knowledge sharing;
  • Build strong relationships with business and technology delivery teams to ensure the AI Center of Excellence is deeply embedded within core business processes, fostering trust and alignment; and
  • Contribute to shaping a newly established team by promoting collaboration, defining best practices, and helping create a culture of innovation and adaptability.

What We’re Looking For

Must have qualifications include:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field (or equivalent experience);
  • We are hiring for a range of experience levels but expected a minimum of 2 years' experience in an engineering or similar role.
  • Strong programming skills in Python and SQL as well as familiarity with best coding practices;
  • Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation;
  • Experience with cloud platforms (preferably Azure and Snowflake) and version control systems (Git);
  • Understanding of AI/ML capabilities in business applications (e.g. Cortex on Snowflake, Copilot in Microsoft CRM);
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with attention to detail; and
  • Ability to communicate complex concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Preferred qualifications include:

  • Master's or PhD in Computer Science, AI/ML, or related field;
  • Experience with LLMs and AI;
  • Experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn);
  • Experience with containerization (Kubernetes) and API development;
  • Contributions to open-source AI/ML projects or published research or papers in AI/ML conferences or journals;
  • Understanding data privacy, security and AI regulations;
  • Understanding of AI use cases in Sales, Marketing and Service processes; and
  • Understanding of AI use cases in Financial services.

Other considerations

  • The position is for a minimum of 32 hours per week.
  • This is a hybrid role, requiring the candidate to work in office (Rotterdam based) for 60% of the time.
  • Working permit for working in the Netherlands

Why Join Us

You’ll work at the intersection of finance, technology, and innovation, shaping how investments leverage AI responsibly. We foster a culture of collaboration, adaptability, and inclusion, where your voice matters.

Research shows that female candidates only apply if they meet 100% of the requirements, while male candidates already do so at 60%. Please do apply, we’re looking forward to hearing from you.

All applications will be treated with the utmost confidentiality. An assessment and integrity test may be used in the selection procedure.

Robeco Recruiting Team

jobs.title: Senior VLSI Verification Engineer (AI Compute SoC) – Poland / EU remote / Kraków hybrid
jobs.description:
Our client is a fast-growing deep-tech company building a next-generation AI compute SoC, combining high-performance AI processing with advanced networking capabilities. They have 70+ engineers across Israel, Europe, and the US, and with their first silicon already taped out and functioning they are now expanding their VLSI team in Poland.

They are looking for a highly independent Senior VLSI Verification Engineer who can own a verification domain end-to-end and operate as an extension of the Israeli VLSI team. This is a senior, impact-heavy role requiring strong technical leadership, autonomy, and experience with complex SoCs.

What You Will Do
  • Take full ownership of block/cluster verification from specification to sign-off.
  • Build and evolve SystemVerilog UVM verification environments.
  • Drive unit-level, subsystem, and full-chip verification flows.
  • Define verification strategy and methodology for your domain.
  • Collaborate closely with architecture, RTL, and AI compute teams (mostly IL-based).
  • Work on a state-of-the-art SoC that includes NoC, CPU subsystems, PCIe, DMA, memory hierarchies, and AI accelerators.

What We’re Looking For
  • 7+ years of ASIC/SoC pre-silicon verification (senior-level autonomy is essential).
  • Deep knowledge of SystemVerilog and UVM.
  • Experience building verification from scratch and owning a block/cluster.
  • Hands-on experience across unit, subsystem, and full-chip verification.
  • Solid understanding of SoC architecture.
  • B.Sc./M.Sc. in Electrical or Computer Engineering.

Nice to Have
  • AMBA/AXI, NoC, CPU subsystems, PCIe, DMA, networking hardware.
  • Experience with AI/ML accelerators or high-throughput pipelines.
  • Prior tape-out experience.

Why This Role Is Unique
  • Work on a real AI compute SoC with a successfully taped-out first generation.
  • High autonomy: you will operate as a senior extension of the IL VLSI team.
  • Low bureaucracy, fast decision-making, strong engineering culture.
  • Chance to influence architecture, methodology, and silicon quality.
  • Direct access to the VP of VLSI and CEO—rare for a hardware role.
  • Hybrid office in Kraków: typically 2 days/week on-site, flexible for non-local candidates.
  • EU remote possible with occasional office visits.

Location
  • Preferred: Kraków (hybrid).
  • Possible: Anywhere in EU time zones with periodic travel to Kraków.

Hiring Process:
  • 30-minute prescreen call with an external recruiter – initial experience check and role alignment.
  • Initial phone interview (15–30 minutes) with the Site Manager in Poland.
  • 2–3 technical interviews with the VLSI team
  • HR interview with the company’s HR representative.
  • Final decision & offer.

If you’re looking for depth, ownership, and the chance to build verification for cutting-edge AI silicon — we’d love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer Go - AI platform
jobs.description:
Who we are
At Prosus, we improve everyday life for billions across the globe through cutting-edge technology. As a leading global consumer internet group and one of the world's largest technology investors, we nurture and support industry-leading businesses that empower individuals and enrich communities. Guided by our core values, Innovation, Results, People, Impact, and Entrepreneurship, we push boundaries, encourage collaboration,
and create an environment where diversity and inclusion thrive. We value curiosity, ownership, and resilience. We hire people who take initiative, embrace change, and bring fresh perspectives to everything they do.

We are proud to lead the charge in AI innovation, making significant strides in this transformative field. With operations in over 100 countries, our extensive global portfolio includes over 90 companies. We drive progress in sectors such as online classifieds, food delivery, payments & fintech, and e-commerce , consistently pushing the boundaries of technology. Our brands, like iFood, OLX, PayU, EMAG, and Takealot, are changing the way
people live and work.
Join the development team in designing and implementing innovative AI-driven tools that empower our users. Enhance our internal processes, seamlessly integrating AI capabilities into every aspect of our operations.
You will tackle sophisticated technical challenges involving multiple technology stacks, including AI and machine learning, and will play a key role in architectural design, provide initiative and technical leadership to build reliable, high-quality, high-performance solutions that scale.

This position will be based in our Amsterdam office.

About the role

  • Mentor and support your fellow teammates.
  • Deliver and review technical design, code and documentation.
  • Coordinate with stakeholders and decision-makers to test and improve services
  • Provide analytical approaches to solve various problems
  • Troubleshoot issues where needed
  • Code back-end components and integrate applications to other web services
  • Understand software requirements and translate them into products

Basic qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in computer science or similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7+ years professional software development experience
  • Provable proficiency in Go programming, common frameworks, and tools (3+ years experience)
  • AI Experience - both as a user but also working on AI/ML systems
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Attention to detail, and able to qualify the need for detail
  • Portfolio of work with examples that showcase technical skill
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Time management and organizational skills
  • Experience working with a team

Preferred qualifications

  • Experience building and maintaining event-sourced systems
  • Experience using Generative AI and Machine Learning Infrastructure to concretely impact engineering efficiency
  • Experience building and iterating on code review (GitHub), automation test infrastructure (unit, integration, E2E), build systems and deploying to AWS cloud infrastructure
  • Experience with Python programming
What we offer

Global Impact: Play a crucial role in shaping the future of global commerce. Be part of a dynamic ecosystem of tech-led companies across markets, from emerging disruptors to established platforms, all working to create positive change at scale.
Growth Opportunities: Expand your expertise through high-stakes challenges within our diverse portfolio. You'll gain access to a network of businesses, leaders, and learning opportunities that span continents and industries.
Innovative Culture: Join a forward-thinking team that values strategic insights and bold ideas. You’ll operate at the intersection of venture-building, innovation, and investment, where experimentation is encouraged and cross-company collaboration drives breakthroughs.
Creative Environment: Engage in work that encourages creativity and constant improvement. We challenge assumptions, explore new frontiers, and believe great ideas can come from anywhere in our ecosystem.
Collaborative Atmosphere: Benefit from autonomy and self-management in a supportive, outcome-driven workspace. You’ll work alongside sharp, motivated peers across our portfolio, all united by a shared ambition to move the needle.
Hybrid Work: Experience the satisfaction of our flexible model tailored to balance work and life.
Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a salary package that reflects your skills and contributions.
Comprehensive Benefits: From health and wellness to learning, commuting, and everyday perks, we offer a well rounded package designed to help you thrive at work and beyond.

Our Diversity & Inclusion Commitment
We respect the dignity and human rights of individuals and communities wherever we operate in the world. Building an inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome and can thrive is critical for us. We provide access to education, which helps everyone understand the important role they play and the positive impact they can have. For a deeper look at our journey and future plans, explore our latest Annual Report. Stay up to date with our latest news to see what makes Prosus stand out. Learn more at www.prosus.com.

jobs.title: Vice President of GenAI Engineering
jobs.description:
Meet Our Team:

Pegasystems is seeking a VP of Generative AI Engineering to define and lead our enterprise GenAI strategy and product roadmap. In this pivotal leadership role, you will drive the vision, architecture, and execution of AI-powered capabilities that transform how our clients leverage the Pega platform. You'll oversee the end-to-end development lifecycle of GenAI initiatives—from research and prototyping through production deployment—while building and leading a world-class global team of engineers and applied researchers.


As a key technical and strategic leader, you'll partner across Product Engineering, Go-To-Market, and executive stakeholders to embed cutting-edge AI capabilities (including LLM orchestration, RAG, and agentic systems) into enterprise workflows. You'll establish responsible AI governance, drive innovation in AI services, and serve as Pega's primary internal and external engineering evangelist for Generative AI.


This role requires at least 3 days in our Amsterdam office.

Picture Yourself at Pega:

This role requires a seasoned technology executive with deep expertise in AI/ML, proven success launching enterprise-scale AI products, and the ability to balance rapid innovation with enterprise-grade security, compliance, and governance requirements. You'll shape the future of AI-driven workflow automation and deliver measurable business value to global enterprise clients. You have already trialled multiple GenAI technologies in the last 2.5 years understanding the pitfalls and capabilties of different LLMs and approaches.

What You'll Do at Pega:

Strategic Leadership & Roadmap

Define and execute Pega’s Generative AI vision and multi-year technical roadmap aligned with business goals. Identify market opportunities, prioritize investments, and set KPIs and governance for responsible AI. Drive innovation in LLM orchestration, RAG, and agentic architectures.


Engineering, Architecture & Technical Execution

Lead end-to-end development from research to deployment and optimization. Ensure architectural consistency, performance, security, and compliance. Implement best practices for MLOps, model evaluation, prompt management, and observability. Manage vendor ecosystem for cost and risk balance.


Collaboration & Go-To-Market

Serve as GenAI evangelist; partner with Product, Engineering, GTM, and Customer Success to embed AI into workflows. Create reference architectures and enablement assets to accelerate adoption. Align with Legal, Security, and Compliance on responsible AI.


Talent Development

Recruit and mentor a global team across engineering and research. Foster a culture of experimentation and learning. Establish career paths, knowledge sharing, and engineering excellence.


Thought Leadership & Market Engagement

Publish insights on GenAI trends and Pegasystems’ approach. Engage with analysts, academia, and industry leaders. Represent Pegasystems at conferences and in strategic customer dialogues.

Who You Are:

  • 15+ years in software leadership, with 7+ years leading AI/ML initiatives.
  • 5+ years leading AI/ML initiatives with direct experience in Generative AI (LLMs, RAG - chunking, construction technqiues, agentic systems) and NLP. Proven track record launching and scaling AI-powered products/features at enterprise B2B scale.
  • Strong learning curiosity given the fast-moving nature of GenAI. Sees that Pega Blueprint is a game changer.
  • Outstanding ability to drive outcomes rather than be siloed by internal teams.
  • Deep technical expertise with modern AI stacks and enterprise SaaS architectures; strong knowledge of cloud-native deployments (e.g., microservices, Kubernetes, APIs).
  • Experience leading globally distributed engineering teams (50+ members) and driving cross-functional alignment.
  • Strong command of responsible AI, data privacy, security, and model governance in regulated environments.
  • Exceptional communication, executive presence, and stakeholder management; ability to translate complex technology into clear business value.

What You've Accomplished:

Additional Preferred Qualifications

  • Advanced degree (MS or PhD) in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field. Life long learner mindset outweighs academic credentials.
  • Demonstrated experience building research-oriented engineering teams and academic/industry partnerships.
  • Experience establishing MLOps practices, model evaluation frameworks, and AI observability at scale.
  • Familiarity with the AI vendor ecosystem and strategic build/buy/partner decision-making.
  • History of thought leadership (publications, patents, conference speaking) in AI/ML or GenAI.
  • Experience with Pega software.

Pega Offers You:

Pega is THE enterprise AI decisioning and workflow automation platform. Our Agentic orchestration unlocks business transforming outcomes for the World's largest companies. Our mantra of Build for Change® demonstrates our commitment towards continuous improvement, curiosity, and accountable execution. We are at a pivotal moment in our 40+ year history where our employees are empowered to “fuel the change” making their impact count as we excel beyond our Rule of 40 performance. Pega’s culture and values underpin how we work and the results and outcomes we achieve for our employees, clients, partners and investors.


  • Gartner Analyst acclaimed technology leadership across our categories of products
  • Continuous learning and development opportunities
  • An innovative, inclusive, agile, flexible, and fun work environment
  • Competitive global benefits program inclusive of pay + bonus incentive, employee equity in the company


#LI-AR1


AI in Action – Pega embraces the power of artificial intelligence. We encourage all employees to actively engage with AI technologies and continually explore ways to responsibly integrate AI into our products and processes. We may support parts of our recruitment process with automatic processing and, if required by law, you may in such cases have the right to request human intervention, challenge the outcome of such processing and comment on it.

Culture – At Pegasystems, we foster an environment where people feel valued and empowered to contribute their best. With global clients across industries and regions, we know our success depends on the unique perspectives, experiences, and talents of our people. Ours is a workplace where everyone can grow, collaborate, and deliver meaningful outcomes.

We encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences and focus on the core competencies and mindset needed to thrive in a role.

As an Equal Opportunity employer, Pegasystems will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran or disability status, or any other category protected by law.

Export Compliance – For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations such as this, Pegasystems may need to obtain export license approval from the U.S. Government and EU Authorities for certain individuals.

Accommodations – If you require reasonable accommodations under the Americans with Disabilities Act (US only) or comparable regional regulations in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please contact us here or contact (US only) 1-888-PEGA-NOW and/or 225 Wyman Street Waltham, MA 02451 ATTN: Benefits.
jobs.companyDescription: Pega develops software applications for customer engagement and operational excellence.

jobs.title: Network Systems Engineer (Pre-Sales) - Cloud Networking
jobs.description:
Who You'll Work With

We are experiencing tremendous growth and have an immediate need for a self-motivated Pre-Sales Network Systems Engineer to provide pre-sales technical support for our customers and prospects in The Netherlands.

The Systems Engineer is a critical component of the Arista Sales team. The main responsibility of the Systems Engineer is acting as a trusted advisor to our customers and prospects to identify opportunities, gather requirements and design creative solutions.

What You'll Gain:

  • Deep technical, dynamic, startup-like environment
  • Be part of a small, highly motivated team and make a big impact with customers and within the company
  • Deep technical collaboration with technical colleagues in EMEA and worldwide
  • Continuous on-the-job learning through direct contact with engineering & development teams
  • Gaining in-depth hands-on experience with CLI, automation, scripting and tooling
  • Netops / Devops way of working
  • Flexible work environment (home office / flex office)
  • Significant responsibility and extensive decision power
  • Having Fun!

What You'll Do

  • You will proactively partner with Arista Account Managers to understand and solve customer challenges and conduct (white board) network architectural sessions and Arista product presentations
  • You will architect, design and propose Arista Data Center, Routing & Campus network and security solutions to help generate new or additional sales
  • You will perform hands-on customer proof-of-concepts and (initial) network deployments using state of the art products and features
  • You will create design guidelines and recommend improvements to customers for the networks they support
  • Leading technical responses to RFP/RFQs
  • Leading customer feature requests from customer requirements to implementation to deployment
  • Provide (customer) feedback to Product Management and Development
  • Represent Arista at industry events and conferences
  • Keep up-to-date on competitive solutions, products and services
  • Author white papers, blogs and articles on technology and products

#LI-ES1

Qualifications

  • Highly-motivated, passionate, technical, proactive and flexible team player with the willingness to step out of your comfort zone
  • Fluency in both Dutch and English.
  • Sales attitude: Ability and passion to proactively work as a team to drive new business
  • Technical degree required
  • Networking design and implementation experience
  • Practical experience with routing and switching, including relevant protocols
  • Recent experience in Data Center, Routing or Campus network architecture designs
  • Excellent presentation skills
  • Deep knowledge of the relevant switching and routing protocols and technologies (e.g.,Spanning Tree, OSPF, ISIS, BGP, VXLAN, EVPN, Multicast, QoS, Network Segmentation, etc)
  • Good understanding of the competitor technology landscape
  • Work experience as either a Sales Engineer, Solutions Architect, Pre-Sales
  • Systems Engineer or Network Consulting Engineer preferred
  • Practical security deployment experience is a bonus
  • Recent hands-on CLI experience highly desired
  • Experience and/or interest in learning Netops / Devops using tools such as Python and Ansible
  • Arista Cloud Engineering (ACE) Level 5 or higher Qualifications or equivalent Industry qualifications.

jobs.title: Endpoint Management Engineer
jobs.description:
• REQ-10106273
  • 16/12/2025
  • IT Engineering
  • Amsterdam, Nederland
  • €5.485,70 - €8.828,03
  • ING Bank


Are you ready to shape the future of Endpoint Management technology?
We are looking for an Endpoint Management Engineer to join our team in Amsterdam and contribute to the design, development and improvement of endpoint management services.

As Endpoint Management Engineer, you will contribute to the strategic product vision and backlog for endpoint management across our global organization. You’ll work at the intersection of Windows, Windows 365 and cloud-native technologies, ensuring seamless, secure, and scalable device eperiences for our workforce.

The team

The Computing & Device Services (CDS) squad within People and Hubs/Workplace Services is responsible for the product vision and backlog for the ING Cloud Managed Workplace Services. This comprehends amongst other Windows endpoints, Windows 365 as our Virtual platform and printing services. As Endpoint Management Engineer you will be part of this global squad that is based in The Netherlands, Poland and the Philippines. The Endpoint Management Engineer forms a team with the Product Owner, the IT Chapter Lead, and of course the engineers in the team.

Roles and responsibilities
The following responsibilities are sought after in this role:

  • Maintain and improve our services as part of a cross-border squad of peers and customer journey eperts - Employee satisfaction is key to us!

  • Support our 24/7 global service by:

    • Providing 3rd line global support for ~70,000 Windows endpoints and ~3,500 Windows 365 virtual endpoints.
    • Providing 3rd line global support for Print & Scan services in 18 countries and counting.
    • Participating in the standby shifts.
  • Manage SaaS vendors and feature releases, particularly around Intune and workplace tools.
  • Contribute to Cloud-native endpoint product vision and backlog for Windows, Windows 365 Cloud PCs and Printing services.
  • Embed security by design, applying zero trust principles, compliance, and threat protection across all endpoints.
  • Collaborate with engineering, security, and workplace teams to translate business needs into product features and user stories.
  • Contribute to futureproofing the environment by automating, simplifying, and innovating systems with PowerShell and Azure DevOps.
  • Work with stakeholders at all levels to solve issues, design and implement digital solutions.
  • We are valued partners for many of the big suppliers, such as Microsoft, HP and others. You will be in frequent contact with their key staff and product groups.

How to succeed

We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest epectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.

  • At least 3 years of proven eperience in endpoint management, ideally in enterprise environments.
  • Deep familiarity with Intune, Windows 365, and cloud-native frameworks.
  • In-depth knowledge of Windows11, PowerShell and Azure DevOps.
  • Hands-on eperience with printing infrastructure and its integration in Endpoint Management setups.
  • Have eperience in highly regulated environments (e.g., financial institutions).
  • A bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Information Systems or related field - or equivalent work eperience.
  • Ability to communicate comple technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Don’t meet every single requirement?

Studies have shown that people are less like to apply jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At ING we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re ecited about this role, but your eperience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Rewards and benefits

We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. Find out more about our employment conditions.

The benefits of working with us at ING include:

  • A collaborative environment with passionate professionals.
  • A salary tailored to your qualities and eperience.
  • 25-28 vacation days depending on contract.
  • Pension scheme.
  • 8% Holiday payment and 13th month salary.
  • Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation (Practice is two days in the office).
  • Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities.
  • An informal working environment with innovative colleagues.


About us
Curious about how ING empowers people and businesses to move forward? Discover what we do and what we can offer you.

Questions?
Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the ‘Apply’ button.


Your place of work
Eplore the area

Questions? Just ask
Reinier Bekker


Bij ING willen we het beste uit mensen halen. Daarom hebben we een inclusieve cultuur waarin iedereen de kans krijgt om te groeien en een verschil te maken voor onze klanten en de samenleving. Diversiteit, gelijkheid en inclusie staan bij ons altijd voorop. We behan iedereen eerlijk, ongeacht leeftijd, geslacht, genderidentiteit, culturele achtergrond, ervaring, geloof, ras, etniciteit, beperking, gezinssituatie, seksuele geaardheid, sociale afkomst of wat dan ook. Heb je hulp nodig of kunnen we iets voor je doen tijdens je sollicitatie of gesprek? Neem dan contact op met de recruiter die bij de vacature vermeld staat. We werken graag samen met jou om het proces eerlijk en toegankelijk te maken. Lees hier meer over hoe wij staan voor diversiteit, inclusie en erbij horen.

jobs.title: Cloud Network Architect
jobs.description:
Who We Are

At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.


The Role

To succeed in this role, you must be a leader who can guide a team of subject matter experts, manage complex stakeholder relationships, and serve as a primary contact for other domains. You are adept at navigating the complexities and dependencies of large-scale data center deployments under tight deadlines.

  • Agile & Results-Oriented: You have a proven ability to deliver results in a fast-paced environment, applying an agile way of working to accelerate project deliverables. You are focused on outcomes and preventing escalations.

  • Stakeholder & Vendor Management: You possess exceptional stakeholder management skills and have proven experience managing relationships with technology vendors and third-party partners.

  • Consulting & Collaboration: You have strong consulting skills, capable of advising senior stakeholders and working effectively within large, diverse teams.

  • Industry Experience: You have significant experience working within highly regulated environments, preferably in the financial sector or with clients of a similar scale and complexity.

Technical Expertise
You bring a deep and broad technical background to the team, with hands-on experience and expert knowledge across multiple vendors and platforms.

  • Core Technologies: Deep expertise in routing and switching with vendors like Cisco, including complex routing design with BGP peering and high-speed core backbones.

  • Data Center & SDN: Extensive experience in modern data center design, including working with 3rd party DC providers such as Equinix. You have proven skills in Cisco ACI, SD-WAN design, VMware NSX-T

  • Cloud & Automation: You are proficient in Azure Networking, including multi-region design, Azure ExpressRoute, and cloud networking platforms such as Alkira. You are skilled in automation using tools.

  • Zero Trust & Security: A deep understanding of Zero Trust architecture principles. You can design robust security solutions aligned with the AAB Network Security Framework and create business continuity/failover architecture scenarios.

  • Mainframe Connectivity: You possess both conceptual and practical knowledge of Mainframe environments and their specific connectivity requirements

  • Network Management & Observability: You can design solutions for Infoblox DDI (DNS, DHCP, IPAM) platforms and create comprehensive observability designs to integrate and correlate network flows for monitoring and troubleshooting


Who You Are

Your core responsibilities will include:

  • Developing and writing Target State Designs and Solution Designs that align with our current state.

  • Maintaining a comprehensive overview of the NDC for the connectivity domain while supporting subject matter consultants.

  • Reviewing and providing expert contributions to Target State and Solution Designs created by other subject matter experts.

  • Collaborating closely with the Lead Domain Architect and other Domain Architects to enhance and develop new Connectivity Services and align on strategic objectives.

  • Partnering with key stakeholders, such as Product Owners, to ensure the seamless operation of services.

You will be working in a team of architects that work under the leadership of both Kyndryl and customer. This team is responsible for delivering various relevant Target State Designs in a prescribed amount of time to the design authority.

At Kyndryl we support all major cloud platforms, so you’ll get the chance to use everything you know – and then some. You’ll also become expert at knowing when and how to call on other SMEs outside your wheelhouse. Thinking your way around pre-existing limitations will grow your creativity and flexibility. You’ll learn a lot here, and if you want to work toward certifications there are plenty of opportunities. The rewards for all this are many. You’ll get to influence, create, and deliver something from start to finish. You will have the power to delight our clients.


Your future at Kyndryl
This role opens the door to many career paths, both vertical and horizontal, and there may be opportunity to travel. It’s a great chance for database administrators or other techs to break into the cloud. It’s also a solid path to become enterprise or chief architect or a distinguished engineer! Whatever you see for yourself, you’ll find the opportunity here.


Being You

Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.


What You Can Expect

With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.

Get Referred!

If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

jobs.title: Graduate Program 2026
jobs.description:
Winthrop Technologies is a dedicated data centre delivery partner providing turnkey solutions to our clients, headquartered in Dublin and delivering throughout Europe.

Winthrop specialises in providing turnkey data centre solutions, providing services from design, through to construction across the full range of civil, structural, architectural, mechanical and electrical services as well as commissioning. As an engineering-focused organisation.

Winthrop has grown to become one of the leading and most trusted companies in our sector. We are currently constructing multiple turnkey data centre projects in 7 different European countries, equating to over 430MW of IT load in flight.

Winthrop Graduate Programme:

Building on the success of our comprehensive Graduate Programme introduced in 2022, we offer an opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects across Ireland and Europe. This enables graduates to gain valuable technical experience during a crucial stage in their careers. Our programme is uniquely designed to develop skilled professionals with a deep understanding of all phases of large-scale construction projects, providing graduates with exposure to the complete construction process.


Graduate positions are available in the following areas:

  • BIM Engineers (Head office based role in Dublin)
  • Civils, Structural and Architectural Engineering
  • Electrical Engineering
  • Mechanical Engineering
  • Health and Safety
  • Quantity Surveyors
  • Construction Management
  • Finance (Head office based role in Dublin)

Your learning journey will span the entire lifecycle of a data centre project, from initial design and building shell construction through to internal fit-out, commissioning, and final handover. You will gain hands-on experience in both Construction and Project Management activities, covering the Civil, Structural, Mechanical, and Electrical aspects of the build. Additionally, you will learn about the key roles played by teams across Commercial, Construction Management, Engineering, BIM, Quality, and Health & Safety disciplines.

Requirements

  • Minimum Level 8 degree in a relevant discipline is required
  • Good communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal and organisational skills
  • Work effectively cross-functionally with different teams
  • Ability to work collaboratively to bring together ideas, information, use cases, and industry analyses to understand and enhance best practices
  • A hands-on approach to ownership and successful delivery of any tasks undertaken

Benefits

  • Opportunity to work with a Market Leader in the Data centre Industry
  • Supportive career development
  • Competitive salary package
  • Collaborative team environment
  • Pipeline of project growth

Winthrop Technologies is an equal opportunities employer

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer (AWS focused)
jobs.description:
About us

At Incision (www.incision.care), our mission is to revolutionize surgical training and ensure that every patient receives the best possible care. We collaborate with surgical professionals and teams worldwide, sharing expertise through our award-winning e-learning platform, featuring 2D & 3D modules, augmented reality, and virtual reality applications.

Our Core Values

Impact & Excellence: we strive for innovation and excellence in surgical education

Learn, Grow, and Share: knowledge should be shared, and we help each other thrive

Teamwork Unleashed: we support, challenge, and celebrate each other’s success.

About the Role
As a Senior Backend Engineer (AWS-focused) at Incision, you will design, scale, and operate secure, reliable, and cost-efficient backend systems with a strong emphasis on AWS architecture and cloud-native best practices. You’ll work with Node.js and TypeScript, using Nest.js, AWS CDK, and core AWS services to build and evolve our serverless platform.You’ll collaborate closely with Product Owners, Data Engineer, and Frontend teams to deliver features end-to-end, while also acting as a technical authority on AWS design decisions, trade-offs, and operational excellence. You’ll play a key role in strengthening our cloud foundations, improving reliability, scalability, and cost control across environments.This is a great role for someone who enjoys owning AWS architecture, mentoring others, and building systems where security, performance, and trust truly matter.

Your role

  • Architect, build, and operate backend services on AWS serverless using TypeScript, Node.js, Nest.js, and AWS CDK

  • Take ownership of AWS architecture decisions, including service selection, scaling strategies, and cost optimization

  • Own features end-to-end: requirements, design docs, implementation, testing, observability, cost posture, and on-call readiness

  • Design resilient systems using AWS-native patterns (event-driven, async processing, retries, idempotency)

  • Work with DocumentDB (primary) and DynamoDB/Aurora, making informed data modeling and performance trade-offs

  • Design and document clear APIs with OpenAPI, ensuring scalability, security, and maintainability

  • Strengthen observability across services using CloudWatch, logs, metrics, and tracing

  • Ensure privacy, security, and compliance in handling healthcare data

  • Collaborate closely with Product, Data, Frontend, and QA teams to deliver high-quality outcomes

  • Mentor and support other engineers, raising AWS, backend, and operational standards across the team


What You Bring

  • 7+ years of backend engineering experience, with strong hands-on AWS expertise in production environments

  • Deep understanding of AWS core services, such as Lambda, API Gateway, S3, CloudWatch, Step Functions, EventBridge, IAM, and networking fundamentals

  • Proven experience designing and operating serverless or cloud-native architectures at scale

  • Strong background with Infrastructure as Code (AWS CDK strongly preferred, Terraform acceptable)

  • Solid experience with Node.js, TypeScript, and Nest.js in production systems

  • Database expertise: DocumentDB (or MongoDB), plus DynamoDB or Aurora

  • Experience improving system reliability, performance, and scalability through effective debugging, execution optimization, and memory management

  • Strong observability, security, and CI/CD practices in AWS-based systems

  • Track record of mentoring engineers and influencing technical direction

  • Excellent communication skills, able to explain complex AWS concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

Great To Bring Along

  • AWS certifications (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect – Associate or Professional)

  • DevOps or platform experience (CI/CD pipelines, deployment strategies, environment management)

  • Experience with cost optimization and FinOps practices in AWS

  • Event-driven architectures (outbox pattern, idempotency, async messaging)

  • Exposure to AI/LLM integrations and AWS-based AI services

  • Frontend experience, especially Angular

  • Background in healthcare, finance, or other regulated environments

What We Offer:

Make a Real Impact: help revolutionize surgical education worldwide!

Cool & Modern Office: work in a stylish, pet-friendly space in Amsterdam.

International Team: join a diverse crew with 10+ nationalities.

Learning & Development: access training, courses, and growth opportunities.

Thursday Borrel: unwind with your team at our weekly get-together!

Hybrid Work Model: flexibility to work remotely and from our Amsterdam HQ.

Career Growth: expand your skills in a fast-paced, innovative environment.

Top-Notch Equipment: choose between Apple or Microsoft laptop, plus office monitor & tools.

Inspiring Team: collaborate with medical professionals and cutting-edge innovators.

Flexible Work Options: 2 days a week.

Free Lunches & Snacks: enjoy delicious meals and treats at the office!

Team & Social Events: regular gatherings to connect, learn, and have fun.

Competitive Salary: get rewarded for your skills and expertise.

Travel Allowance: support for commuting costs.

Pension Plan: secure your future with our retirement benefits.

Mental Health Support: access well-being resources through OpenUp.

Casual Scale-Up Environment: work in a dynamic, fun, and inspiring atmosphere!

Diverse & Inclusive Workplace: be part of an open-minded, supportive culture where everyone is valued.

jobs.title: Phd Position Design and Simulation of Patient-Specific Implants Based on External Morphology
jobs.description:
Phd Position Design and Simulation of Patient-Specific Implants Based on External Morphology

Design the next generation of biodegradable, additively manufactured bone substitutes. Combine materials, mechanics, and machine learning to shape patient-specific regenerative implants


Job description

The Department of Biomechanical Engineering at TU Delft invites applications for a PhD position aimed at transforming the design of patient-specific orthopedic implants. With a strong foundation in biomechanics, computational modeling, and experimental methods, the BME department provides an ideal environment for developing next-generation regenerative technologies. This project leverages that expertise to create personalized shoulder implants that respond intelligently to individual anatomical and functional demands.


The project will focus on the personalized design of shoulder implants, with particular emphasis on optimizing the external morphology to improve fit, reduce soft tissue irritation, and promote long-term functional outcomes. You will develop a hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) simulation framework that integrates anatomical models and biomechanical data to evaluate implant-tissue interactions. This data-driven platform will enable the design of implants tailored to individual anatomical and loading conditions.


By combining computational modeling with experimental validation, you will explore how implant geometry affects mechanical performance, implant-bone interface adaptation, and osseointegration. The resulting shape-optimized implants will complement structural architectures developed in parallel PhD projects, forming part of a larger, patient-specific bone replacement solution.


This position is embedded in a Marie Skłodowska-Curie Doctoral Network (Horizon Europe), offering advanced training, research mobility, and international secondments. You will join a vibrant network of early-stage researchers and contribute to a new generation of smart, responsive, and clinically effective orthopedic implants.


Job requirements

Your Key Responsibilities:

  • Investigate the role of design parameters, architecture, material composition, and AM process settings on mechanical performance and degradation behavior.
  • Develop physics-based and data-driven models to link geometry, materials, and biodegradation kinetics.
  • Conduct experimental tests to validate models.
  • Collaborate closely with researchers at PME and BME, as well as with the wider MSCA network.
  • Interface designs with biodegradability tests and topology-optimized structures from sibling projects.

Your Profile:

We are looking for a highly motivated candidate with:

  • A Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science, Biomedical Engineering, Applied Physics, or a related field.
  • Knowledge of additive manufacturing, biomaterials, or mechanical testing.
  • Strong background in computational mechanics, particularly in finite element modeling, and machine learning (experience in more than one is a plus).
  • Experience with programming (e.g., Python, Julia).
  • Interest in biomechanics, biodegradable materials, and design for AM.
  • Good communication skills and the ability to work in a multidisciplinary team.
  • Willingness to relocate and undertake international secondments.
  • Compliance with MSCA mobility rule: you must not have lived or carried out your main activity (work, studies) in the Netherlands for more than 12 months in the past 36 months.

What we offer:


  • A fully funded PhD position within a prestigious MSCA Doctoral Network.
  • Close supervision and mentorship from BME department at TU Delft.
  • Access to state-of-the-art additive manufacturing and experimental characterization facilities.
  • Training through network-wide workshops, summer schools, and transferable-skills programmes.
  • Research secondments with international academic and industrial partners.
  • Collaboration with a cohort of Doctoral Candidates working toward an integrated, patient-specific implant design pipeline.

TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)

Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.


At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.


Challenge. Change. Impact!


Faculty Mechanical Engineering

From chip to ship. From machine to human being. From idea to solution. Driven by a deep-rooted desire to understand our environment and discover its underlying mechanisms, research and education at the ME faculty focusses on fundamental understanding, design, production including application and product improvement, materials, processes and (mechanical) systems.


ME is a dynamic and innovative faculty with high-tech lab facilities and international reach. It’s a large faculty but also versatile, so we can often make unique connections by combining different disciplines. This is reflected in ME’s outstanding, state-of-the-art education, which trains students to become responsible and socially engaged engineers and scientists. We translate our knowledge and insights into solutions to societal issues, contributing to a sustainable society and to the development of prosperity and well-being. That is what unites us in pioneering research, inspiring education and (inter)national cooperation.


. Do you want to experience working at our faculty? These videos will introduce you to some of our researchers and their work.


Conditions of employment

Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.


Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, increasing from €3059 - €3881 gross per month, from the first year to the fourth year based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.

As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills.

The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.


Will you need to relocate to the Netherlands for this job? TU Delft is committed to make your move as smooth as possible! The HR unit, Coming to Delft Service, offers information on their website to help you prepare your relocation. In addition, Coming to Delft Service organises events to help you settle in the Netherlands, and expand your (social) network in Delft. A Dual Career Programme is available, to support your accompanying partner with their job search in the Netherlands.


Additional information

For more information about this vacancy, please contact Dr. Mohammad J Mirzaali (m.j.mirzaali@tudelft.nl) and Prof. Amir A. Zadpoor (a.a.zadpor@tudelft.nl).


Application procedure

Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than 29 January 2026 upload the following documents:

  • Your cover letter
  • CV
  • Transcripts
  • 2 recommendation letters

Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.

Please note:

  • You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
  • As part of knowledge security, TU Delft conducts a risk assessment during the recruitment of personnel. We do this, among other things, to prevent the unwanted transfer of sensitive knowledge and technology. The assessment is based on information provided by the candidates themselves, such as their motivation letter and CV, and takes place at the final stages of the selection process. When the outcome of the assessment is negative, the candidate will be informed. The processing of personal data in the context of the risk assessment is carried out on the legal basis of the GDPR: performing a public task in the public interest. You can find more information about this assessment on our website about knowledge security.
  • Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.

Faculty/Department: Faculty of Mechanical Engineering
Salary range: €3059 - €3881
Hours per week: 36-40
FTE: 0,9-1,0
Submission is possible until: 29 Jan 2026

jobs.title: Tech Lead Cloud Services
jobs.description:
This is what we offer you

  • Salary: Gross monthly salary between EUR 5,381 and EUR 7,687 (scale 10).
  • Extras: a thirteenth month, 8% holiday allowance, and a 10% Employee Benefit Budget.
  • Development budget: EUR 1,400 development budget per year for your growth and development.
  • Hybrid working: a balance between home and office work (possible for most roles).
  • Pension: decide for yourself the amount of your personal contribution.

Or view all our benefits.

Empowering engineers to deliver secure, scalable, and innovative cloud solutions that drive Rabobank’s digital transformation.

You & Your role

As Senior Tech Lead Cloud Services, you will play a pivotal role in shaping Rabobank’s multi-cloud engineering landscape. You will lead high-performing teams, nurture talent, and ensure robust, secure IT delivery. By connecting people and ideas, you drive meaningful change and help engineers deliver business value through integrated, high-quality IT services. At Tech4Engineering, your leadership will empower over 8,000 engineers worldwide, fostering a culture of proactiveness, ownership, and continuous improvement.

Practical Examples

  • Transform existing tools into scalable, user-friendly services that enable engineers to deliver value from day one.
  • Guide teams through the adoption of Managed Standardized Services (MSS) and the Nexa Service Store process.
  • Advance DevOps and Simplify at Scale (S@S) maturity, embedding continuous improvement and engineering excellence.

Facts & Figures

  • 40 hours per week
  • Lead and develop squads (~35 engineers), fostering a strong engineering culture, craftsmanship, and continuous learning.
  • Within the organisation, you will be part the Tech Lead chapter, and the Area triangle of Cloud Services.

Top Responsibilities

  • Own and execute the multi‑cloud delivery strategy across Azure, AWS, and GCP, ensuring platform maturity, scalability, and resilience.
  • Drive operational transformation and innovation, improving delivery efficiency and ensuring 24x7 IT delivery.
  • Advance S@S/DevOps maturity and embed continuous improvement practices into daily operations.
  • Manage stakeholders, risks, and budgets, ensuring compliance with security standards and optimizing vendor performance.
  • Standardize service onboarding via the Nexa Service Store and promote adoption of Managed Standardized Services (MSS) across the organization.

Together We Achieve More Than Alone

We believe in the power of differences. By combining people’s unique perspectives, we become an even better bank. We are curious about what you add to our team of Cloud Services.

The 65 people of Cloud Services are dedicated to delivering managed, standardised, and high-quality services that enable engineers to focus on delivering business value. Collaboration is our approach; as one decisive team within Rabobank.

Work on Yourself & the World Around You

At Rabobank, your development and that of society go hand in hand. That’s why we invest in you and work together to create a better world. At Rabobank you work on yourself & the world around you at the same time. This is reflected in your own development budget, our hybrid working environment, and a good work-life balance. You can work on banking matters for our private and business clients, but also on social issues such as food and energy transitions.

Why Everyone Is Welcome at Rabobank

At Rabobank, we believe that we become stronger through people who complement each other. By embracing our differences, we bring out the best in each other. We look for this diversity in areas such as knowledge, skills, and experience, but also in gender, background, and culture. We strive for diversity and the space to be yourself in every department, whoever you are. That’s what diversity and inclusion at Rabobank is all about.

You & Your Talent

  • Academic working and thinking level, proficiency in both Dutch and English at a business level
  • At least 5 years of experience in similar roles within complex IT environments.
  • Deep technical expertise in cloud engineering, security, performance, and platform reliability.
  • Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to weigh interests and risks alongside the business, bring sharpness to discussions, and constructively challenge colleagues.
  • Strong influencing skills at the highest level, with a focus on broad stakeholder management, people development, and behavioural change.
  • Analytical and innovative thinking within defined standards, policies, and objectives, contributing to the strategic vision and IT roadmap.

Apply

To ensure that we assess all candidates equally for suitability for this position, we do not require a mandatory cover letter. Instead, we ask all candidates the same three questions to see how your profile matches the role. Please pay sufficient attention to answering these questions and explaining your answers; together with your CV, these responses form the basis for our evaluation in this round. Submitting both a CV and answers to the three questions is the minimum requirement to be considered in the selection process. A cover letter is not mandatory but may be submitted optionally.

You may draw on your work experience, volunteer work, education, private life, and so on. Use a maximum of 200 words per question and provide no more than two examples. Below are the questions:

  • How have you contributed to shaping or executing an IT strategy in a complex organization? What was your role, and what impact did your contribution have?
  • Describe a situation where your technical expertise in software development, security, or performance directly influenced a business-critical outcome. How did you balance innovation with risk and compliance?
  • Describe a situation where you took ownership of a challenge or opportunity and drove it forward with an entrepreneurial mindset. What was the outcome?

You and the job application process

  • Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Ashley Lumbantobing, IT Recruiter, ashley.lumbantobing@rabobank.nl
  • We will hold the interviews through a video call. If you are selected for an interview, Bo, our virtual assistant, will reach out to you via SMS and email to schedule the interview.
  • You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq
  • A screening is part of the process.
  • We respect your privacy.

To be considered for this position, you must be located in the Netherlands and have the legal right to work in the Netherlands. We are unable to consider candidates requiring relocation from another country.
